We run appointments consistently.

We are building a high-level CRM system to increase:

 • Show rates

 • Close rate

 • Re-engagement

 • Automation precision



This is NOT a basic funnel job.

This is a revenue automation architecture role.





Who This Is For



We are looking for someone who:

 • Thinks in systems, not campaigns

 • Understands sales pipelines deeply

 • Has built complex conditional workflows inside GoHighLevel

 • Knows tagging logic, branching logic, task automation, and reporting

 • Can design CRM structure from scratch



If you build basic funnels or simple follow-up sequences, this is not for you.





What We Need Built



We already have structure started. We need:

 • Multi-branch appointment confirmation + reminder flows

 • Post-appointment routing based on objections

 • Seasonal re-engagement campaigns with segmentation

 • Conditional tagging logic (based on replies + call outcomes)

 • Automated task assignment for office staff

 • Pipeline cleanup logic

 • Long-term nurture logic (90–180 days)

 • Clean internal notes + documentation



Everything must be scalable and structured.







Required Experience



You MUST have:

 • 2+ years hands-on GoHighLevel experience

 • Built advanced workflows using:

 • Conditional logic

 • Multiple triggers

 • If/Else branching

 • Opportunity stage triggers

 • Dynamic custom fields

 • Experience integrating:

 • SMS +
 automation

 • Call tracking

 • Appointment triggers

 • Ability to design CRM logic before building it



Bonus:

 • Experience with home service / construction businesses

 • Experience increasing show rate and close rate







What We Don’t Want

 • “I know funnels”

 • “I can build landing pages”

 • “I took a GHL course”

 • Basic VA skill level

 • People who disappear after hearing complexity







Application Instructions 



If you apply, include:

 1. A Loom video (max 5 minutes) showing:

 • A complex workflow you built

 • How you structure tagging

 • How you prevent automation conflicts

 2. Screenshot of:

 • A workflow with at least 10+ steps

 • Conditional branches visible

 

If you do not include these, we will not respond.







Compensation



Open to:

 • Fixed project rate

 • Hourly for system build

 • Ongoing retainer (if execution is strong)



We are looking for a long-term partner, not a freelancer.







Final Note



We are serious operators building real infrastructure.



If you are advanced in GoHighLevel automation architecture, apply.



If you are not, please do not waste your time or ours.

title: Social + Influencer Lead (Creative Strategy + Content + Trends + Data)
description:
What this role exists to do



Own social and influencer execution end to end. Build bespoke social campaigns for each client, create platform native content fast, stay on top of trends without being cringe, and use data to continuously improve results.



This is a hands on role. You will plan, create, publish, and learn.



?



Success looks like

 • Clients feel like we “get” their audience and culture

 • Content output is consistent and high quality every week

 • Clear campaigns run regularly, not random posting

 • Strong creative testing loop with measurable learnings

 • Social and influencer work supports paid ads with ready to run creative variants

 • Reporting is simple, accurate, and useful



?



Key responsibilities



Strategy and campaigns

 • Build tailored social strategy per client (pillars, formats, cadence, tone)

 • Create campaign concepts for launches, promos, seasonal moments, always on series

 • Translate trends into brand safe executions that fit the client



Content creation and publishing

 • Create content in Canva (tiles, carousels, stories, simple motion)

 • Light video editing for Reels and TikTok (CapCut, Premiere Rush, similar)

 • Write captions and hooks that actually stop scroll

 • Schedule and publish content across IG, TikTok, FB, LinkedIn (as relevant)

 • Maintain a clean content calendar and asset library



Influencer and creator management

 • Source creators aligned to brand and audience

 • Brief creators properly (angles, do and don’t, deliverables, deadlines)

 • Track outreach, bookings, content delivery, approvals, usage rights

 • Build and maintain an influencer tracker and performance summary



Data, reporting, optimisation

 • Track weekly performance (reach, watch time, retention, saves, shares, CTR, follower growth)

 • Run a simple test plan (hooks, formats, topics, editing styles, CTAs)

 • Deliver a weekly update with what worked, what didn’t, and what we do next

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Executive Assistant & Business Operations Manager

Remote (Offshore) | Part Time/Full Time



The Role



I run 3 businesses in Australia and I need someone who can actually run me. Not someone who waits to be told what to do. Someone who sees what needs to happen and makes it happen.



This isn't a typical EA role. I need a bulldog. Someone who'll chase me for answers, hold me accountable, and isn't afraid to tell me when I'm dropping the ball. If you're looking for a cruisy admin job, this isn't it.



---



What You'll Be Doing



**Calendar & Meetings** (We use a lot of different tools, to make this easy for you!)

- Manage my weekly calendar across all three businesses

- Prep me for every meeting. Agendas, context, what I need to know

- Make sure I turn up ready and leave with clear next steps



**Inbox & Comms**

- Manage
, DMs, the lot

- Keep key people lists current (clients, partners, team, personal)

- Draft replies, filter the noise, flag what matters

- Nothing falls through the cracks on your watch



**Systems & Execution**

- Turn my goals into actual execution plans

- Build and run task systems that work

- Weekly resets. Review what's done, plan what's next

- Create order out of chaos



**Delegation & Accountability**

- Chase updates without me asking

- Assign tasks, set deadlines, get confirmations

- Follow through until it's actually done

- Hold people accountable, including me



**Business Ops Support**

- Track invoices, chase overdue payments

- Check in with Karl (Sales) on leads and pipeline

- Flag issues before they become problems

- Light ops support across the businesses



**Decision Support**

- Bring me solutions with issues, not just problems

- One page summaries so I can decide fast

- Do the research, give me options, then execute



**Confidentiality**

- Handle sensitive business and personal info with total discretion

- Need to know policy across teams

- You're the gatekeeper



---

What I'm Looking For



**Experience:**

- 5+ years as an EA, Chief of Staff, or Ops Manager (ideally supporting founders)

- You've managed complex calendars and multiple stakeholders before

- You build systems, not just follow them

- Strong written and verbal English

- Comfortable with Aussie business hours or can be flexible on timezone

- Tech savvy (Google Workspace, project management tools, CRMs)



**Personality:**

- Proactive as hell. You anticipate what's needed before I ask

- Organised to the point where it's borderline obsessive

- High ownership. If you see it, you own it

- Thick skinned. You can handle direct feedback and pressure

- Assertive. You're not afraid to push back when needed

- Discreet. You can be trusted with anything

- You bring solutions, not excuses



**Bonus:**

- Experience with Australian companies

- Startup or fast paced environment background

- Managed remote teams or contractors

- Know your way around basic business ops, finance, or sales



---



What You Get



- Competitive remuneration

- Direct access to me and real impact across three businesses

- High autonomy. I trust you to run with it

- Shape the systems from scratch

- Long term opportunity as we scale (potential ownership in businesses etc)



---



Apply



Send your CV and a short note (200 words max):

1. Why are you the right person for this?

2. Tell me about a time you held someone senior accountable or pushed back on a decision.



*Remote role, open globally. Preference for those who've worked with Australian or US companies and can handle timezone flexibility.*

title: MSP Technician – Level 2/3 (US Hours, Full-Time)
description:
MSP Technician – Level 2/3 | Full-Time | US Business Hours

Courant is a growing Managed Service Provider (MSP) based in New Orleans, Louisiana, USA. We provide IT management, cybersecurity, and cloud services to small and mid-sized businesses across multiple states. We are looking for an experienced MSP Technician to join our service desk team as a full-time, long-term tea
mber.

This is not a virtual assistant role. This is a technical position where you will handle escalated support issues and work directly in our systems (ConnectWise PSA, RMM, Microsoft 365 admin portals) alongside our US-based team. Depending on your experience level, you will be placed as a Level 2 or Level 3 technician, with compensation to match.



SCHEDULE

Full-time, 40 hours per week.

You will work US Central Time business hours: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM CST (Monday–Friday).

This is 10:00 PM – 7:00 AM Philippine Time (night shift).

No on-call or weekend work is required at this time, but could be negotiated in the future.



WHAT YOU WILL DO

All technicians at this level will:



- Handle escalated technical issues that Level 1 support cannot resolve

- Administer and support Microsoft 365 environments including Exchange Online, Entra ID, conditional access policies, and license management

- Troubleshoot networking issues including firewall configuration, VPN connectivity, switch management, and DNS/DHCP

- Perform server administration tasks including Active Directory, Group Policy, file share permissions, and print services

- Troubleshoot and manage endpoint security including antivirus/EDR, patch deployment, and vulnerability remediation

- Support backup and disaster recovery systems including monitoring, testing, and restoration

- Monitor client environments via RMM tools and respond to alerts

- Execute project tasks under our Project Manager including migrations, hardware refreshes, and rollouts

- Create and maintain technical documentation including network diagrams, SOPs, and configuration records

- Communicate directly with US-based clients — providing clear status updates and setting appropriate expectations

- Document ALL work thoroughly in PSA with accurate time entries



Level 3 technicians will additionally:



- Serve as the final escalation point for the most complex technical issues

- Design and implement client network infrastructure (firewalls, switches, wireless, site-to-site connectivity)

- Perform advanced Microsoft 365 and Azure administration including Intune/Endpoint Manager, compliance policies, and tenant-to-tenant migrations

- Lead complex project execution (client onboarding, cloud migrations, infrastructure upgrades)

- Define and maintain technical standards, SOPs, and best practices for the service team

- Mentor and train junior technicians

- Serve as a trusted technical advisor to key client accounts

- Participate in pre-sales technical assessments for prospective clients

- Help manage security frameworks across client environments (EDR,
 security, backup verification, vulnerability management)





WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

For Level 2 ($1,000 – $1,400/month):



- 2–4 years of hands-on IT support or systems administration experience

- MSP experience preferred — understanding of multi-tenant environments, SLAs, and billable time tracking

- Working knowledge of Microsoft 365 administration (Exchange Online, Entra ID, conditional access)

- Solid networking fundamentals (firewalls, VLANs, VPN, DNS, DHCP)

- Windows Server administration (Active Directory, Group Policy)

- Experience with backup and disaster recovery solutions

- Experience with RMM and PSA tools (ConnectWise is a strong plus)

- CompTIA A+ required; Network+ preferred or willingness to obtain

- Microsoft 365 administrator-level certification preferred



For Level 3 ($1,400 – $2,000/month):



- 4+ years of progressive IT support, systems administration, or infrastructure engineering experience

- MSP experience strongly preferred

- Strong expertise in Microsoft 365 and Azure administration (Entra ID, Intune, Exchange Online, conditional access, compliance)

- Advanced networking skills (firewall management, routing, VLANs, VPN, wireless design)

- Windows Server administration (Active Directory, Group Policy, DNS, DHCP, certificate services)

- Experience designing and implementing infrastructure solutions

- Experience with RMM and PSA tools (ConnectWise is a strong plus)

- CompTIA A+ and Network+ required

- Microsoft 365 Certified: Administrator Expert or equivalent required

- CompTIA Security+ and Azure certifications (AZ-104, AZ-500) are a strong plus



Both levels require:



- Excellent written and spoken English — you will communicate directly with US-based clients

- Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

- Strong documentation habits

- A methodical, root-cause-oriented troubleshooting approach



WHAT WE OFFER



- Full-time, long-term employment (this is not a project or contract role)

- $1,000 – $2,000 USD/month based on experience and level placement (paid monthly via direct transfer)

- A professional, respectful work environment — we treat our remote team as full members of the company, not outsourced labor

- Stable, growing company with an established client base

- Opportunity to work with modern Microsoft cloud technologies





HOW TO APPLY

Please DO NOT send a generic application. We will not consider copy-paste cover letters.

To apply, please respond through OnlineJobs.ph with ALL of the following:



- Your updated resume/CV

- A SHORT VIDEO (3–5 minutes max) where you speak directly to the camera and cover the following three topics:

-- a. Your MSP experience — how many years, what tools you used (PSA, RMM, M365 admin), and the size of the client base you supported

-- b. Your experience with Microsoft 365 administration — specifically Entra ID, Intune, Exchange Online, and conditional access policies

-- c. Your experience with networking — specifically what firewall brands you have worked with, and your comfort level with VLANs, VPN, and wireless

- Upload your video to YouTube (unlisted), Google Drive (shared link), or Loom and include the link in your application.

- Your current certifications (CompTIA, Microsoft, or other)

- Confirm that you can work the required schedule: 10:00 PM – 7:00 AM Philippine Time, Monday through Friday

- Your expected monthly salary in USD and which level (2 or 3) you believe you qualify for

- In your application, include the phrase "midnight tech" so we know you read the full posting



Applications that do not include ALL of the above will not be reviewed.



ABOUT COURANT

Courant is a Managed Service Provider headquartered in New Orleans, Louisiana. We provide IT management, cybersecurity, cloud services, and strategic technology consulting to small and mid-sized businesses. Our team is small, professional, and focused on delivering high-quality service. We value competence, reliability, and clear communication above all else.

Learn more:

title: Social Media Marketing & Content Creator
description:
Part-Time Social Media Marketer for Houston Personal Injury Law Firm



About Us

We are a boutique personal injury law firm in Houston, Texas, specializing in auto a
 cases and slip and falls (2 areas). Our firm consists of one dedicated attorney supported by a small, focused team of 1 paralegal and 1 legal assistant. We're looking to expand our online presence and connect with potential clients through strategic social media marketing.



What you need to know

I have basically very little online presence. A few 5-star google reviews on google business. I advertise on
/ Instagram for car wreck cases and slip and fall cases.



Position Overview

We are seeking a part-time Social Media Marketing Specialist with experience growing small professional service businesses, particularly law firms. The ideal candidate will develop and implement a comprehensive social media strategy across
, Instagram,
/X, and eventually TikTok to increase our visibility, establish our brand as a trusted resource for personal injury victims, and generate qualified leads.

Responsibilities

•	Develop a content calendar and create engaging, professional content tailored to personal injury law and our target audience

•	Manage and grow our presence across multiple platforms 
, Instagram,
/X, and later TikTok)

•	Create visually appealing graphics and short-form videos that communicate our services and value proposition

•	Research and utilize relevant hashtags and trends in the legal industry

•	Monitor social media analytics and adjust strategies based on performance

•	Engage with followers, respond to comments, and manage direct messages

•	Stay informed about personal injury law topics to ensure accurate content

•	Collaborate with the attorney to highlight case successes (while maintaining client confidentiality)

•	Identify opportunities for community engagement and local networking

•	Implement a process for gathering reviews

..	Optimize $250/month
 ad budget for maximum reach and engagement



Requirements

•	Proven experience growing a small business social media presence, preferably for a boutique law firm or professional service business

•	Strong understanding of social media platforms, particularly
, Instagram, and
/X

•	Experience with content creation tools (Canva, Adobe Creative Suite, or similar). I have a Canva account you could use.

•	Excellent written communication skills with English grammar and spelling

•	Basic understanding of legal ethics regarding attorney marketing

•	Ability to create professional, empathetic content appropriate for personal injury victims without attorney being on camera. This may change later. 

•	Content should create “emotion” (for example a quick content piece could be someone saying “Imagine being gifted a home…or enough to put a sizeable down payment on one. If you’ve been injured in a slip and fall/ a
 then your case may be worth more than you know. If you never call, you’ll never know. I’d like to help. Call The __________ Firm, 281-XXX-XXXX

•	Must engage with clients as if you are the attorney (I will give you a list of standard responses and ask that you respond within 4 hours of someone leaving a comment).

•	Experience with social media analytics and reporting

•	Self-motivated with the ability to work independently

•	Familiarity with U.S. culture and communication styles

•	Should create a plan for growth and be willing to discuss your plan with attorney. Plan should include growth rate.

Hours and Compensation

•	15-20 hours per week (flexible). These hours will increase with time.

•	Competitive hourly rate based on experience

•	Long-term opportunity with potential for growth

Application Process

Please submit your application with:

1.	Resume/CV highlighting relevant social media marketing experience

2.	Portfolio or examples of social media accounts you've managed (especially for professional services)

3.	Brief proposal (1 page max) outlining your initial social media strategy for a personal injury law firm and your payment requirements (please specify currency).



Please have examples of your experience/ prior jobs.



We look forward to finding a talented marketing professional to join our team and help grow our online presence!

title: Remote Spec Book & Architectural Construction Documentation Drafter
description:
Job Summary:



We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly skilled Remote Spec Book & Architectural Construction Documentation Drafter with advanced Revit expertise to support the production of accurate, coordinated, and buildable construction documents. This role requires a strong understanding of construction and architectural logic, NYC building codes or USA in general, and the ability to translate approved design concepts into fully coordinated documentation ready for field execution. The ideal candidate is efficient, precise, and capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining a high level of accuracy. Strong communication skills, professional reliability, and the ability to collaborate effectively with internal teams and leadership are essential. This position requires availability during Eastern Standard Time business hours and participation in a test project following the first interview.



Key Responsibilities:



Produce accurate, coordinated construction documents in Revit based on received files and inputs.

Evaluate approved design concepts with a clear understanding of how the design will be built in the field.

Translate approved design concepts into clear, buildable, and fully coordinated construction documentation.

Model and document designs based on architectural, consultant, and client inputs.

Identify finishes, fixtures, and materials and document them accurately.

Detect missing details, inconsistencies, or coordination issues and proactively address or flag them.

Communicate changes and revisions clearly with the internal team.

Perform other tasks related to the role.

Qualifications & Requirements:



Proficient level of English (written and spoken).

Excellent interpersonal and communication abilities to collaborate effectively with teams, leadership, providers, and clients.

Advanced proficiency in Revit is required.

Demonstrated experience in 3D modeling and construction documentation.

Proven experience in construction documentation.

Ability to produce accurate, well-coordinated architectural documentation.

Working knowledge of AutoCAD.

Experience using Asana or similar project management tools.

Strong general computer skills and digital workflow proficiency (Word, Excel, Outlook) and Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets).

Strong understanding of NYC building codes and laws or USA in general. 

Experience with NYC multi-family residential code logic is highly preferred, but not required.

High accuracy and attention to detail.

Solid construction and architectural logic.

Fast and efficient workflow.

Ability to multitask across multiple projects.

Out-of-the-box thinker, reliable, and professional.

Availability to work during Eastern Standard Time (EST) business hours.

Availability to complete a test project assigned after the first interview is required.

Sound judgment and the capacity to comprehend and execute instructions promptly with minimal supervision.

, 
,

 set out in 2005 to change the way real estate is sold. And we have done just that. title: Real Estate Closing Department Manager
description:
List With Freedom, a national flat-fee MLS real estate brokerage, is seeking an experienced manager to oversee our Closing Department. This department of six (6) Closing Transaction Coordinators handle a very high volume of closing files so the work is very fast paced. If you thrive in a high-energy environment, enjoy juggling multiple files at once, like to manage people and processes - you may be a perfect fit.



What You’ll Do

---------------------

Management Tasks

- Manage (6) Closing Transaction Coordinators (CTCs) ensuring their workflow follows established processes, protocols and compliance requirements

- Monitor attendance, schedules, KPIs, customer satisfaction, etc.

- Handle escalations from the team when they reach road blocks that do not allow them to complete their closing file

- Look for ways to improve processes

- Meet with Department Director weekly (at a minimum) to discuss successes and struggles





Closing Transaction Coordinators (CTCs) Tasks

- Manage real estate transactions from contract to close

- Obtain all required compliance documents

- Coordinate communication between sellers, title companies, buyers, and buyer’s agents

- Review offers, contracts, and addenda for accuracy and compliance

- Ensure timely execution of critical dates and deliverables

- Track contingencies, title, inspections, and escrow timelines

- Maintain complete and organized digital transaction records

- Follow a clearly defined and structured workflow



Requirements

- Minimum 3 years of experience as a Transaction Coordinator in residential real estate (closings)

- Minimum 3 years managerial experience

- Fluent, clear, and professional English communication (written and verbal)

- Proven ability to handle fast-paced, high-volume workloads with precision

- Solid understanding of real estate contracts, timelines, and closing procedures

- Highly organized, self-motivated, and tech-savvy

- Experience with CRMS (a must) and ticketing platforms (a plus)

- Strong interpersonal skills and a commitment to excellent customer service=



Bonus Points For

- Experience in high-volume brokerage or flat-fee listing environments

- Familiarity with tools like Brokermint, ZohoDesk, or similar platforms



Why Join Us?

- Stable, solid career (full time, long term)

- Work with a supportive, experienced team

- Strong salary with incentive bonuses and Paid Time Off

- Enjoy remote flexibility and steady workflow

- Be part of a company that’s modernizing the home-selling experience



*********

List With Freedom set out in 2005 to change the way real estate is sold. And we have done just that. We offer homeowners a way to sell their properties by listing on the Multiple Listing Service (MLS) for a low flat fee. Our customers are able to list on their own and save thousands of dollars. ListWithFreedom will list our customers’ homes in the MLS and 3rd party websites, and expose their property to thousands of agents who have ready, willing, and able buyers.

title: Remote Travel Booking Specialist
description:
Job Summary:





We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Remote Travel Booking Specialist to manage end-to-end travel arrangements, provide competitive travel quotes, and ensure seamless coordination between clients, internal teams, and travel partners in a 24/7 support environment. The ideal candidate brings strong experience using Global Distribution Systems (GDS), with expert-level proficiency in Amadeus and familiarity with Sabre, to accurately prepare quotes, verify pricing and booking details, and confirm reservations in a timely manner. This role requires excellent English communication skills, strong organizational and follow-up abilities, and the capacity to work independently while collaborating effectively with remote teams. The successful candidate will proactively resolve booking issues or discrepancies and consistently deliver a high level of client satisfaction. A professional, self-motivated mindset and the ability to manage complex travel requests with precision and efficiency are essential for success in this role.



Key Responsibilities:



Handle travel bookings efficiently while ensuring accuracy and timely confirmations.

Coordinate with tea
mbers to maintain seamless 24-hour coverage and support.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date booking records and documentation.

Resolve booking issues and discrepancies promptly to ensure client satisfaction.

Communicate clearly and professionally with clients regarding bookings and updates.

Provide accurate travel quotes using GDS Amadeus primarily and GDS Sabre as a secondary system.

Prepare and send competitive rate options per client quote.

Perform other tasks related to the position.



Qualifications & Requirements:



Proficient level of English (written and spoken).

Strong interpersonal and communication skills and collaboration skills.

Demonstrated advanced GDS expertise, ideally with prior experience in a senior or lead role within a travel company.

Extensive professional experience using Amadeus at an expert level.

Familiarity with Global Distribution Systems (GDS), preferably Sabre.

Proven experience in travel booking and reservations.

Ability to support and coordinate 24-hour shift coverage.

Proven experience handling travel bookings and preparing quotes.

Strong organizational and follow-up skills to ensure efficient coordination.

Reliable, self-motivated, with a positive attitude and a professional approach to problem-solving.

Out-of-the-box thinker, reliable, and professional.

Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook) and Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets).

Sound judgment and the capacity to comprehend and execute instructions promptly with minimal supervision.

Reliable computer (Windows 10 or newer), two monitors, and stable high-speed internet.?

Compensation & Benefits:



100% remote work.

Compensation in USD.

Full-time position with 40 hours weekly.

Great work environment with potential for growth.

title: ITaaS Manager
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE: 

The Strategic ITAAS Consulting Manager is a pivotal leadership role responsible for overseeing the successful delivery and strategic evolution of IT-as-a-Service (ITAAS) offerings to a portfolio of key clients. This role requires a blend of technical expertise, advanced financial acumen, and exceptional consulting skills to ensure service excellence, drive continuous improvement, and act as a trusted advisor to senior executives.





RESPONSIBILITIES:

The successful candidate will focus on strategic execution and measurable outcomes, including:



-Strategic Roadmapping: Execute the organization's technology and ITAAS strategy, assessing client needs, identifying transformation opportunities, and aligning IT initiatives with overall business goals.

-Service Delivery Excellence: Define and lead opportunities to enhance IT service delivery across client engagements, implementing best practices, process improvements, and automation to increase efficiency, quality, and business value.

-Performance & Governance: Conduct recurring service ticket report reviews, perform advanced analysis of trends and KPIs, and utilize these insights to proactively manage service health and resource allocation.

-Leadership & Escalation: Serve as the final escalation point for critical service issues and case management, driving timely resolution and conducting root cause analysis of infrastructure problems to develop robust resolution and prevention plans.

-Financial Management: Manage the P&L for assigned ITAAS accounts, ensuring resource optimization, forecasting costs accurately, and providing assistance with identifying and scheduling service requests that fall outside of contracted services.

-Talent Development: Work with the recruitment team to conduct technical interviews, provide expert feedback, and mentor junior engineering and service management resources.



REQUIREMENTS:

We are looking for a leader who can deliver strategic value from day one:

-Experience: 8+ years of progressive experience in IT, with at least 5+ years in a technical leadership or ITAAS/ITSM Manager role, ideally within an IT consulting or managed service provider environment.

-Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience and certifications.

-ITSM Expertise: Strong knowledge of leading ITSM frameworks, such as ITIL (certification highly desired), COBIT, or ISO 20000.

-Tool Proficiency: Proven proficiency in implementing, customizing, and managing enterprise ITSM tools (e.g., ServiceNow, BMC Remedy, Cherwell, JIRA Service Management).

-Consulting Skills: Demonstrated excellence in analytical, problem-solving, and project management skills, including organization, planning, and prioritization of complex, multi-client engagements.

-Leadership: Proven experience in leading significant ITAAS projects and managing high-value client relationships and expectations.



Advanced Senior Skills (Highly Desired)



-Reporting and Presentation experience: Demonstrated success in building trusted advisor relationships with client stakeholders and influencing IT strategic decisions, prioritizations, and roadmaps.

-Operational budgeting & Client engagement P&L Tracking: 

-Direct experience with P&L responsibilities, budget forecasting, and leading complex vendor management or IT sourcing contract negotiations.

-Cloud Service Management: Strong architectural understanding of service management and operational best practices across major public cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP).

-Automation Focus: Expertise in leveraging advanced automation, AI, and orchestration technologies to transform service delivery models.

-Risk & Compliance: Practical experience integrating GRC (Governance, Risk, and Compliance) requirements (e.g., SOC 2, ISO, HIPAA) into service delivery processes.



Logistics & Contract Terms



-Opportunity Type: Short-term, project-based contract (specific duration to be determined per engagement).

Schedule: Must be willing to work during US Pacific timezone (8am - 5pm PT) or during client hours as required.

-Equipment: Must possess a fully functional and up-to-date computer and willing to install necessary next-generation endpoint protection provided by the company.

?????

NOTE: 

This is a remote (work from home) opportunity.



TO APPLY: ** DO NOT SEND HERE**



1. COPY & PASTE this link to your browser:





2. Fill up the form and submit your resume to our system.



We will reach out to you via
 using our system. Thank you!

title: Google Ads Specialist - 6 Month Contract
description:
Job Title: Senior Google Ads Specialist



Company: Missing Link Social Media 
/ 



Location: Remote - Philippines



Hours: Full-time 6-month contract, 38 hours per week, 7.6 hours per day (starting 9am Sydney time)



Salary: Depending on experience



Type: Contractor, not Employee



About Missing Link Social Media:

Missing Link Social Media is a leading marketing agency that helps businesses of all sizes achieve their online marketing goals. We're passionate about creating and implementing effective digital strategies that drive results.



About the Role:

We are seeking an agency-experienced and/or freelancer with minimum 5 of Google Ads experience managing multiple clients to join our team on a 6 month contract. 

In this role, you will play a key role in developing and executing Google Ads strategies for a diverse portfolio of clients (5 to 12 clients) as we continue to build out our Google Ads division. You will be responsible for managing all aspects of Google Ads campaigns, from keyword research and ad creation to performance analysis, optimisation and reporting. The role also requires strong knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager. 





Responsibilities:

• Develop and implement comprehensive Google Ads strategies aligned with client objectives.

• Propose recommended campaign structures, match types, optimisation goals etc.

• Conduct in-depth keyword/competitor research and audience targeting to maximise campaign reach and effectiveness. 

• Create compelling ad copy, to then be approved by our copywriter

• Understand each client’s businesses including their products, services, and target market to ensure keywords are relevant and attract the right kind of customer

• Setup and management of Google Analytics 4, including creating conversion events

• In-depth knowledge of Google Tag Manager, including auditing existing setups

• Basic ability to audit website / landing page performance and provide recommendations to improve SEM conversion rate, e.g. • Direct response copywriting tweaks visual asset suggestions, adding testimonials, page structure, etc

• Manage campaign budgets and bidding strategies to optimise ROI. 

• Monitor campaign performance, pace budgets, analyse key metrics, and provide regular reports to your Account Manager at Missing Link. 

• Stay up-to-date with the latest Google Ads trends and best practices.





Qualifications:

• 5+ years of proven experience managing Google Ads campaigns within an agency and/or freelance setting managing multiple clients

• Strong understanding of digital marketing principles and best practices.

• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

• Proficiency in Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager and other relevant tools.

• Strong communication and presentation skills.





Benefits:

• Flexible work schedule.

• Work closely with a collaborative, skilled, and supportive team.

• Opportunity to make a real impact on the success of the businesses we help.



How to apply:

Please submit your resume to 
 and complete this short questionnaire:

title: International Education Researcher
description:
About Us

Educational Records Evaluation Service (ERES) is a trusted evaluation agency in the United States, providing credential evaluation services for international students, professionals, and immigrants. 



Position Overview

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical International Education Researcher to join our growing team. This role is ideal for someone passionate about global education systems and experienced in comparing international academic credentials against U.S. standards.

You will play a key role in supporting our credential evaluation team by conducting in-depth research on foreign education systems, academic policies, institutional recognition, grading practices, and program structures.



Responsibilities

• Conduct thorough research on education systems, qualifications frameworks, and credential structures across various countries

• Analyze foreign academic documents and provide insight into degree equivalencies

• Develop and maintain internal country-specific education profiles and databases

• Verify institutional recognition and program accreditation

• Collaborate with evaluation staff to provide timely, well-documented guidance on complex cases

• Monitor changes in global education systems, policies, and credential types

• Participate in professional development and networking related to international education

Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s degree in Education, International Studies, Library Science, Linguistics, or a related field preferred

• Experience in international education, credential evaluation, academic research, or comparative education highly preferred

• Strong analytical and writing skills

• High attention to detail and accuracy

• Ability to work independently and manage multiple research tasks

• Familiarity with databases and education resource tools) is a plus

• Multilingual ability is a plus



Why Join Us?

• Flexible work environment

• Opportunity to contribute to educational equity and international mobility

• Work with a collaborative, mission-driven team

• Room for professional growth and contribution to policy shaping



How to Apply

Please submit your resume, a brief cover letter, and one writing sample (preferably related to education or research) via Google Drive or another accessible online platform link within the "Onlinejobs" messaging system.

We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds and experiences. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

title: Operations Assistant for Fast Paced Digital Marketing Agency
description:
About the Role



We are seeking a highly intelligent, proactive, and detail-obsessed Virtual Assistant to support our Creative Director, Pod Leaders (Project Managers), and broader agency team. This role requires excellent communication skills, exceptional organization, and a strong sense of ownership. You must be able to anticipate needs, flag issues before they become problems, and confidently move projects forward without waiting for permission.



This is a fast-paced, high-pressure environment with quick turnaround expectations. We are looking for someone who operates with integrity, takes accountability seriously, and consistently strives for excellence—someone who doesn’t mind staying a little later when needed to get the job done right.



If you are resourceful, solutions-oriented, and energized by managing multiple moving pieces at once, you will thrive here.



Key Responsibilities



Project Coordination & Workflow Management

Coordinate directly with the Creative Director and Pod Leaders to manage client deliverables.

Move tasks through each stage of the workflow (creation ? review ? revisions ? approval ? scheduling ? publishing).

Set up task cards, task details, subtasks, descriptions, and deadlines in platforms like Notion and Nifty.

Follow up with clients and internal tea
mbers to gather missing information proactively—whether from clients, tea
mbers, past documentation, or internal assets—and ensure tasks are ready for execution

Maintain clear, up-to-date task statuses for newsletters, blogs, and social media content across multiple clients.

Flag potential issues proactively and offer suggested solutions.



Content Operations

Organize, track, and manage newsletters, blog posts, and social media assets (you do not need to write or design them).

Schedule social media content through GoHighLevel (knowledge preferred but not required).

Ensure all content follows internal guidelines and is prepared for team review or client approval.



Administrative Support

Manage spreadsheets, trackers, and reporting documents with exceptional accuracy.

Follow established processes while confidently making decisions to keep projects moving.

Communicate effectively with tea
mbers and clients through written and verbal channels.

Assist with quality control in conjunction with the Quality Control Manager by ensuring deliverables are handled, organized, and finalized correctly.



Required Skills & Qualities



Professional Skills

Excellent written and spoken English (grammar, clarity, professionalism).

Strong organizational skills and ability to manage many detailed tasks simultaneously.

High-level decision-making ability and willingness to act independently when appropriate.

Ability to work efficiently under pressure and adapt quickly to shifting priorities.

Tech-savvy and able to learn new tools quickly.

Strong coordination, follow-through, and project management instincts.



Personal Qualities

Smart, intuitive, and able to think outside the box.

Extremely detail-oriented and punctual.

Honest, accountable, and trustworthy.

Strong sense of responsibility and ownership.

Solutions-focused and results-driven.

Willing and able to occasionally work beyond standard hours when deadlines require it.

Consistently motivated to do your best work.



Tools & Platforms We Use

(You do not need to know all of these, but familiarity is a plus.)

GoHighLevel

Notion

Nifty

Google Drive

Loom

Zoom

Kajabi

WordPress

Canva

Adobe Creative Suite

CapCut



Work Schedule

Monday–Friday, 9AM–5PM EST - Availability during these core hours is required for the first 6 months. After this period, schedule flexibility may be discussed based on performance and workload.



Bonus Skills (Not Required but Highly Valued)

Strong writing or editing abilities

Basic design skills (Canva or Adobe Suite)

Experience scheduling content or managing workflows in GoHighLevel

Prior agency, project coordination, or operations experience



How to Apply



Please follow all steps. Applications missing anything will not be considered.



- Start your application message with the phrase: “Details Are My Superpower”

- Attach your resume/CV (PDF preferred)

- Include a 2–3 minute intro video link recorded specifically for this application

- Introduce yourself

- Share relevant experience

- Explain why you’re a fit for this role

- Do not submit a pre-recorded or generic intro video



Answer these questions directly in your application:



1. Why are you a strong fit for this role?

2. Describe a time you proactively solved a problem.

3. Which tools from our list have you used before?

4. Can you work Monday–Friday, 9AM–5PM EST for the first 6 months?

title: Credit & Business Funding Specialist
description:
We are seeking an experienced Credit & Personal/Business Funding  Specialist with a deep understanding of consumer credit laws and advanced dispute strategies. The ideal candidate is highly skilled in Metro 2 compliance disputing, leveraging the CFPB to file and resolve complaints, and executing secondary bureau opt-outs to protect client data and improve credit outcomes.



This role requires hands-on experience navigating multiple credit monitoring systems (such as IdentityIQ, SmartCredit, MyFICO, etc.) and working within various CRMs to track, manage, and execute disputes accurately and efficiently. You must understand how to analyze credit reports across bureaus, identify violations, and apply lawful, strategic dispute methods that produce real results.



A strong working knowledge of consumer protection laws (FCRA, FDCPA, FACTA) is essential. Experience with business funding, LLC creation, and structuring business credit is a plus. Familiarity with GoHighLevel (GHL) for client management, automation, or workflows is also a plus.



This role is ideal for a detail-oriented expert who delivers compliant, results-driven credit solutions.

title: Senior Graphic Designer with Modern Skill with AI Prompting Master Skils and proven experience with Amazon
description:
ABOUT US



Since 2013, Prodigy Media has built more than brands — we've created an Amazon-native empire. With 12 years of proven success and 28+ product lines under our belt, we don't play small. Our mission? Launch culturally resonant, design-led, emotionally sticky products that dominate Amazon and beyond.



Now, we're leveling up — and we want a design assassin who’s mastered AI workflows, commands Midjourney like a wizard, and turns prompts into visual gold.



WHO WE WANT



This is not your average graphic design role. We're looking for a hybrid Creative Director / Prompt Engineer / Graphic Design savant who can:



Think like a marketer. Design like an artist. Prompt like an AI god.



You’ll own the visual storytelling for our brands, using both traditional tools and bleeding-edge AI systems to pump out Amazon-optimized assets that convert.



WHAT YOU’LL DO



Craft Ultra-High-Converting Amazon Ads – static, lifestyle, 
-tier, and scroll-stopping. Own A+ Content Design – full module execution with story arcs that build obsession. Design Labels & Packaging – pixel-perfect, regulatory-ready, and unforgettable on the shelf. Prompt, Edit & Produce AI-Generated Visuals – using tools like Midjourney, DALL•E, Runway, Spline, Veo3, Sora, and others. Run 3D Product Renders – via Blender, KeyShot, or AI-powered 3D tools. Develop Scroll-Hook Videos – using After Effects, Premiere, Runway AI, etc.



Systematize Brand Visuals Across 30+ Products – while keeping it all aligned, emotional, and conversion-focused.



WHO YOU ARE



5+ years in design, at least 2+ years in Amazon/e-commerce brand creative

Fluent in Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, Blender, After Effects

Pro-level Midjourney / AI prompt engineer – this is non-negotiable

Obsessed with Amazon visual psychology, packaging psychology, and design that sells

Able to juggle 10 brands and still hit deadlines

Operate with a Creative Director mindset — not just execution, but strategy

Bonus: Experience creating creative systems, art direction templates, or leading a team



MUST-HAVES

Portfolio with Amazon ads, A+ pages, labels, 3D renders, videos, and AI-gen examples

Real-world use of AI tools integrated into your workflow

Available Mon-Fri 5:00am–2:00pm PST

title: Hiring Experienced Cold Caller (Philippines) | B2B | Ongoing Work
description:
We are hiring an experienced cold caller based in the Philippines.



This role is focused on calling businesses in Australia and booking qualified meetings for our team.



This is not customer service.

This is outbound B2B sales calling.



What You Will Be Doing



• Calling construction companies across Australia

• Introducing our service using our provided script

• Handling basic objections confidently

• Booking meetings into our calendar

• Updating CRM notes after each call

• Sending a daily summary of calls made, conversations and bookings



You Must Have



• Strong, clear English with a neutral accent

• Confidence speaking to senior business owners

• Proven B2B cold calling experience

• Ability to follow a script but sound natural

• Stable internet connection

• Quiet workspace

• Good quality headset and laptop



Working Hours



• Australian business hours

• Part time to start

• Opportunity to increase hours

• Long term position for the right person



If you have only done customer service, appointment reminders or inbound work, this role is not for you.



******Application Requirements – Very Important*******



To be considered, you must complete the following steps:



Download the script from this link:





- Record yourself reading the script.



- Upload the recording to Voicearoo.



- Send us the Voicearoo link in your application.



We will not review any application that does not include a Voicearoo recording.

title: Customer Support Specialist
description:
ABOUT RECIME



ReciMe (
) is a recipe app revolutionizing how cooks organize, plan and shop their recipes. Our smart importing tool enables users to aggregate all their recipes in one platform within seconds - whether those recipes came from an Instagram video, recipe blog or grandma’s recipe box. 



We’ve been a Top 10 app (
) in the US App Store’s Food category for months and were recently featured on The Drew Barrymore Show (
).



---



Now, we’re looking for one Customer Support Specialists to join our small team!



ABOUT THE ROLE



As a Virtual Assistant in our Customer Success team, you’ll be at the heart of ensuring our customers feel supported every step of the way. From managing our
 inbox to engaging with our online communities, you’ll help customers find solutions, answer questions, and create positive interactions. You’ll be the go-to person for handling inquiries with professionalism, efficiency, and care. 



The role will be full-time and fully remote.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



- Oversee and organize our
 and messages inbox, ensuring timely and professional responses.

- Engage with and manage our online communities, fostering positive relationships.

- Continually update our Help Center articles to help customers self-service new issues.

- Collaborate with our team to streamline customer success processes.

- Summarize and relay user feedback and new bugs to the Product team.

- Represent our brand with clarity, empathy, and excellence.



REQUIREMENTS



- Flawless English proficiency (both written and spoken).

- Exceptional written communication skills with attention to detail.

- A fast learner who’s comfortable adapting to new tools and systems.

- Availability during US time zones to align with our customers.

- Prior experience in customer support, ideally using tools like Intercom.



WHAT ARE THE BENEFITS



- 15 days paid time off annually, plus extra paid day off on your birthday

- Be part of one of the fastest growing consumer subscription apps

- Work directly with the founders and a small, hungry team solving a real-world problem

- A product with real retention, real revenue, and real impact

- Opportunities to travel for team off sites!



INTERVIEW PROCESS



We’ve outlined our process below - we intend to move quickly, and ideally the interview process will take no longer than 2 weeks from application submission



- Submit Application

- Short Video interview answering 3 brief questions

- Online Case Study

- Final interview w/ live challenge



HOW TO APPLY



To apply for this role, please put in your application in this Google Form and we will get back to you: 



We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Offshore Administrative Assistant/Marketing Assistant
description:
Offshore Administrative Assistant



We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Offshore Administrative Assistant to join our team. This role involves managing our project management system, coordinating tasks, and ensuring projects are delivered on time. You will also assist with invoicing, social media management, and general administrative duties.



Key Responsibilities:

 • Project Management: Oversee and maintain our project management system (Teamwork) to ensure efficient workflows and task prioritisation.

 • Team Coordination: Manage tasks and liaise with team members to ensure timely project execution and delivery.

 • Invoicing: Handle invoicing processes, including following up on unpaid invoices and creating new invoices based on quotes and scopes of work.

 • Social Media Assistance: Support the social media team with tasks such as writing captions, scheduling content, and generating reports using our tools.



Requirements:

 • Experience with project management tools (Teamwork or similar).

 • Strong organisational and time management skills.

 • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

 • Familiarity with invoicing systems and processes.

 • Knowledge of social media platforms and tools for scheduling and reporting.

 • Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.



Preferred Qualifications:

 • Prior experience in a similar role.

 • Experience working with remote teams.

 • Familiarity with tools like Canva, Buffer, Hootsuite, or similar for social media tasks.



This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who is highly organised, self-motivated, and eager to contribute to a dynamic team.

title: Director of Sales & Leadership Development
description:
ROLE OVERVIEW

The Director of Sales & Leadership Development is a senior leadership role responsible for building scalable sales performance through elite training, closing excellence, and leadership development.



This role exists to develop people, systems, and results—not to micromanage daily activity.



CORE OBJECTIVES

• Improve close rates, conversion, and revenue per lead

• Build a structured sales training and certification system

• Develop internal leadership bench strength

• Standardize sales execution and performance expectations

• Create predictable, repeatable sales outcomes



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Sales Enablement & Closing Performance

• Own sales scripts, objection-handling frameworks, and closing methodologies

• Lead advanced call reviews focused on psychology, structure, and execution

• Analyze sales metrics and identify improvement opportunities

• Build and maintain a comprehensive sales playbook



Training & Development

• Design and deliver structured sales training programs

• Certify sales reps based on skill mastery

• Measure training effectiveness through performance improvement

• Maintain training documentation and LMS content



Leadership Development

• Identify high-potential sales tea
mbers

• Develop Team Leads and Managers through coaching and training

• Train leaders on accountability, performance management, and forecasting

• Prepare leaders to operate independently



Strategic Leadership

• Set and enforce sales performance standards

• Recommend hiring, promotion, demotion, and termination decisions

• Partner with executive leadership on sales strategy and growth initiatives

• Reduce leadership bottlenecks by developing capable managers



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE

• 3–5 years of call center or high-volume inbound sales experience

• Experience training and coaching sales teams

• Experience mentoring Team Leads or senior sales reps

• Demonstrated ability to improve sales performance metrics

• Hands-on experience with closing and objection handling



REQUIRED SKILLS & COMPETENCIES

• Advanced sales coaching and call analysis skills

• Leadership development mindset

• Data-driven decision-making ability

• Clear communication and accountability standards

• Strategic thinking with operational execution



PERFORMANCE METRICS

• Close rate improvement

• Revenue per lead growth

• Internal promotions into leadership

• Training completion and performance lift

• Reduction in escalations due to stronger frontline leadership



COMPENSATION

Base Salary: $16–$21 USD per hour

Performance-Based Bonuses: Bonuses tied to sales performance, leadership development outcomes, and training effectiveness.



*Interested candidates can send their resume through our account for consideration.
salary: Base Salary: 16 usd to 21 usd per hour

title: Produce Buyer & Operations Reporting Specialist
description:
Produce Buyer & Operations Reporting Specialist

Full-Time | Stable Long-Term Role | Reliable Pay, Performance Bonuses, and Career Stability in a Structured, Growth-Focused Environment



READ THE DETAILS AND Apply here: 
/47MsOW8.



About the Role

We are looking for a Produce Buyer & Operations Reporting Specialist to manage daily produce order processing and deliver structured weekly market update reports. In this role, you will ensure purchasing accuracy, reconcile financial data, and provide actionable market insights that support operational decision-making. This is a long-term, full-time opportunity where your precision and analytical discipline directly impact order accuracy, vendor relationships, and reporting reliability.



Key Responsibilities

1. Process and verify daily produce orders across multiple digital channels, ensuring accurate entry, confirmation, and documentation.

2. Coordinate with vendors and clients to confirm quantities, pricing, availability, and delivery timelines to prevent operational disruptions.

3. Reconcile purchase orders, invoices, and pricing data to maintain financial and operational accuracy.

4. Research market trends and competitor pricing to compile structured weekly produce update reports using spreadsheets and Canva.



Must-Have Skills

1. Exceptional attention to detail with the ability to accurately process high-volume orders without errors.

2. Strong reconciliation skills, including verifying purchase orders, invoices, pricing, and financial data for accuracy.

3. Clear and confident English communication skills for professional vendor and client coordination.

4. Strong analytical ability to interpret data and translate findings into structured, easy-to-understand reports.

5. Proficiency with Excel or Google Sheets, QuickBooks Online, and Canva for reporting and documentation.

6. Ability to work consistently during 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM Pacific Time, Monday through Friday.



Nice-to-Have Skills (Bonus)

- Experience as a buyer, purchasing coordinator, or procurement specialist.

- Familiarity with produce, perishable goods, or food distribution supply chains.

- Experience preparing recurring operational or market reports for leadership.

- Exposure to cost analysis, margin tracking, or financial reporting.

- Ownership of a personal printer for order confirmations and documentation (preferred but not required).



Tools You’ll Use

- Entree Software

- Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets

- QuickBooks Online (QBO)

- Canva

-
 platforms (Outlook or Gmail)

- Phone or VOIP systems



Work Schedule

Full-time, 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM Pacific Time, Monday–Friday



Our Values

- Integrity – Doing what’s right with transparency and accountability.

- Excellence – Delivering high-quality results using modern tools.

- Innovation – Adapting quickly and solving problems proactively.

- Resilience – Reliable and steady support for success.

- Collaboration – Thriving in a positive, team-oriented environment.



Why You’ll Love Working Here

Our tea
mbers say this is more than just a workplace — it’s a supportive community where you can grow your career and feel valued. Here’s what you can look forward to:

- Long-term stability

- Reliable pay and bonus opportunities

- Paid leave and holidays

- Training and development

- Community and recognition

- Career security with continuous role opportunities

? Please do NOT apply if:

? If you can keep your phone online 20–24h/day consistently, you’ll do well here.

title: Tech & Data Operations Virtual Assistant
description:
Cadenth Consulting Group

Remote | Independent Contractor | Performance-Based Upside



About Cadenth



Cadenth Consulting Group installs Growth Systems inside service-based businesses. We diagnose revenue leaks, design scalable frameworks, and implement structured operating systems across sales, delivery, and operations.



We are not a marketing agency.

We are a systems consultancy.



This role is for someone who can architect the intelligence layer behind our diagnostics and implementation.



Role Overview



We are seeking a highly technical, execution-focused Tech & Data Operations VA to own the backend intelligence and systemization layer of Cadenth.



This person will:



• Extract and structure data from client intake forms

• Build automated diagnostics and scoring models

• Translate raw business data into structured growth frameworks

• Support CRM and automation architecture

• Develop lightweight tools, scripts, and data dashboards

• Assist in technical implementation of client systems



This is not a basic administrative role.

This is a hybrid of Data Analyst, Automation Engineer, and Technical Systems Operator.



Core Responsibilities

1. Client Intake Data Structuring



• Collect and clean data from client intake forms

• Structure inputs into standardized diagnostic dashboards

• Identify revenue leaks and system inefficiencies

• Create scoring metrics across sales, delivery, follow-up, and retention



2. Diagnostic & Framework Development



• Build data-backed growth scorecards

• Develop templated but customizable business frameworks

• Turn qualitative business answers into quantitative insights

• Assist in generating client-specific system roadmaps



3. Automation & Systems Engineering



• Build automations in tools like:



GoHighLevel



HubSpot



Zapier



Make



Airtable

• Create workflows and API integrations

• Develop backend automation for lead routing and tracking



4. CRM & Pipeline Intelligence



• Maintain structured CRM architecture

• Track funnel metrics and performance KPIs

• Build forecasting and reporting dashboards

• Optimize sales velocity and pipeline hygiene



5. Light Engineering & Tool Development



• Develop scripts in:



Python



JavaScript



SQL

• Build internal tools for scoring, projections, and diagnostics

• Assist in web integrations and backend data handling



Required Technical Skills



Must Have:

• Strong Excel / Google Sheets (advanced formulas, scripts)

• Python or JavaScript proficiency

• Experience with APIs and webhooks

• Experience with CRM systems

• Understanding of SQL and database structure

• Data visualization experience



Preferred:

• Automation engineering experience

• Experience building internal dashboards

• Experience working with consulting firms or agencies

• Familiarity with SaaS revenue metrics



Ideal Candidate Profile

title: Verification of Benefits (VOB) & Prior Authorization Specialist – ABA (New York Experience Required)
description:
We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Verification of Benefits (VOB) & Prior Authorization Specialist with direct experience supporting ABA therapy providers in New York. This role is responsible for managing eligibility checks, navigating complex NY payer requirements, and overseeing the full prior authorization lifecycle to ensure uninterrupted ABA services.

The ideal candidate understands New York insurance workflows, ABA clinical processes, and can independently manage high-volume authorizations with accuracy and efficiency.

Verify patient eligibility and insurance benefits for ABA services, including coverage limits, deductibles, copays, coinsurance, and authorization requirements

Manage the full prior authorization process, including initial submissions, renewals, extensions, and re-authorizations

Navigate New York-specific payer requirements and authorization protocols

Submit and track authorizations through insurance portals and clearinghouses

Communicate directly with insurance carriers to resolve issues, follow up on pending cases, and assist with appeals when needed

Review clinical documentation to ensure compliance with payer guidelines

Maintain accurate authorization and benefits records within internal systems

Collaborate closely with intake, clinical, and billing teams to support smooth client onboarding

Chorus

Prior experience supporting ABA therapy providers in New York

Deep understanding of ABA workflows and behavioral health insurance processes

Familiarity with New York payer policies and authorization requirements

Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills

Ability to manage multiple authorizations simultaneously in a fast-paced environment

Strong written and verbal English communication skills

Ability to work independently with minimal supervision



Benefits:**

Dynamic and supportive work environment.

Job Security and Stability

Opportunities for Career Growth

title: Sales Intake
description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and professional Sales Intake to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for managing initial client intake, accurately collecting and organizing information, and ensuring a smooth handoff to internal departments. You will play a critical role in maintaining data integrity, supporting operational workflows, and delivering a professional first impression of the firm.



***Responsibilities***



- Serve as the primary point of contact for new client inquiries via phone,
, and online forms.

- Collect, verify, and document client information accurately in internal systems.

- Conduct structured intake conversations to gather relevant case details while maintaining professionalism and empathy.

- Ensure all required documentation and intake forms are completed and properly recorded.

- Coordinate with internal teams to route completed intakes to the appropriate department.

- Track intake status and follow up on missing information as needed.

- Maintain confidentiality and compliance with company policies and data standards

- Identify incomplete or inconsistent information and resolve discrepancies promptly.

- Support continuous improvement of intake procedures and documentation processes.



***Qualifications***



- Strong verbal and written communication skills with excellent attention to detail.

- Experience in intake coordination, administrative support, or client-facing roles.

- Professional and composed demeanor, especially when handling sensitive information.

- Ability to follow structured processes while maintaining accuracy and consistency.

- Strong organizational and time-management skills.

- Comfortable working with databases, CRMs, or intake management systems.

- Ability to multitask effectively in a fast-paced environment.

- Reliable, process-driven, and accountability-focused mindset.



***Preferred Traits***



- Calm, professional communication style

- Detail- and process-oriented

- Strong follow-through and documentation skills

- Team-oriented and dependable



***Application Instructions:***



Please reply with a Google Drive link to your resume and include “Intake Coordinator” in the
 subject line.

THIS IS A PRIVATE U.S. COMPANY & NOT AN AGENCY

title: Order Specialist (female)
description:

Manage multiple orders simultaneously with accuracy and speed

Communicate clearly with reps, restaurants, and our internal team

Data Entry into software system on all orders

Are extremely punctual and dependable



Type quickly (please include your WPM in your reply)



Learn new systems fast



Stay calm and organized under pressure



Must-have skills: Comfortable making outbound calls

Fast and accurate on a computer (multi-tasking between portals,
, chat, etc.)

Proven reliability (perfect attendance is a big plus)

please include: A little about yourself

LinkedIn profile URL (if you have one)

Clear voice and neutral accent

Proper grammar, punctuation, and writing flow

A friendly and natural tone in conversation



Please record yourself answering the questions below and send both: 

 

The audio recording , and

The written text of your answers



You may use ChatGPT or any tool to help review your written responses if you wish.

 

Questions:



What makes you a good fit for this position?

Training is time-consuming, and we’re looking for someone long-term — are you planning to stay with the company after training?

What do you enjoy doing in your free time?

Write or record how you would respond to this customer in a professional and empathetic manner.

 

Final Task

Please visit 
 and:

 

Review the website, then

As if you were trying to convince me to use it for ordering food for my office.

Once I review your audio and written answers, I’ll follow up regarding next steps.

title: Conversion Focused UX UI Web Designer
description:
About Us

We are a performance driven digital marketing agency focused on measurable growth. We manage paid media, SEO, and digital strategy. Our websites and funnels must drive revenue, not just look good.



Role Overview

We are looking for a UX UI Web Designer to support client website, landing page, and funnel builds on an as needed basis.



This is not a purely aesthetic role. You must understand structure, offer clarity, user flow, funnel architecture, and conversion psychology.



You will work closely with our paid media and SEO teams to ensure websites and funnels align with traffic strategy and revenue goals.



What You Will Do

• Design high converting websites and landing pages

• Design and structure multi step funnels tied to paid traffic campaigns

• Map full user journeys from ad click to final conversion

• Define page sequence and step specific conversion goals

• Create wireframes based on messaging hierarchy and funnel logic

• Improve existing sites and funnels using analytics and performance data

• Collaborate with paid ads and SEO teams

• Explain the strategic reasoning behind your layout and funnel decisions

• Think in terms of revenue impact, not just visuals



Required Experience

• UX UI design experience

• Funnel and landing page design tied to paid traffic

• Understanding of conversion psychology

• Ability to interpret analytics, heatmaps, or performance data

• Experience working inside WordPress, Webflow, Shopify, or similar platforms



Strong Bonus

• CRO testing experience

• Direct response background

• Agency experience

• Familiarity with Google Analytics and tracking



How We Evaluate

Please submit:

• 3 websites or funnels you personally designed

• The primary conversion goal of each

• Why you structured it the way you did

• Any measurable performance improvement

• A short Loom video, 5 to 10 minutes, walking through one funnel you built and explaining your strategy, structure, and decision making process



If your portfolio focuses only on aesthetics without conversion thinking, this is not the role.



For the right person, there is opportunity to grow into a larger role as volume increases.

title: CRM & Automation Specialist
description:
Hey Everyone! My name is Julian and I am the founder of Skyline RAI Holdings LLC here in California. We are a fast-growing real estate investment and sales organization focused on efficiency, speed, and smart use of technology. We run high-volume lead flow, manage a sales team, and are actively integrating automation and AI to scale without adding headcount.



We’re looking for a hands-on Automation & Systems Specialist to own our CRM, workflows, AI tools, and website updates.



Role Overview:

This role is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the systems that power our sales and marketing operations. You will automate repetitive work, improve data accuracy, integrate AI tools, and manage ongoing website updates and optimizations.



This is a builder role not just strategy. You’ll work closely with leadership to turn ideas into working systems.



Key Responsibilities:

- Own and optimize our CRM (lead flow, pipelines, automations, reporting)

- Automate follow-ups, task creation, lead routing, and data cleanup

- Improve CRM data quality and reporting accuracy

- Create dashboards and KPIs for sales performance

- Explore and test new AI tools to improve sales efficiency

- Maintain and update company websites

- Document workflows, automations, and processes



Schedule(Flexible):

Our team works 10am-4pm PST, but I am flexible to make a part time schedule around that schedule.



Salary(Flexible):

I am offering $8/hr for 20-25 hours a week, but I am open to hearing your suggested pay if you are able to bring value!



I am honestly looking for someone who is good at managing CRMs, AI, knows how to automate systems to make it easier for the team. We are a growing company and have great culture!



Make sure to respond to this by telling me your experiences and how you can bring tremendous value to my team, make the subject of you response ( Value Add!) so I know you read this whole post.



Thanks!

ntum.

title: Patent Specialist
description:
Patent & Product Development Specialist – Solar Innovation (Remote | Philippines Preferred)

Company: US Power

Industry: Renewable Energy / Solar Technology

Position Type: Contract (Potential for Long-Term Engagement)

About Us

US Power is a fast-growing solar energy company focused on advancing residential and commercial power solutions. We are currently developing a next-generation solar technology and are seeking an experienced Patent & Product Development Specialist to help translate this innovation into protected intellectual property and support early-stage product development.

This role works directly with company leadership on a potentially industry-defining energy product.

?? REQUIRED: Proven Patent Development Experience

Applicants without direct patent support or development experience will not be considered.

We are specifically seeking professionals who have previously helped draft, develop, document, or support utility patents — ideally involving mechanical, energy, materials, or electromechanical technologies.

Please be prepared to demonstrate your track record.

Role Overview

We are looking for a technically advanced professional capable of bridging the gap between concept, engineering reality, and patent-ready documentation.

You will collaborate directly with the founder to refine the invention, expand technical embodiments, explore manufacturability pathways, and help prepare structured materials suitable for patent counsel.

Key Responsibilities

Support the technical development and structuring of a utility patent

Translate conceptual invention details into precise engineering documentation

Identify multiple embodiments, configurations, and design pathways

Assist in preparing invention disclosures and supporting materials

Research relevant technologies, materials, and mechanical systems

Evaluate feasibility and manufacturing approaches

Develop clear technical diagrams where needed

Collaborate with patent attorneys as required

Maintain absolute confidentiality regarding proprietary technology

Ideal Candidate Profile

MANDATORY:

? Demonstrated patent development/support experience

? Proven track record contributing to successful patent filings

? Strong technical writing ability

? Excellent English communication skills

Strongly Preferred Technical Backgrounds:

Mechanical Engineering

Materials Science

Energy Systems

Electromechanical Engineering

Advanced Product Development

Top candidates typically:

Think both creatively and structurally

Understand how inventions move from concept ? patent ? prototype

Are highly detail-oriented

Can quickly grasp complex technical mechanisms

Operate with professionalism and discretion

Confidentiality Requirement

This role involves highly sensitive intellectual property.

A strict NDA will be required prior to engagement.

Compensation

Competitive and based on expertise and patent experience.

We are not seeking the lowest-cost option — we are seeking proven capability.

Exceptional candidates may evolve into long-term strategic contributors as the technology advances.

To Apply, Please Provide:

Resume or CV

Summary of your patent experience

Examples of patents you have supported (public patent numbers preferred)

Description of your specific contribution to those filings

Technical areas of expertise

Your hourly or project rate

Optional but highly valuable:

Describe the most technically complex invention you have helped develop.



“Must provide the patent number of at least one utility patent you directly supported and describe your contribution.”

Why This Role Is Unique

Most engineering roles focus on improving existing products.

This opportunity involves helping create and protect entirely new technology within one of the fastest-growing sectors in the world — renewable energy.

If you have real patent experience and enjoy working on meaningful innovation, we want to hear from you.
