title: Customer Service Representative
description:
About the Role



Lawn Doctor is a lawn care service operating in Utah. We are hiring a long term remote tea
mber who will handle written communication with customers and gradually take on operational responsibilities. This position begins heavily focused on texting and
 communication but is designed to grow into a key support role inside the company.



You will represent the business directly to homeowners. The tone must be clear, professional, natural sounding, and human. Customers should feel they are speaking with a knowledgeable person locally, not a scripted response.



Core Responsibilities

Customer Communication



• Respond to customer text messages and
s

• Answer service questions about treatments, scheduling, watering, and expectations

• Provide clear explanations of lawn conditions and what customers should expect next

• Follow up with customers after applications

• Proactively communicate delays, weather impacts, and service updates

• Write responses in proper English grammar and natural conversational wording



Lawn Issue Support



You will be trained to identify common lawn problems in Utah using customer photos and technician notes.



Responsibilities include:

• Review lawn photos sent by customers

• Identify common problems such as heat stress, watering issues, weeds, fungus, insects, and dormancy

• Provide reassurance and education to customers

• Escalate serious issues to management when needed

• Maintain consistent messaging about our treatment program



No prior lawn experience required, but you must be willing to learn basic lawn agronomy specific to the western United States climate.



Administrative & Operational Tasks



• Schedule adjustments and routing support

• Customer account notes and record keeping

• Track callbacks and service follow ups

• Assist with estimates and service recommendations

• Organize inboxes and conversation threads

• Help maintain consistency in communication templates



Growth Path



This role is intended to expand over time depending on performance and interest.



Potential future responsibilities:

• Handling phone calls

• Managing service routes

• Sales conversations and renewals

• Quality control follow ups

• Training new assistants

• Internal documentation and process improvement



Requirements

Communication Skills



• Strong written English grammar and vocabulary

• Ability to write naturally and conversationally without sounding robotic

• Ability to think and respond independently without relying on automated writing tools

• Professional tone with friendly personality



Work Style



• Detail oriented

• Reliable and consistent availability during agreed hours

• Comfortable learning technical topics

• Able to handle frustrated customers calmly

• Organized and responsive



Technical Skills



• Comfortable using text messaging platforms,
, and CRM systems

• Able to review and interpret photos carefully

• Stable internet connection and quiet workspace



Preferred Traits



• Experience in customer support or service businesses

• Experience communicating with U.S. customers

• Interest in learning practical science based problem solving

• Long term employment mindset



Training Provided



We will train you on:

• Lawn care basics for Utah climate

• Company service program

• Communication standards and expectations

• Common customer scenarios and resolutions



Goal of the Position



We are not looking for a short ter
ssage responder. We are looking for a reliable tea
mber who can grow into a trusted operational partner inside the company and help reduce owner workload over time.

title: Operations Project Manager & Team Performance Lead - SOPs, KPIs, hiring A player Talent
description:
Remote | Full-time | Fluent English Required

Salary: Based on experience plus performance-based bonuses



TopFoxx is a rapidly growing, women owned NYC e commerce brand creating luxury eyewear with real solutions, floating sunglasses, tangle free aviators, foldable pocket sunnies, and mood boosting lenses. We are a small, ambitious, fast moving team that is scaling quickly.

Right now, our biggest opportunity is not product or marketing. It is systems, structure, and execution.We are looking for an Operations Project Manager and Team Performance Lead who will act as the connective tissue of the company. This person will help design how TopFoxx operates, how teams perform, and how work flows across departments. It is about building the systems that make the company run like a unified machine.

You will work closely with the Founder, the Marketing Manager, and the Executive Assistant. You will help define what success looks like in every department, track KPIs, and ensure execution actually happens. You will help in all areas of project management, operational tasks, recruiting process top talent, holding tea
mbers accountable and improving top performers happiness. 

If something is unclear, messy, slow, or disorganized, it becomes your responsibility to create clarity, build structure, and enforce a new standard.

This is a leadership role for someone who thinks like a founder, takes initiative, and thrives in ambiguity. Your goal is simple. When you join, TopFoxx becomes more organized, more aligned, and more efficient every single week.



Key Responsibilities

1. Team Performance and KPI Ownership

You will own how well the team performs inside the systems you create.

• Build KPI scorecards for each department

 • Define what “good performance” looks like for each role

 • Set weekly targets and measurable outcomes

 • Run performance check ins and follow ups

 • Identify bottlenecks and recurring problems

 • Fix root causes instead of applying temporary patches

 • Ensure deadlines are respected across the team

 • Escalate risks early with clear solutions

Your presence should make the entire team sharper, faster, and more accountable.



2. Systems, SOPs, and Documentation

You will build TopFoxx’s operating backbone from the ground up.

• Shadow each tea
mber to understand their work

 • Create clear SOPs and step by step playbooks

 • Record Loom videos for processes and workflows

 • Ensure all work lives in shared Google Drive

 • Standardize folder structures, naming, and templates

 • Make documentation usable for new hires

 • Prevent knowledge from living only in people’s heads

If someone new joined tomorrow, they should be able to understand how TopFoxx works because of your systems.



3. Asana and Project Management

You will be the guardian of Asana.

• Clean up and restructure existing workflows

 • Create consistent naming conventions

 • Build repeatable project templates

 • Track progress across departments

 • Identify bottlenecks and redesign processes

 • Ensure every task has clear ownership and deadlines

Everything in Asana must be uniform, organized, and easy to follow.



4. Hiring, Vetting, and Talent Quality

You will support hiring to help build a stronger team.

• Lead candidate screening with a performance mindset, not just resume review.

 • Conduct structured interviews that test judgment, ownership, and real execution ability.

 • Check references thoroughly, asking hard, specific questions about reliability, speed, and integrity.

 • Validate real past results, not stories, portfolios, or buzzwords.

 • Assess cultural fit with TopFoxx values of accountability, urgency, and clarity.

 • Identify red flags early and protect the company from weak or risky hires.

 • Recommend final candidates to the Founder with clear, evidence based rationale.

 • Help design onboarding so new hires hit the ground running at a high standard.

You are not just managing the current team. You are helping shape the future one.



5. Operations Support

While your main focus is systems and performance, you will also support operations by:

• Structuring workflows across Customer Service, Fulfillment, and Vendors

 • Creating checklists for inventory and orders

 • Standardizing how information moves between teams

 • Building Google Sheets trackers where needed

 • Ensuring operational knowledge is documented

You are the glue that keeps everything connected.



What We’re Looking For

You should have:

• 5 plus years experience in operations, project management, or systems building

 • Experience in startups or fast growing small businesses

 • Strong command of Google Drive, Asana, and Google Sheets

 • Excellent persuasive written and verbal English

 • Ability to think strategically and execute meticulously

 • Experience creating SOPs or playbooks

 • Comfort working with multiple personalities and departments

 • High attention to detail and organization

E commerce experience is a strong plus.



What You Get

• Competitive monthly salary + bonuses, based on experience.

 • Fully remote role

 • Free Sunglasses 

Direct access to the Founder and leadership team

 • Opportunity to grow into senior leadership

 • Free TopFoxx products

 • Paid time of

title: Shopify Web Developer - CRO Specialist - Ecommerce Advertising Agency - Full Time 3b
description:

I am looking for an experienced shopify web developer to help me upgrade client’s checkout processes and execute CRO tests for various ecommerce brands.

In this role you will update Shopify theme templates, develop landing pages using various page builders and html/CSS frameworks, research/install various checkout/bundle applications, and implement A/B tests using testing tools like intelligems.

You will also report on test performance, and provide suggestions for next steps.

This is a full-time opportunity. Training will be provided and you will work directly with me.



About Zack Miller

My name is Zack Miller, and I’ve been a DTC Ecommerce Growth Marketer since 2019. I’ve done everything fro
dia buying and client strategy, to agency internal operations.

I’ve contributed to the growth of over 200 ecommerce brands in my agency experience. Now, as an independent growth marketing partner, I work closely with a small number of brands on their new customer acquisition strategy.

Monday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Tuesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Wednesday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Thursday: 9am – 5:30pm EST

Friday: 9am – 5:30pm EST



Roles & Responsibilities

- Research new ideas for direct response content marketing strategies.

- Work in my project management system, ClickUp.

Required Experience & Education

This role goes beyond social media management; you will architect our front-end aesthetic and create original, scroll-stopping content that establishes Lisa Barry as the preeminent voice in the industry.

Original Production: Create high-impact Reels, TikToks, and Shorts from scratch. Research trends, develop unique hooks, and execute flawless transitions.

YouTube Mastery: Own the end-to-end production of the weekly 20-minute "Deep Dive." Manage high-retention editing, SEO, and thumbnails that command clicks.

Viral Exposure: Execute the strategy to reach 50,000 – 100,000 followers through elite content and engagement.

Community Connection: Engage daily to build deep relationships using Lisa’s authentic voice.

Funnel Aesthetics: Ensure landing pages and sales funnels in GHL/Canva are visually stunning and premium.

Marketing Collateral: Design pitch decks, onboarding assets, and event-specific graphics (ads, banners, promos).

Brand Guardianship: Ensure every touchpoint—from
 headers to YouTube descriptions—is visually elite.

Innovation: Stay ahead of marketing trends to keep the brand fun and innovative.



Who You Are



A Storyteller: You build authority through original visuals and marketing psychology.

An Owner: You don't wait for a task list. You see gaps and fill them with brilliance.

Design-Obsessed: If it isn’t world-class, it doesn’t get published.

High-Performance: You thrive in fast-paced environments and take pride in hitting growth targets.

Experience: 2–3+ years as a Creator or Marketing Assistant for high-ticket coaches or agencies.

Exceptional Communication: Flawless near-native English with a talent for voice matching.

Technical Mastery: Expert in Video Editing (CapCut/Premiere) and Visual Design (Canva/Photoshop/Figma).

Marketing Savvy: You understand how design impacts funnel conversion.



Application Requirements

Portfolio: Links to original social content, voice-matching copy, and marketing designs.

Growth Case Study: Breakdown of an account you grew and the strategy used.

DISC Profile: Please include your results.



Work Arrangement & Compensation

Compensation: $1,280 AUD / month (Full-Time)

Long-term Growth: We are looking for team to grow with the brand; as we scale, your role and compensation will scale with it.

title: Remote Operations Assistant
description:
Please Read Before Applying



This is not an easy role and not a temporary job.



We are looking for A-players who can think independently, make good judgment calls, and take full ownership of their work. If you are simply looking for “any job,” this role is not for you.



If you want long-term career growth with a fast-growing company expanding across Canada, keep reading.



About the Role



As an Operations Assistant, you will help run daily operations for a premium cleaning company in Montreal.



You will handle real situations — customer concerns, scheduling issues, and operational problems — and will be expected to solve problems calmly and independently, not follow scripts.



This role requires strong judgment, reliability, and comfort with responsibility.



Key Responsibilities



- Handle customer issues and service concerns professionally

- Make judgment calls to protect long-term client relationships

- Adjust schedules and resolve daily operational issues

- Communicate clearly with clients and cleaners

- Update job notes and follow operational processes



You are a strong fit if you:



- Can solve problems without constant supervision

- Have excellent judgment and stay calm under pressure

- Are reliable, disciplined, and consistent

- Are comfortable with technology and learning software

- Want long-term stability and growth



This Role Is NOT for You If:



- You need step-by-step instructions

- You avoid responsibility or decision-making

- You are looking for short-term or temporary work



Compensation & Schedule



- $1,000–$1,200 CAD/month, based on performance

- Full-time, consistent schedule aligned with Montreal hours

- Growth opportunities as the company expands across Canada



How to Apply



Please include:



- A short video of why you would perform well in a high-responsibility role

- Cover letter

- Resume

- Screenshot of computer specs

- Screenshot of internet speed

- Photo of your work from home set up

- Your backup internet and electricity plans (in the case of an outage)



Generic applications may not be considered.

title: Growth Strategist / Direct Response Marketing Brain
description:
This is NOT a social media manager role.

If you only schedule posts, make Canva graphics, or “run ads” without thinking  this is not for you.



I’m looking for a cold, calculated, strategic marketing operator who understands buyer psychology, revenue strategy, funnels, webinars, and conversions.



This role is about thinking, not just executing.



ABOUT THE BRAND



We operate in the financial education / consulting space.

Our audience is emotional, hesitant, motivated, and needs clarity + confidence to buy.



Your job is to help us:

 • Think smarter

 • Sell cleaner

 • Convert better

 • Scale faster



WHAT YOU’LL ACTUALLY DO



You will be responsible for strategy, not busy work.



Core Responsibilities:

 • Break down buyer psychology (why people hesitate, stall, or ghost)

 • Create offer positioning & messaging that converts

 • Build and refine funnels (cold ? warm ? buyer)

 • Design high-converting webinar frameworks

 • Develop ad angles, hooks, and messaging

 • Analyze what’s working, what’s not, and pivot fast

 • Generate new campaign ideas weekly

 • Help structure launches, promos, and evergreen sales



You’ll work closely with execution teams, but you are the brain behind the moves.



YOU ARE A FIT IF YOU:

 • Think in psychology, pressure, timing, and leverage

 • Can explain why something will convert — not just “let’s test it”

 • Understand urgency, authority, scarcity, and emotional buying

 • Can map a funnel without guessing

 • Aren’t afraid to challenge ideas (respectfully)

 • Care about revenue, not vanity metrics



?



YOU ARE NOT A FIT IF YOU:

 • Only do content calendars

 • Only “run ads” without strategy

 • Can’t explain buyer objections

 • Need constant direction

 • Avoid accountability

 • Hate numbers or feedback



?



EXPERIENCE WE VALUE (NOT REQUIRED, BUT A PLUS):

 • Direct response marketing

 • Webinar sales strategy

 • Info products, consulting, or high-trust offers

 • Scaling $200–$2K offers

 • Financial, coaching, or education industries



Results > credentials.



?



COMPENSATION

 • Monthly retainer

 • Performance bonuses tied to revenue

 • Trial period (2–4 weeks) before long-term commitment



We pay for brains, not hours.

Remote Transaction Coordinator

???? Direct Hire | Remote | Mon–Fri, 9AM–6PM EST | $1,100–$1,500/month + $50/closed deal

Subject: TCVA JOB POSITION

 1. Do you have Transaction Coordinator (TC) experience in wholesale? If yes, how many years?

What We’re Offering

- $1,100-$1,500 USD/month base pay (paid on time, every time)

- $50 bonus per closed transaction (no cap — the more you close, the more you earn)

- Full-time, long-term role with a company that closes deals weekly

- Training on our systems — we don’t babysit, but we’ll equip you to win



What We Expect (Non-Negotiable)

- Transaction Coordinator experience at a wholesale real estate company (not retail, not mortgage, not theory)

- Experience handling both cash and novation deals

- Proven track record clearing title issues with U.S. title companies

- Fluent written & spoken English (daily calls/emails)

- Reliable internet, headset, and power backup — no excuses

Send a short voice recording talking about your RE TC experience. 



Answer these:

 1. Do you have Transaction Coordinator (TC) experience in wholesale? If yes, how many years?

 2. Have you handled novation deals? If yes, how many do you typically manage per month?

 3. Have you ever managed files independently from start to finish as a TC?

 4. If a title report shows a lien two weeks before closing, what would be your next step?

 5. If the title company requires a death certificate but the seller doesn’t have it, what would you do?

 6. If there’s a deceased party on title with no probate, how would you proceed?



We need experienced wholesale TCs, not general VAs.

If you’ve never cleared title, chased down lien payoffs, worked with sellers/buyers/attorneys/title companies, or processed a novation deal… stop reading. This is not for you.



If you don’t follow these instructions, your application will be ignored.



What You’ll Do

- Manage files from contract to close (cash + novation deals)

- Work directly with U.S. title companies to clear title issues fast

- Coordinate daily with buyers, sellers, and attorneys

- Keep multiple files moving at once — no excuses, no missed deadlines

- Handle paperwork, follow-ups, and updates with precision



What We’re Offering

- $1,100-$1,500 USD/month base pay (paid on time, every time)

- $50 bonus per closed transaction (no cap — the more you close, the more you earn)

- Full-time, long-term role with a company that closes deals weekly

- Training on our systems — we don’t babysit, but we’ll equip you to win



What We Expect (Non-Negotiable)

- Transaction Coordinator experience at a wholesale real estate company (not retail, not mortgage, not theory)

- Experience handling both cash and novation deals

- Proven track record clearing title issues with U.S. title companies

- Detail-obsessed, organized, and able to thrive under pressure

- Fluent written & spoken English (daily calls/emails)

- Reliable internet, headset, and power backup — no excuses



The Bottom Line

We’re building a team of closers behind the closers.

If you want an easy VA job, this isn’t for you.

If you’re sharp, fast, and already know how to push wholesale deals across the finish line — we want you.

title: Customer Relations VA – Real Estate Wholesaling (with real estate ACQ/DISPO/CLOSER experience)
description:
Job Title: Customer Relations Virtual Assistant – Real Estate Wholesaling - DIRECT HIRE

Compensation: $6-$8/hour + performance-based commissions

Employment Type: Full-Time (40 hours/week) || 10:00AM to 7:00PM EST

Location: Remote??



ONLY APPLY IF YOU HAVE REAL ESTATE ACQ/CLOSER EXPERIENCE



???? To Apply:

 

Subject: Customer Relations VA



SEND A VOICE RECORDING

- A short introduction about yourself and why you’d be a good fit.

- Your relevant work experience (especially in real estate or customer relations).



Answer these:?

1. Do you have experience working in real estate wholesale? If yes, how many years?

2. Have you worked in Real Estate Acquisitions, Dispositions, or Customer Relations? If yes, please describe your experience and key responsibilities.

3. Are you comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with daily targets and follow-ups?



Responsibilities



You will be the point of contact for sellers and ensure everything runs smoothly between contract signing and closing.



Tasks include but are not limited to:



- Seller Communication & Updates

- Provide sellers with timely updates throughout the transaction process.

- Answer seller questions in a professional and friendly manner.

- Scheduling & Coordination

- Book notaries with sellers for contract signings or closings.

- Schedule property pictures and walkthroughs.

- Coordinate inspection or showing appointments when required.

- Pipeline Management

- Track and manage multiple files in the transaction pipeline.

- Update CRM and internal spreadsheets daily.

- Follow up with sellers, buyers, notaries, and vendors to keep files moving on time.

- Documentation & Task Support

- Ensure contracts and supporting documents are sent and received.

- Organize and upload documents into our system.

- Communicate with tea
mbers on any red flags or missing steps.



Qualifications

We’re looking for someone who brings more than just admin skills. The right candidate will have:

- Proven VA experience (real estate preferred).

- Strong English skills (spoken & written).

- Organized, detail-oriented, and tech-savvy.

- Able to manage multiple tasks and deadlines.

- Reliable setup: stable internet, headset, quiet workspace.

- Proactive and solution-driven attitude.

title: Opportunity for ICD-10 and OASIS Coders
description:
Hi everyone — I wanted to share something a little different here.



I'm with Lime Health AI. We build AI-powered tools for the U.S. home health and hospice industry — specifically AI OASIS Scribe and AI Coding. Our software helps agencies save time on documentation, reduce coding errors, and stay compliant.

I'm reaching out because I know many of you work directly with U.S.-based home care agencies and hospices. You have relationships with owners and administrators that we simply don't have. And that's valuable.



So here's what I'd like to propose:



If you have a relationship with a home health agency or hospice owner and can make an introduction, we'd love to work with you on a referral basis. If that introduction leads to a signed client, we'll pay you a referral bonus — starting at $2,000 USD for a standard-sized agency, and it goes up from there depending on the size of the organization.



How it actually works:



The first step is just a call with us. We'd schedule a time to talk, get to know each other, and hear about the connection you have — who the agency is, your relationship with the owner, and how you'd make the introduction. Nothing complicated. On that call, we'll confirm the exact referral bonus so there are no surprises.



From there, you introduce us to the agency owner. We take it from there on the sales side. If we close the deal, we honor the amount we agreed on. Simple as that.



A few things worth mentioning:



We do ask that everyone interested schedule an intro call with us first. It's not a screening — it's just a conversation. We want to make sure we're on the same page and that we can answer any questions you have before you put your name behind an introduction. 



Who is this a good fit for?



If you're an ICD-10 or OASIS coder who works with U.S. home health or hospice agencies and you're on good terms with an owner or decision-maker — this could be a great fit. Even if you're just curious about how it works, we're happy to hop on a quick call and explain more.



Feel free to send a message if you're interested. Looking forward to connecting.

— Lime Health AI

title: Video Editor
description:
Full-Time Video Editor (Long-Term Position)



Location: Remote (Philippines preferred)

Software: Adobe Premiere Pro (required)

Schedule: Full-time — 30 - 40 hours/week flexible hours.  Must meet deadlines. 

Start: As soon as the right fit is found



About the Role



I’m a filmmaker working across original YouTube series, commercial projects, and digital media.



I’m hiring a full-time video editor for a long-term position.

This is not freelance and not short-term. I’m looking for someone who wants stable work, clear direction, and a collaborative relationship.



App Development a major asset.  If you have experience please make it clear in application.



Project names, links, and client work will be shared after shortlisting.



What You’ll Be Working On



The role primarily involves video editing, with work spread across:



documentary-style long-form videos



short-form social content (reels/shorts)



animated and educational content



occasional commercial or branded projects



The exact balance of tasks may change over time depending on projects and production cycles. Some weeks may be heavier on editing, others lighter, with time allocated to preparation, revisions, or supporting other creative work.



Flexibility is part of the role.



Editing Style & Expectations



This position prioritizes:



calm, intentional pacing



clear storytelling



restraint over flashy effects



strong judgment about what to cut



clean sound and simple music use



This is not fast-cut, viral, 
, or hype editing.



I provide:



detailed training and workflow videos



timeline breakdowns



pacing references



style guides for different shows and commercial work



You will not be guessing how I want things cut — expectations are documented clearly.



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)



Adobe Premiere Pro (must be your primary editing software)



Strong English comprehension (written and spoken)



Able to follow direction and established workflows



Comfortable working independently



Open to feedback and iteration



Reliable, organized, and professional



Interested in a long-term, full-time role



Experience with documentary, travel, educational, or commercial content is a strong plus.



Time Commitment



Full-time



30 hours per week



Long-term position



Outcome-focused work (not micromanaged minute-by-minute)



Compensation



$300 USD per month



Paid monthly



Stable, full-time role



Retention Bonus

After 12 months of consistent work and a strong working relationship, there is a $400 retention bonus.



Compensation will be reviewed as responsibilities and scope evolve.



What I Provide



Clear creative direction



Structured training materials and style guides



Organized assets and footage



Consistent feedback



Respectful, professional communication



A stable work environment



How to Apply:



Please include answers to the following questions in your application:



Editing Software



Is Adobe Premiere Pro your primary editing software?



How many years have you been editing in Premiere Pro?



Portfolio



Please share 1–2 examples of documentary-style or story-driven edits (long-form preferred).



Avoid short-form, hype, or 
-style edits unless clearly labeled.



Availability



Are you available for a full-time role (40 hours per week)?



Are you comfortable with a long-term position?





Workflow & Direction



Are you comfortable following detailed direction, style guides, and training videos that outline pacing and timeline structure?



Language



Are you comfortable communicating in English (written and spoken)?



Bonus Skills (Optional but Valued)



Do you have any experience with coding, automation, or AI-based tools?



Have you ever built or contributed to a working app, tool, or prototype?

(Briefly describe, if yes.)



Applications that do not answer these questions may not be considered.

Shortlisted candidates will be invited to complete a paid test edit.



Final Note



I’m looking for someone who values:



clarity over chaos



taste over trends



structure with flexibility



long-term collaboration



If you want steady work, clear expectations, and the chance to grow with ongoing projects, I’d like to hear from you.

title: Appointment Setter & Lead Qualifier — Full-Time, Remote (EST Hours)
description:
We are a fast-growing, multiple six-figure tutoring company based in Michigan, USA. While we provide academic support across multiple subjects (Math, English, Science, Foreign Languages), SAT prep is our primary focus and core offering.



Due to continued growth in demand for our SAT programs, we are expanding our team and hiring an additional full-time member to support our increasing volume of inbound SAT leads. Although most of our clients are local to Michigan, we proudly serve families across the U.S.



The Role

You will call warm parent leads who opted in through our SAT-focused
 ads and scheduled a 5-minute SAT Accelerator callback. Your primary responsibility is simple and focused:



Have a short, professional phone conversation with parents and secure a 30-minute SAT Skills Assessment via Zoom with one of our SAT Specialists.



• Average call duration: 4–6 minutes.

• Calls are made using the WAVV power dialer in GHL (GoHighLevel), creating a fast, seamless workflow.

• You are not responsible for closing sales or enrolling families into the program.



All calls are made by following a detailed, step-by-step script that we provide. This role rewards clear delivery, confidence, and consistency, not improvisation.



Core Responsibilities

• Call warm SAT-focused parent leads who have already requested information or a callback.

• Use the WAVV power dialer to efficiently move through scheduled callbacks.

• Follow a detailed call script to ensure consistent, professional conversations.

• Build rapport with parents while staying structured and on-script.

• Gather key student background information (grade, testing history, goals).

• Confidently answer common questions using approved SAT talking points.

• Book qualified leads for Zoom appointments with our SAT Specialists.

• Follow up with previously contacted or missed-call leads.

• Accurately track call outcomes, notes, and lead status/disposition in our CRM (GoHighLevel).



Performance Expectations

• Expected pace after ramp-up: 16–24 qualified Zoom bookings per day.

• Consistent adherence to scripts and workflows.

• Strong attention to detail when documenting calls.

• Ability to stay composed, persuasive, and efficient on short (4–6 minute) calls.



What We’re Looking For

• Excellent spoken English (clear, fluent, confident; neutral or native-level accent).

• Prior experience in appointment setting, lead qualification, or phone-based customer interaction.

• Comfortable following scripts while sounding natural and conversational.

• Strong rapport-building skills with parents.

• Coachable, reliable, and performance-driven.



Technical & Environment Requirements

• Laptop or desktop with at least 16 GB RAM.

• High-speed, stable internet (backup connection preferred).

• Quiet, professional workspace.

• Noise-canceling headset.

• Ability to work Michigan / EST hours (40 hours per week).

• Backup power or contingency plan for outages (strongly preferred).



IMPORTANT: Please apply only if you already have a second monitor or are willing to set one up within your first 7 days. A dual-monitor setup is essential for this role.



Compensation & Benefits

* 100% remote.

* Paid every Friday.



Weekly Payment Structure

Note: Compensation is earned only for qualified Zoom show-up and is calculated weekly as follows:

* 1 through 50: $5 per qualified Zoom show-up

* 51 through 60: $6 per qualified Zoom show-up

* 61 and above: $7 per qualified Zoom show-up

* 80 and above: A one-time $50 bonus each week



How to Apply

1. Watch this video and follow all instructions carefully:



2. Submit a link to your CV (Google Drive or similar). Please make sure we can access/view it.

3. Include a short audio or video recording of you speaking in English (introduce yourself and explain why you’re a good fit).



Important Notes

• We are hiring freelancers / independent contractors only.

• Attention to detail matters. Applicants who do not follow instructions will not receive a reply.

• Do not message our social media accounts or
 addresses.

• Do not call our company lines or personal phone numbers. Doing so will result in immediate disqualification.



Hiring Process

• Due to the high volume of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

• Qualified applicants will be invited to an interview within one week.

title: Accountant/Bookkeeper - US GAAP
description:
TO APPLY CLICK HERE: 



We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Accountant/Bookkeeper to oversee our financial audits and ensure compliance with US GAAP (Generally Accepted Accounting Principles). This is a full-time, remote position, offering an excellent opportunity to contribute to the financial oversight of a growing tech company while enjoying the flexibility of working from home.



*Key Responsibilities:

- Day-to-Day Accounting: Manage daily accounting operations including accounts payable/receivable, general ledger entries, bank reconciliations, and expense tracking.

- Financial Reporting: Prepare accurate monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports, ensuring compliance with GAAP standards.

- Record Maintenance: Maintain organized and up-to-date financial records, receipts, and documentation for all transactions.

- Budget Support: Assist with budgeting, forecasting, and variance analysis to support strategic decision-making.

- Compliance Assurance: Ensure financial practices comply with applicable local, state, and federal regulations.

- Process Improvement: Recommend improvements to accounting workflows, tools, and systems to increase efficiency and accuracy.

- Tax Support: Assist with preparation and organization of financial data for tax filings and work with external tax professionals as needed.

- Software Management: Use financial software such as QuickBooks Online to manage company accounts and generate reports.

- Internal Controls: Help implement and maintain internal controls to safeguard company assets and prevent financial discrepancies.



*Qualifications:

- Proficient in accounting software, particularly QuickBooks Online, with advanced Excel skills.

- Strong background in inventory management, including accurate tracking, reconciliation, and reporting.

- Exceptional attention to detail with a proven track record of accuracy in record-keeping, reconciliations, and financial reporting.

- Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.

- Highly organized with excellent written and verbal communication skills.

- Capable of working independently and dependably in a remote setting.

- Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field required; certification (e.g., CPA, CMA, CB) is a plus.

- Prior experience in a startup or technology-driven environment is a plus, though not essential.

• Follow up with previously contacted or missed-call leads.

• Accurately track call outcomes, notes, and lead status/disposition in our CRM (GoHighLevel).

• Consistent adherence to scripts and workflows.

• Strong attention to detail when documenting calls.

• Prior experience in appointment setting, lead qualification, or phone-based customer interaction.

title: Appointment Setter & Lead Qualifier
description:
We are a fast-growing, multiple six-figure tutoring company based in Michigan, USA. While we provide academic support across multiple subjects (Math, English, Science, Foreign Languages), SAT prep is our primary focus and core offering.



Due to continued growth in demand for our SAT programs, we are expanding our team and hiring an additional full-time member to support our increasing volume of inbound SAT leads. Although most of our clients are local to Michigan, we proudly serve families across the U.S.



The Role

You will call warm parent leads who opted in through our SAT-focused
 ads and scheduled a 5-minute SAT Accelerator callback. Your primary responsibility is simple and focused:



Have a short, professional phone conversation with parents and secure a 30-minute SAT Skills Assessment via Zoom with one of our SAT Specialists.



• Average call duration: 4–6 minutes.

• Calls are made using the WAVV power dialer in GHL (GoHighLevel), creating a fast, seamless workflow.

• You are not responsible for closing sales or enrolling families into the program.



All calls are made by following a detailed, step-by-step script that we provide. This role rewards clear delivery, confidence, and consistency, not improvisation.



Core Responsibilities

• Call warm SAT-focused parent leads who have already requested information or a callback.

• Use the WAVV power dialer to efficiently move through scheduled callbacks.

• Follow a detailed call script to ensure consistent, professional conversations.

• Build rapport with parents while staying structured and on-script.

• Gather key student background information (grade, testing history, goals).

• Confidently answer common questions using approved SAT talking points.

• Book qualified leads for Zoom appointments with our SAT Specialists.

• Follow up with previously contacted or missed-call leads.

• Accurately track call outcomes, notes, and lead status/disposition in our CRM (GoHighLevel).



Performance Expectations

• Expected pace after ramp-up: 16–24 qualified Zoom bookings per day.

• Consistent adherence to scripts and workflows.

• Strong attention to detail when documenting calls.

• Ability to stay composed, persuasive, and efficient on short (4–6 minute) calls.



What We’re Looking For

• Excellent spoken English (clear, fluent, confident; neutral or native-level accent).

• Prior experience in appointment setting, lead qualification, or phone-based customer interaction.

• Comfortable following scripts while sounding natural and conversational.

• Strong rapport-building skills with parents.

• Coachable, reliable, and performance-driven.



Technical & Environment Requirements

• Laptop or desktop with at least 16 GB RAM.

• High-speed, stable internet (backup connection preferred).

• Quiet, professional workspace.

• Noise-canceling headset.

• Ability to work Michigan / EST hours (40 hours per week).

• Backup power or contingency plan for outages (strongly preferred).



IMPORTANT: Please apply only if you already have a second monitor or are willing to set one up within your first 7 days. A dual-monitor setup is essential for this role.



Compensation & Benefits

* 100% remote.

* Paid every Friday.



Weekly Payment Structure

Note: Compensation is earned only for qualified Zoom show-up and is calculated weekly as follows:

* 1 through 50: $5 per qualified Zoom show-up

* 51 through 60: $6 per qualified Zoom show-up

* 61 and above: $7 per qualified Zoom show-up

* 80 and above: A one-time $50 bonus each week



How to Apply

1. Watch this video and follow all instructions carefully:



2. Submit a link to your CV (Google Drive or similar). Please make sure we can access/view it.

3. Include a short audio or video recording of you speaking in English (introduce yourself and explain why you’re a good fit).



Important Notes

• We are hiring freelancers / independent contractors only.

• Attention to detail matters. Applicants who do not follow instructions will not receive a reply.

• Do not message our social media accounts or
 addresses.

• Do not call our company lines or personal phone numbers. Doing so will result in immediate disqualification.



Hiring Process

• Due to the high volume of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

• Qualified applicants will be invited to an interview within one week.

title: Accounts Receivable Specialist
description:
TO APPLY CLICK HERE: 



We are looking for a detail-oriented and reliable Accounts Receivable Specialist to manage daily invoicing, payment tracking, and AR-related tasks. - Strong communication skills



*Schedule:

- Full-time

- Working hours: 7:00 AM – 3:00 PM CST

title: Executive Virtual Assistant/Influencer Relationship Manager
description:
We’re looking for a proactive, highly organized Executive Virtual Assistant / Influencer Relationship Manager to support a growing talent management agency. This role will begin at approximately 4–6 hours per week with flexible scheduling, and is ideal for someone looking to take on a meaningful side role with strong growth potential.



The goal is to grow this position into a full-time leadership role, with the opportunity to manage campaigns — and eventually people — as the agency expands.



Key Responsibilities: 



1. Manage and organize
 inboxes for a social media agency



2. Respond to brand inquiries and maintain partnership communication



3. Source and vet influencers for brand campaigns and to join agency 



4. Support campaign execution from outreach to invoicing



5. Assist with social media management (engagement + posting strategy)



6. Create and manage ShopMy/LTK product links





Required Skills



1. Excellent written communication skills



2. Experience managing influencer campaigns on both the brand and creator side



3. Strong understanding of the full campaign lifecycle: outreach ? negotiation ? contracts ? execution ? reporting ? invoicing



4. Comfortable using remote collaboration tools (Slack, Gmail, Trello/Notion)



5. Experience with Canva



6. Highly organized, detail-oriented, and self-directed





Nice to Have: 



1. Experience negotiating rates and usage rights



2. Knowledge of FTC compliance and influencer guidelines





This is a great opportunity for someone who wants to grow with an agency long-term and step into a leadership role over time.

title: Remote Inside Sales Associate
description:
The Inside Sales Associate (ISA) is the first point of contact for new prospects. This role focuses on engaging inbound leads, conducting initial discovery calls, qualifying prospects, and scheduling qualified appointments for the sales team.



You will work with leads generated from paid search,
 marketing campaigns, and outbound cold-calling efforts. Your success will be measured by the number of qualified appointments completed and the quality of opportunities passed to the sales team.



This is an excellent opportunity for a motivated professional who enjoys speaking with business owners, identifying opportunities, and contributing directly to company growth.



Key Responsibilities



Respond promptly to inbound leads from multiple marketing channels

Conduct initial discovery calls or virtual meetings with prospective clients

Qualify prospects based on company criteria (budget, decision-maker status, timeline, and need)

Clearly explain Full Force Ads’ services at a high level

Schedule qualified appointments for the sales team

Maintain accurate records in CRM and appointment scheduling systems

Follow up with leads who have expressed interest but have not yet scheduled

Coordinate closely with the marketing and sales teams to ensure lead quality and pipeline flow

Meet or exceed monthly appointment and performance targets

Complete outbound call campaigns if not engaged in inbound campaigns. 



Required Qualifications



Strong English communication skills (spoken and written)

Experience in sales, appointment setting, lead qualification, or customer service

Comfortable conducting calls and virtual meetings with business owners and decision-makers

Strong organizational and time management skills

Reliable high-speed internet connection and a quiet work environment

Familiarity with CRM systems and scheduling tools (or willingness to learn quickly)

Ability to work consistently during EST business hours



Required Skills



Experience in B2B sales or marketing services

Experience in qualifying leads or conducting discovery calls

Knowledge of digital marketing or advertising concepts

Experience working remotely for a U.S.-based company

Self-motivated and performance-driven mindset



Compensation and Performance Structure



Base Salary: $500 per month

Performance Bonus: $30 per completed appointment

Commission: 3% on all deals closed by the sales team from appointments you set

OTE goals are $2000 per month+ 

This structure provides strong earning potential for high performers and creates a clear path to increased income as results improve.



Work Schedule



Monday through Friday

8:00 AM to 5:00 PM Eastern Standard Time

Consistent availability during scheduled hours is required



Growth Opportunities



Full Force Ads is a growing company, and top-performing ISA may have opportunities to:

Advance into senior ISA or account executive roles

Take on leadership responsibilities

Increase earnings through higher performance and commissions



Who Succeeds in This Role



This position is ideal for someone who:



Enjoys speaking with people and building rapport quickly

Is goal-oriented and motivated by performance incentives

Is comfortable following structured processes while maintaining a friendly, professional tone

Wants long-term growth in sales or digital marketing

title: Property Manager Assistant
description:
Overview

We are seeking a detail-oriented and organized Property Management Assistant to support property operations. The ideal candidate has experience in property management, strong administrative and accounting skills, and the ability to manage recurring operational tasks efficiently.



Key Responsibilities

• Assist with property management operations

Qualifications

• Strong administrative and organizational skills

• Basic to intermediate accounting knowledge

• Excellent attention to detail and time management

• Ability to manage deadlines and recurring responsibilities

• Strong written and verbal communication skills



Preferred Skills

• Property management software experience

• Ability to work independently and proactively

• Professional demeanor and discretion



How to Apply

Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your relevant experience.

title: GoHighLevel Specialist
description: We are seeking a high-octane GoHighLevel (GHL) Specialist who lives and breathes automation and can navigate the platform’s expansive ecosystem with surgical precision. In this role, you’ll serve as the primary architect behind our marketing infrastructure, responsible for building high-converting sales funnels, crafting intricate multi-step workflows, and managing complex CRM configurations that ensure no lead ever falls through the cracks. You aren't just a "button-pusher"; you’re a strategic problem-solver who can deploy and customize snapshots, integrate third-party tools via Zapier or Webhooks, and troubleshoot API or deliverability issues without breaking a sweat. From designing sleek landing pages and membership sites to setting up reputation management triggers and granular reporting dashboards, you’ll ensure every technical gear is turning in perfect sync. If you’re the type of person who finds genuine joy in a perfectly executed trigger link and knows how to translate ambitious business goals into scalable, automated systems, you’re exactly who we need to bridge the gap between "manual chaos" and "automated excellence."

title: Operations Coordinator
description:
We're a Texas-based real estate company looking for an Operations Coordinator to work directly with our CEO. This is not a traditional assistant role—it's an execution position. You'll be the interface between leadership and our vendors, contractors, and internal tea
mbers. 



You’ll be working with a high energy CEO and you'll start with a clear base salary, with mapped-out performance markers for 3, 6, and 12 months, each step comes with a raise as you hit targets.



The right person can take a loosely-defined directive, turn it into a structured plan, coordinate the people needed to execute it, quality-check the work before it reaches leadership, and communicate clearly throughout. You'll manage designers, developers, and marketing vendors—ensuring work gets done right the first time.



Key Responsibilities:



Vendor & Project Coordination:

-Serve as the primary point of contact for designers, developers, and marketing vendors

-Turn vague directives into structured briefs with clear requirements and acceptance criteria

-Manage project timelines, follow up on deliverables, and enforce deadlines

-Quality-check all work before it reaches the CEO—catch issues, request revisions, and ensure deliverables are complete

-Handle vendor questions and problem-solving independently rather than escalating prematurely



Performance Marketing Support:

-Review and interpret marketing performance reports (GA4, Piwik, CallRail)

-Understand A/B testing fundamentals and communicate results clearly

-Coordinate with performance marketing vendors on campaigns and optimizations

-Summarize key metrics and flag anomalies or opportunities



Communication & Execution:

-Make phone calls and send texts on behalf of the CEO (vendors, service providers, scheduling)

-Research and plan projects—gather steps, identify vendors, compile costs, present options

-Set up and configure software tools as needed

-Create and maintain documentation, SOPs, and checklists

-Handle logistics for business and personal projects



Required Qualifications:

-Excellent spoken and written English — you'll be making calls and leading conversations with US-based vendors

-Prior project management or coordinator experience — agency, SaaS, marketing, product, or operations background preferred

-Experience managing creative or technical vendors — designers, developers, marketing agencies

-Analytical ability — comfortable reviewing reports, identifying patterns, and summarizing data

-Strong technical aptitude — able to learn new software quickly without hand-holding

-High autonomy — able to take vague instructions and figure out the path forward

-Highly organized — able to juggle multiple projects and vendors without dropping balls

-Comfortable with oversight tools (phone monitoring, activity tracking) during initial period

-Reliable internet and a quiet space for phone calls

-Availability during US Central Time business hours



Nice to Have:

-Familiarity with real estate or property management operations

-Experience with analytics tools (Google Analytics, Piwik, CallRail)

-Basic UX literacy—can spot layout issues, unclear UI, poor hierarchy

-Light HTML/CSS familiarity

-Light Figma ability

-Light automation experience (Zapier/Make)

-Video editing basics (Riverside.fm, Descript)

-Genuine interest in AI tools



Tools You'll Use:

-Google Workspace

-Follow Up Boss (FUB)

-CallRail

-Piwik (web analytics)

-Statamic (CMS)

-Basecamp

-Riverside.fm / Descript (video)

-SendGrid



Schedule

-Full-time (40 hours/week)

-Monday–Friday, 9am–5pm Central Time

-Remote — Philippines-based candidates only



Compensation & Growth Track:



Starting Salary: $1,200 USD/month + 13th month pay



This is a growth-track position. Hit your targets, your pay grows with you:



-Start -  $1,200/mo: Learning systems, shadowing, getting up to speed.

-3 months - $1,350/mo: Running routine tasks independently. Making calls and completing research with minimal revision.

-6 months - $1,500/mo: Owning projects end-to-end. Taking vague direction and delivering complete solutions.

-9 months - $1,750/mo: Anticipating needs before being asked. Improving processes on your own. Training others.

-12 months - $2,000+/mo: Operating as a true "right hand." Handling complex projects. Full delegation of workstreams.



Raises are tied to hitting milestones, not automatic. We review together at each checkpoint.



Hiring Process:



-Apply: Submit your resume and complete the TestGorilla assessments (link below)

-Screener Call: Short 15-minute video call to discuss your experience

-Trial Projects: Complete 2–3 take-home projects similar to what you'd do in the role

-Final Interview: Present your trial project results and meet the team



How to Apply:



To be considered for this role, please complete the TestGorilla assessments here:

title: Rulebook Designer Needed – Card Game Instruction Booklet
description:
We’re looking for someone experienced in rulebook writing and layout design to help refine and rebuild the instruction booklet for our tabletop card game.



This is not just about making it look nice.

We need clarity, structure, and flow.



What we need

- Rewrite and refine the current rules for clarity

- Improve structure and logical order of information

- Simplify explanations without losing depth

- Identify gaps, contradictions, or confusing sections

- Professionally design and format the final booklet

- Deliver a clean, print-ready PDF



The game is strategic but accessible. The rulebook needs to feel:

- Clear

- Concise

- Easy to reference mid-game

- Beginner-friendly without dumbing it down



Ideal candidate

- Experience writing or editing board game rulebooks

- Strong understanding of game flow and player psychology

- Good at spotting unclear wording

- Skilled in layout design (InDesign, Affinity, etc.)

- Can provide examples of past rulebooks or similar work



Bonus (not required)

- Experience with Kickstarter projects

- Playtesting or demo experience

- Ability to suggest player aids or quick-start guides



** PLEASE INCLUDE YOUR PORTFOLIO OR ANY EVIDENCE OF INSTRUCTION BOOKLET OR MANUALS YOU HAVE WRITTEN/DESIGNED WITHIN YOUR MESSAGE **

title: Backend Developer (Automation)
description:
Key Responsibilities

• Design, develop, and maintain AI-driven backend systems for multiple client projects

• Build and integrate APIs, webhooks, and automation workflows

• Work with LLMs and AI services to support custom AI solutions

• Implement and manage vector databases for semantic search and retrieval use cases

• Develop AI assistants and workflows (e.g., document processing, image generation, object

recognition)

• Support projects involving file processing, data transformation, and structured storage

• Collaborate with the Solutions Architect to execute technical designs and priorities

• Maintain clear documentation and follow structured development processes



Required Technical Skills

• Strong experience with Node.js and Python

• Hands-on experience with cloud platforms:

title: Assistant for Luxury Watch Sales
description:
looking for someone passionate and interested in luxury watches to help us grow our business. You must be good with data entry and spreadsheets and must be good at paying attention to detail. salary: 5$ an hour or $25 per watch bought

title: Online Chat Salesperson
description:
This is NOT a DATA-ENTRY or CUSTOMER SUPPORT position. We are looking for AGGRESSIVE candidates.





Job description:



Selling to and upselling over online chat to people who have indicated interest in the product. This is a SALES position, NOT a CUSTOMER SUPPORT position. We are looking for COMPETITIVE, DRIVEN, and HUNGRY candidates. Our standards are HIGH. You will work as a part of a TEAM, but you are responsible for YOUR OWN SUCCESS. The ideal candidate is between the ages of 18-25 and has ENERGY and AMBITION.





Compensation:



You will be paid hourly and in commission if your commission exceeds your hourly. After your trial period you will be expected to consistently exceed your hourly. If you are unable to meet the daily sales target after the trial period, you will be let go. You will be expected to make enough sales to AT LEAST earn $40 per shift. With skill and motivation a salesperson can exceed this amount multiple times over.





Hard Requirements:



- Adequate internet connection

- Adequate PC setup

- EXCELLENT written and GOOD spoken English

- SPEED. You may be juggling 10 or more chats at the same time and each requires your full attention to EARN

- WORK ETHIC: You will be expected to stay focused and active for the entire duration of your shift

Everything else can be taught.





Nice to have:



- Understanding of modern internet culture/
s

- Exposure to video games and other media from the US

- Charisma

- Post-secondary education (we'll accept it as an indicator of competence as long as you can provide us with the diploma)



This is NOT an easy job, but it can be VERY LUCRATIVE with talent and especially hard work.



End note:

Applications written by AI will be detected and rejected immediately. Chosen candidates are to expect a thorough interview (1 hour). No hard feelings if the interview is cut short, it means we have d
 you're not a good fit.



Full time ONLY

title: Unlock Your Creativity: Join Arispheris as a Graphic Designer for a Dynamic 3-Month Project
description:
Arispheris is looking for a highly skilled and innovative Graphic Designer to join our team for a 3-month full-time project term, with potential for extension. This is a remote position, but we require a designer who can work independently, take initiative, and bring fresh, original creativity to the table—no AI-generated designs will be accepted.



If you thrive in an environment that values creative autonomy, attention to detail, and hands-on design skills, we’d love to hear from you.



Company Overview

Arispheris is a staffing firm that provides authentic and connective staffing solutions for small business owners. We take pride in our in-depth recruiting process, ensuring that every professional we bring on board has the skills and drive to succeed.



We are actively expanding our design team and are looking for a Graphic Designer who excels at crafting compelling visuals that enhance brand presence and engage audiences. If you want to be part of a team that values true creative expertise, this is the perfect opportunity for you!



Key Responsibilities

Design on-brand graphics for both Arispheris and its clients, including but not limited to:

Logos, brand kits, media and promo materials

Social media banners, headers, and marketing posts

Website vector images, multimedia thumbnails, and digital ads

Newsletter and
 marketing templates

eBook and print book covers

Presentation decks, invitations, and website wireframes

Ensure all final graphics are visually appealing, 100% original (no AI-generated work), and meet client brand guidelines.

Collaborate with tea
mbers and clients to conceptualize social media campaigns and marketing materials.

Present design drafts, revise based on feedback, and ensure timely project completion.

Keep a well-organized directory of design assets for efficient access.

Stay up to date with design trends and continuously refine skills to maintain top-tier creative output.



Requirements & Qualifications

A degree in Graphic Design, Digital Arts, Creative Multimedia, Marketing, or a related field.

At least 2 years of professional experience in digital design, branding, or marketing.

Must be highly proficient in both Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop) and Canva—you will be tested during the interview.

Strong sense of design composition, color theory, and typography.

Ability to create content quickly and efficiently while maintaining a high standard of design quality.

Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with clients and teams.

Detail-oriented and capable of handling multiple projects at once while meeting deadlines.

Familiarity with tools like Google Workspace, Slack, and Asana is a plus.

Absolutely no AI-generated designs or portfolios will be considered.



Compensation & Benefits

Full-time remote position (3-month term, potential for extension based on performance)

Competitive compensation based on experience and skills

Bi-monthly pay via money transfer

Paid career training relevant to the role

Performance-based bonuses

Work-life balance and flexible hours



How to Apply

We will be holding interviews on Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday this week for immediate hiring, contingent on your skills and company fit.



To Apply, Follow These Steps:

Reply with your Name and Position in the subject line. Example: "John Doe – Graphic Designer"

Define a staging area (this is part of your application process).



Submit the following:

Your resume (CV)

Portfolio links showcasing your original design work (no AI-generated content)

Websites you have designed (if applicable)



Once we receive your application, we will send you a scheduler to book your interview slot. You will be required to demonstrate proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite and Canva during the interview.



If you’re ready to bring your creativity to a team that values real design expertise, we look forward to your application!

title: Senior-Level Property Accountant / Bookkeeper (Remote – Full Time)
description:
About Us Altus Property Partners

is a rapidly growing real estate operations firm focused on property management, real estate investing, and construction management. With roots in Chicago and a growing footprint in Florida, we manage a diverse portfolio of residential and multifamily properties — all while building out a tech-enabled ecosystem to power our next phase of growth.



We’re looking for a seasoned, detail-obsessed Property Accountant or Sr. Bookkeeper with deep experience in real estate, construction, and property management accounting. This is a high-trust, high-impact role where you’ll help build the financial backbone of a rapidly scaling real estate organization.



What You’ll Do

Full-Cycle Accounting

• Own monthly reconciliation of operating accounts, reserve funds, security deposits, and trust accounts

• Prepare and analyze accurate financial reports, balance sheets, and owner P&Ls for 25+ properties

• Categorize expenses for real estate investments (e.g. CapEx, value-add improvements, equity contributions)

• Oversee construction & maintenance billbacks — ensuring proper coding, vendor classification, and cost allocations

• Track payables for unit turns, make-readies, and long-term rehabs



AP/AR + Systems Work

• Process all incoming vendor invoices and schedule payments via 
 and QuickBooks Online

• Sync data between Buildium and QBO to maintain unified, clean records

• Ensure timely rent roll matching, rent deposits, and reconciliation across platforms

• Maintain clean records for 1099 contractors and prepare W9/W8-BEN documentation as needed



Cross-Team Collaboration

• Communicate directly with our U.S.-based leadership and offshore teams to ensure flawless books

• Work closely with our maintenance department to ensure labor, materials, and subcontractor invoices are categorized and reimbursed properly

• Partner with our PM and construction leads to improve job costing workflows



Optimization & Internal Controls

• Proactively flag discrepancies, inefficiencies, or outdated processes

• Assist in building SOPs, cleanup reports, and dashboard summaries

• Support long-term audit readiness and tax prep by organizing financial records and documentation



Ideal Candidate Profile

• 3+ years of accounting or bookkeeping experience — **REQUIRED** in property management, real estate investing, or construction

• Strong experience in Buildium, QuickBooks Online,  and Microsoft Excel/Sheets

• Understands key categories like CapEx vs OpEx, owner contributions, investor tracking, and job costing

• Obsessed with detail and documentation

• Highly organized and proactive in communication

• Has experience working with U.S.-based teams and remote tools like Slack, Zoom, Google Drive



Working Hours

• Full-time: 40 hours/week

• Schedule: 9:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. CST (Chicago time), Monday through Friday

• Must be available during core hours for meetings, reporting, and collaboration



Compensation & Growth

• Competitive pay based on experience

• Performance-based bonuses available for systems cleanup, reporting accuracy, and leadership

• Opportunity to grow into a Controller-level role or team lead in 2024–2025

• Work directly with U.S. leadership and be part of a high-growth remote company



How to Apply



Please

title: Maintenance Coordinator for Property Management
description:
Altus Property Partners is a leading property management and real estate investment firm specializing in residential and multifamily properties. We are committed to maintaining high standards in property management by ensuring effective maintenance and prompt resolution of tenant, owners issues. We seek a dedicated Maintenance Coordinator to join our team and contribute to our mission of enhancing property value and tenant satisfaction. 



 Responsibilities: 



 Maintenance Coordination: 



- Oversee general maintenance and coordinate specialized vendor services as required. 

- Troubleshoot minor maintenance issues to determine if in-house staff or third-party vendors should be deployed. 

- Manage and schedule repairs, ensuring efficient resolution and high-quality service. 

- Utilize Property Meld to communicate directly with tenants and vendors, facilitating transparent and direct interaction. 



 Vendor and Project Management: 



- Source and evaluate vendors, obtaining estimates and adding new vendors to our systems. 

- Negotiate pricing where applicable, aiming to optimize costs while maintaining service quality. 

- Coordinate with in-house maintenance teams and external contractors to ensure timely completion of work. 



 Reporting and Performance Monitoring: 



- Monitor and report on key performance indicators such as speed of repair, tenant satisfaction ratings, response times, and cost management through Property Meld. 



 Tenant Relations: 



- Manage tenant interactions primarily through Property Meld to ensure all communications are logged and actionable. 

- Provide exceptional customer service, addressing tenant needs and ensuring satisfaction with maintenance efforts. 



 Emergency Management: 



- Handle maintenance emergencies during business hours, with management taking over after hours. 

- Develop protocols to ensure quick response and effective resolution of emergency maintenance issues. 

3

 Essential Qualifications: 



- Experience: Prior experience as a Maintenance Coordinator, preferably within a property management or real estate setting. Familiarity with general maintenance tasks and vendor management is essential. 

- Technical Skills: Proficiency in using property management software such as Buildium, Property Meld, and GoHighLevel CRM. 

- Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to clearly convey repair needs and coordinate effectively between tenants, vendors, and management. 

- Problem-Solving Skills: Strong analytical abilities and problem-solving skills to handle maintenance issues efficiently and devise effective solutions. 

- Organizational Skills: Exceptional organizational and time-management skills, capable of managing multiple tasks simultaneously under tight deadlines. 



 Working Conditions: 



- This position is fully remote and requires the Maintenance Coordinator to be available during US Central Time hours. The role includes standard working hours with potential for occasional weekend and evening work to address urgent maintenance issues. 

  

 Compensation and Benefits: 



- Competitive salary based on experience 

- Opportunities for professional development and career growth 

- Supportive work environment focused on innovation and efficiency 



This is a full-time job.



US Central Standard Time Working Hours



Application Process: 



To get an interview, please send an
 to 
 (Exact
 subject: Altus Maintenance Coordinator) the following:

1. Summary of your work experience. Please highlight your executive/admin assistant experience.

2. PDF copy of your Resume/CV.

3. A screenshot of your internet speed. 
/

title: Virtual Assistant Recruitment Manager
description:

• Shortlist top-tier candidates based on skills, communication, and culture fit

• Evaluate English fluency and confidence

• Assess technical skill level (Admin, ISA, Marketing, Operations, etc.)

• Organize qualified candidates into structured talent pools

• Coordinate final interviews between clients and candidates

• Improve and refine the recruitment process over time



Bonus Skills



• Experience recruiting for U.S.-based real estate teams



What We’re Looking For



• 2+ years experience in recruitment or talent acquisition

• Experience hiring Virtual Assistants or remote staff (preferred)

• Strong English communication skills (verbal + written)

• Confident conducting live interviews

• Organized and detail-oriented

• Comfortable using ATS/CRM systems

Key Traits We Value

What Success Looks Like

Why Join Divine Growth?

You’ll be building a talent ecosystem that helps business owners buy back their time.



We are scaling fast and looking for someone who wants to grow into a leadership role within the company.



Please send us a short one-person voice recording (1–5 minutes) answering the questions below.

How to record using Vocaroo:



Go to 

Click Record and allow microphone access.

Record your answers (1–5 minutes).



Click Stop, then Save and Share.



Copy the shareable link.



Questions to answer in your recording:



Please introduce yourself and briefly share your background.

What type of virtual assistant or role are you most experienced in?

Why do you believe you would be a great fit for this role?

What tools or systems have you used that are relevant to this position?

What are your availability and preferred working hours?



Once finished, simply reply to this
 and paste the Vocaroo link in your message.



You may also use Loom (audio only) or a phone voice recording if you prefer.

title: Head of AI Photo & Creative Design
description:
About Us:

We are a luxury jewelry brand focused on stunning visual storytelling. Our products , especially engagement rings and fine jewelry , deserve world-class visuals that capture attention and drive engagement. We are now looking for a creative leader to take our imagery and content to the next level.



Position Overview



We are seeking an experienced, highly creative Head of AI Photos & Creative Design to lead all visual content creation. You will be responsible for producing high-quality AI-generated on-model photos, product photos, and creative social media assets including Reels, Instagram posts, Pinterest content, and website imagery. You will help establish and maintain our brand aesthetic across all platforms.



What You’ll Be Responsible For



???? Generate high-quality AI photos — on-model lifestyle images, product photos (especially rings and jewelry), and styled visuals that align with our brand.

???? Create engaging social content designs for:

• Instagram Reels

• Feed posts

• Pinterest pins

• Stories & carousel graphics

???? Edit, refine, and enhance visuals to ensure top-tier quality.

???? Post and organize content across platforms (website, IG, Pinterest, etc.) with consistency.

???? Develop creative concepts and visual storytelling ideas to drive engagement and conversions.

???? Collaborate closely with marketing to ensure visuals support campaigns and brand direction.



Ideal Qualifications



? Strong experience with AI image generation tools (e.g., Midjourney, Leonardo, DALL-E, etc.)

? Proficient in graphic design and photo editing (Photoshop, Illustrator, Canva, etc.)

? Background in creative social media content (Reels, IG posts, Pinterest design)

? Excellent sense of composition, lighting, styling, and brand aesthetic

? Ability to consistently deliver high-quality visuals with creativity and detail

? Strong time-management skills and ability to meet deadlines

? Experience with e-commerce visuals a plus (especially jewelry or fashion)

title: Assistant Project Manager (Construction)
description:
JOB OVERVIEW

About Us

We are a rapidly growing construction builder and developer based in the Cupertino, Bay Area, backed by AlphaX RE Capital. Our projects range from single-family homes and ADUs to larger community developments. We emphasize precision, efficiency, structured bidding, and disciplined project management across every stage of the construction process.



Core Responsibilities

(Cost Management, Bidding & Project Coordination Focus)

- Assist in preparing project cost budgets, including preliminary estimates, detailed budgets, and cost baselines, supporting both pre-construction bidding and active project phases.

- Support bidding and procurement processes, including bid package preparation, subcontractor outreach coordination, bid leveling, scope comparison, and pricing analysis.

- Review and analyze bids, subcontractor proposals, and material quotations, supporting cost comparison, value engineering, and award recommendations.

- Perform cost control and dynamic cost tracking, monitoring actual expenditures against approved budgets throughout the project lifecycle.

- Prepare regular cost forecasts, variance analyses, and financial reports for project managers and executive teams.

- Track and document cost impacts from change orders, scope clarifications, and schedule adjustments, maintaining accurate cost logs and backup documentation.

- Support project management functions, including coordination of schedules, procurement timelines, contracts, and cost-related project documentation.

- Assist with schedule–cost alignment, identifying potential budget risks related to sequencing, delays, or scope changes.

- Collaborate remotely with architects, engineers, designers, and contractors to maintain alignment on cost, scope, and schedule impacts across project phases.



Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

- Strong understanding of construction budgeting, estimating, cost control, forecasting, and bid evaluation processes.

- Working knowledge of project management principles, including schedule coordination, procurement tracking, and contract administration support.

- Proficient with project management software and remote collaboration platforms.

- Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills, with the ability to support multiple projects simultaneously.

- Ability to interpret construction drawings, specifications, and scopes of work for bidding, procurement, and cost control purposes.

- Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, Architecture, or a related field.

- 2+ years of experience in construction cost control, estimating, bidding support, or project coordination roles.

- Professional certifications (e.g., PMP, OSHA, cost-related credentials) are a plus.



Preferred Qualifications (Not Required)

- Familiarity with California building codes, permitting processes, and construction standards

- Experience using Procore or similar construction management platforms

- Working knowledge of MS Project for schedule tracking, cost reporting, and workflow coordination

- Chinese language skills



Job Overview

- Remote

9:00 am – 5:30 pm (California Time)
