title: E-Commerce Finance Specialist
description:
Your mission is simple: Give us financial clarity and stability — every single day. You will own the full finance function of a fast-growing 7-figure e-commerce company. From treasury to bookkeeping, accounts payable to reporting, you’ll ensure our financial engine is accurate, up-to-date, insightful, and efficient.



This is not a passive finance role. You won’t just “record numbers.” You will interpret them, question them, improve them, and drive decisions with them. We’re looking for a detail-obsessed, fast-moving Finance Specialist with strong e-commerce experience (3–5+ years), preferably in a Shopify-based business.



You should be meticulous and structured — but also proactive, strategic, and two steps ahead. Someone who sees problems before they arise and builds systems to prevent them. You'll be the person ensuring our books are accurate, our cash flow is clear, our forecasts make sense, our payments run on time, and our profitability is razor sharp across SKUs, vendors, and channels.



Key Responsibilities :

1. Financial Operations & Bookkeeping

? Own the full lifecycle of accounts payable and treasury, including loading vendor payments, managing approval flows, sending proof of payments, and maintaining organized financial records

? Reconcile, track and monitor all cash inflows and outflows, including customer orders, Shopify payouts, refunds, fees, chargebacks etc

? Maintain accurate, up-to-date books across Xero 

? Manage all dealer portal payments, and meticulously track vendor credits, refunds, and financial adjustments



2. Reporting & Financial Intelligence

? Maintain accurate monthly P&Ls, cash flow statements, and other financial reports using visual dashboards and data-driven tools

? Provide weekly and monthly financial reporting with clear insights, recommendations, and action points

? Perform SKU-level profitability analysis, identifying best sellers, low-margin items, fast movers, and opportunities for growth.

? Conduct vendor performance reviews, assessing profitability, reliability, and financial risk

? Build dashboards and models that give leadership real-time visibility into performance, profitability, and trends

? Identify financial inefficiencies, cash leaks, or risks — and proactively propose solutions



3. Systems, Processes & Automation

? Maintain and optimize financial data across the Order Management System (OMS) and all relevant integrations

? Use Google Sheets and other tools to build automated trackers, dashboards, reconciliation sheets, and financial models



4. Strategic Finance & Business Support

? Act as the company’s financial truth source, ensuring all decisions are driven by accurate and reliable data

? Flag financial risks early and provide actionable recommendations. 



To excel in this role, you must be able/have the following:

? 3+ years of hands-on eCommerce finance experience (Shopify experience strongly preferred)

? Fluent in English, both written and verbal — clear communication is critical

? Hands-on experience building P&Ls, cash flow statements and budgets

? Strong experience with accounting tools such as Xero, Zoho, or QuickBooks

? Strong Google Sheets skills (advanced formulas preferred)

? Experience with treasury and the full banking function of accounts payable.

? Experience with reconciliation in fast-moving e-commerce environments

? Experience with Order management systems /ERP finance data (bonus)

? Provide deep financial clarity that empowers the founder to make bold, informed decisions with confidence



Personal Traits:

? You're highly detail-oriented - accuracy is your superpower and you notice when a single number is off

? You think in financial models, systems, spreadsheets, and clarity

? You are obsessed with consistency and financial hygiene

? You are a strong analytical thinker who can turn numbers into business insights

? You love turning financial chaos into clarity

? You’re calm, responsible, reliable, and execution-focused



What’s in it for you?

???? Competitive Salary – Earn a market related salary of up to $1000 for the right candidate ( depends on experience) 

 ???? Fully Remote – Work from anywhere with full flexibility 

???? Growth & Influence – Be part of a 7-figure brand on track to scale fast, your work will shape how the entire company operates 

???? 10 days paid time off– Recharge and refresh with flexible PTO 

???? Performance Bonuses – Earn more based on the results you help drive 

???? Creative Freedom – Take messy ideas and build elegant, efficient solutions

** Please Note: This is a remote contractor role. Salary is gross and you are responsible for handling local taxes in your country of residence.



If this role sounds like a perfect fit, we’d love to hear from you. Apply here -

s — we solve real operational challenges at scale. We bring structure, speed, and clarity to a complex supply chain.

, and live chat, ensuring fast, clear, and personalized communication.

Coordinate daily with suppliers to ensure smooth fulfillment, resolve delays, manage backorders, and process RMAs, returns, and warranties.

Maintain clean, accurate records inside Shopify, ClickUp, helpdesk tools, and Google Sheets, following all SOPs with precision.

Respond to and intercept chargebacks, communicate with customers to resolve disputes, and document all resolution steps.

Intercept shipments when needed to prevent incorrect or unwanted deliveries and coordinate actions with suppliers and Manage and maintain the Order Management System (OMS) to ensure all orders, statuses, timelines, and notes stay clean and up-to-date.

Troubleshoot customer issues quickly, take full ownership of complex cases, and proactively prevent problems before they reach the customer.

Deliver a concierge-level customer experience that reflects professionalism, clarity, and brand consistency.

Identify patterns, recurring issues, and opportunities to improve processes — and communicate insights to leadership.

Act as the bridge between customers, suppliers, and internal operations, ensuring seamless communication and smooth execution end-to-end.



To excel in this role, you must be able/have the following:

Fluent, accent-neutral English (C1/C2 level) — clear verbal and written communication is non-negotiable

1+ year of hands-on customer service experience (eCommerce experience strongly preferred)

Experience supporting customers across phone,
, and live chat

Ability to manage order tracking, supplier coordination, RMAs, returns, and shipping issues

Strong comfort using tools like Shopify, ClickUp, Gorgias/Helpdesk, Google Sheets, etc.

Ability to follow SOPs with precision while maintaining clean documentation

Strong organizational skills — able to manage multiple customer threads and timelines without losing details

Experience working inside an eCommerce environment (preferred, not required)

Ability to troubleshoot issues quickly and provide clear, solution-oriented responses

Demonstrated reliability — consistent attendance, strong follow-through, and accountability

Personal Traits:

You are patient, calm under pressure, and capable of handling stressful situations professionally

You think clearly, communicate clearly, and stay composed — even when dealing with difficult customers

You move fast without sacrificing accuracy

You’re a problem-solver — you can think deeply and make sound decisions on the fly

You anticipate issues before the customer ever feels them

You’re highly organized and detail-oriented — loose ends bother you

You take ownership — if something is unclear, you figure it out; if something breaks, you fix it

You’re reliable, consistent, and take pride in delivering a world-class experience

You’re coachable, open to feedback, and always improving

You’re naturally helpful, empathetic, and solutions-driven



What’s in it for you?

Competitive Salary

Fully Remote – Work from anywhere with full flexibility

Growth & Influence – Be part of a fast-scaling 7-figure brand where your work directly shapes the customer experience

10 Days Paid Time Off – Recharge and refresh with flexible PTO

Performance Bonuses – Earn more based on company and team results

Strong Team Culture – Join a supportive, disciplined team built on clarity, communication, and ownership

Please Note: This is a remote contractor role. Salary is gross and you are responsible for handling local taxes in your country of residence.



How to Apply

If this role sounds like a perfect fit, we’d love to hear from you. Here’s how to apply:

title: Senior Full-Stack Developer
description:
Senior Full-Stack Developer



About BoatBouncer

BoatBouncer is a peer-to-peer boat rental platform connecting boat owners with renters. We're looking for an experienced full-stack developer to resolve critical production issues along with development of new features.



Project Overview

This is a time-sensitive, focused engagement to resolve two specific issues on our platform:



This opportunity is full time, but can accommodate some part time employment.



Required Qualifications

Must-Have Experience:



3+ years of full-stack web development experience

Proven expertise with Next.js (React framework)

Strong Node.js and Express.js backend development

Demonstrated experience with MongoDB database design and optimization

Mapbox API integration and geolocation services

RESTful API design and debugging

Nice-to-Have Skills

Previous experience with rental/marketplace platforms

We're looking for a

You'll be the creative engine behind our partners' growth—testing, optimizing, and producing winning ads that drive real results.



What We Offer



Base Pay: $5/hour Performance-Based Bonuses (based on client retention & winning creative production) Fully Remote – No on-site work required Rapid Growth Opportunity – We're hiring fast for scale; room to grow into a Senior Media Buyer or Creative Director role Be Part of an innovative, high-growth agency scaling a proven system

mbers. Results-Obsessed – You're motivated by winning creatives and seeing partners hit their growth targets.  ads.

Bonus pay (based on client retention & winning creative production)

Work from home Rapid growth opportunity



Schedule:



Flexible hours (40+ hours/week expected) Day shift

title: Account Coverage Coordinator
description:
Account Coverage Coordinator - Ally Logistics



ABOUT ALLY LOGISTICS:

Ally Logistics is a U.S.-based third-party logistics (3PL) company headquartered in Grand Rapids, Michigan. Since 2012, we’ve been committed to creating the ultimate freight shipping experience by operating at the optimal intersection of people and technology.As a full-service 3PL, we specialize in a wide range of freight solutions, including dry van, refrigerated, drayage, straight truck, open deck/flatbed, drop-trailer programs, warehousing, and more. Our diverse service capabilities allow us to support shippers across industries with flexible, reliable, and scalable logistics strategies.

We partner with skilled global talent to support our continued growth and operational excellence, ensuring our customers receive efficient, high-quality service at every step of the supply chain.



ROLE SUMMARY:



The Account Coverage Coordinator is responsible for ensuring timely and reliable coverage of customer freight by executing same-day or next-day load sourcing with accuracy and urgency. This role manages a high volume of shipments—updating 80–150 loads per day—while maintaining strong communication and operational efficiency. Key responsibilities include coverage on same and next-day loads,  dispatching carriers, performing thorough track-and-trace, extracting and relaying critical customer updates, and sourcing capacity for specific lanes. Success in this position requires exceptional multitasking, attention to detail, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-volume logistics environment.



Regular Weekly Schedule (40 hours): Monday – Friday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM Eastern Standard Time with 1-hour unpaid lunch break from 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM Eastern. Overtime (40+ hours in a week) requires manager approval.



JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES: 

-Under the direction of management, the following outlines the core responsibilities for this position. Duties may evolve -based on business needs.

-Manage same-day and next-day freight coverage for Aldi, including dry van, refrigerated, and other equipment types

-Dispatch drivers and perform proactive track-and-trace for Aldi-specific loads and lanes

-Extract and communicate critical customer updates to the internal Aldi team and, when appropriate, Aldi leadership

-Effectively manage a high-volume workload - 80–150 loads per day

-Source and secure coverage for Aldi-specific lanes and support future Aldi-related projects and initiatives



KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS (KPIs):

-Successfully working with carriers and booking at least 25+ difficult loads per day

-Effectively communicate and manage a high-volume account, supporting 80–150 loads per day with accuracy and responsiveness

-Completing 50–100 outbound calls per day, depending on Aldi volume

-Additional KPIs may be added or adjusted at management’s discretion



REQUIRED SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:

-Minimum of 3 years of experience in logistics/3PL industry

-Minimum of 4 years of experience in the customer service industry

-Strong written and verbal English communication skills

-Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

-Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.



Access to:

-A reliable computer with  high-speed internet

--Backup internet source (mobile hotspot or secondary line preferred)

-Webcam + microphone for Zoom calls

-Headset

-Professional remote workspace

-Ability to work U.S. business hours (EST)



Experience with:

-Outlook

-Zoom phone

-Slack

-Basic CRM or logistics platform



Additional Requirements

1. Technology & Equipment Requirements

-Reliable high-speed internet and computer

-Webcam + microphone for Zoom calls

0Quiet, professional workspace



2. Availability Requirements

-Ability to work U.S. Eastern Time

-Must provide advanced notice for planned time off

-Must maintain consistent communication (Slack responsiveness,
, etc.)

title: CFO - CPA Accountant
description:
Job Summary



We are seeking a highly experienced and strategically minded Chief Financial Officer (CFO) to lead and oversee the full financial, managerial accounting, tax, and treasury functions of our group of companies. The CFO will be responsible for ensuring sound financial governance, borrowing and funding oversight, accounting and tax compliance, and long-term financial strategy aligned with the organisation’s growth objectives.



This role requires exceptional professionalism, integrity, maturity, and leadership. The successful candidate will act as a trusted advisor to executive leadership, providing clear financial insight, risk management, and strategic direction while maintaining strong operational control over all finance-related functions.



Key Responsibilities



Lead and oversee all financial, managerial accounting, tax, and treasury functions across the group



Prepare, review, and approve consolidated financial statements and tax returns in accordance with applicable accounting standards



Ensure full compliance with statutory requirements, tax legislation, and financial reporting obligations



Oversee borrowing, funding structures, cash flow management, and relationships with financial institutions



Direct budgeting, forecasting, and long-term financial planning processes



Provide financial analysis and strategic insights to support executive and board-level decision-making



Oversee tax planning, submissions, audits, and engagements relating to income tax, payroll tax, and other applicable taxes



Manage relationships with external auditors, regulators, banks, and professional advisors



Design, implement, and maintain robust internal controls, financial governance, and risk management frameworks



Identify financial, operational, and regulatory risks and develop mitigation strategies



Lead, mentor, and develop the finance team, fostering a culture of accountability, accuracy, and continuous improvement



Oversee finance-related projects and ensure timely delivery across multiple workstreams



Qualifications & Requirements



Certified Public Accountant (CPA) designation or equivalent professional qualification (mandatory)



Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field (Master’s degree or MBA advantageous)



Minimum of 3–5 years post-qualification experience in senior financial leadership roles



Strong technical knowledge of accounting standards, tax legislation, and financial regulations



Proven experience in financial reporting, tax compliance, audit management, and treasury functions



Demonstrated ability to operate at both strategic and operational levels



Advanced proficiency in accounting systems, financial reporting tools, and Microsoft Excel



Exceptional attention to detail, analytical ability, and sound commercial judgment



Strong leadership, communication, project management, and multi-tasking skills

title: Energy Sage Remote Sales Representative (Solar Sales)
description:
ABOUT SUNSENT



SunSent is a fast-growing U.S.-based solar and roofing company. We are expanding our solar division and looking for a highly detail-oriented and disciplined Energy Sage Remote Sales Representative to support inbound solar leads and help convert opportunities into closed deals.



We are looking for someone analytical, structured, and process-driven, someone who thrives in follow-ups, documentation, and consistent pipeline management.



ROLE OVERVIEW



- As our Energy Sage Remote Sales Representative, you will:

- Manage and respond to inbound solar leads from the Energy Sage platform

- Conduct follow-ups via call,
, and SMS

- Qualify prospects and move them through the pipeline

- Coordinate with internal U.S. tea
mbers

- Maintain accurate CRM updates and notes

- Track opportunities and ensure timely responses

- You will report directly to our U.S.-based Sales Leader



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS



- Proven solar sales experience (required)

- Strong understanding of U.S. residential solar market

- Comfortable handling objections and closing sales

- Excellent written and spoken English

- Highly organized and process-driven

- Strong follow-up discipline

- Must be comfortable working U.S. business hours (Central Standard TIme)



NICE TO HAVE



- Familiarity with the Energy Sage platform



COMPENSATION



Compensation will be discussed during the interview process.

Two structures are being considered:

1. Straight commission model (higher earnings per job sold)

2. Weekly base + commission per job sold



Final structure will be discussed directly with shortlisted candidates.



WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR



We are specifically looking for candidates who are:

- Detail-oriented

- Structured and consistent

- Strong in follow-up and documentation

- Data-driven and process-focused



(We utilize Culture Index as part of our hiring process.)



HOW TO APPLY 



To apply, please submit:



1. Your updated resume

2. A short message explaining your solar sales experience

3. Only shortlisted candidates will move to the next stage.



We’re excited to meet a disciplined, driven solar sales professional ready to grow with SunSent.



Apply now!

title: Production & Supply Chain Manager
description:
We are an international trading company supplying kitchen & household products to major retailers in the Israeli market.

We work with multiple factories across China and Vietnam and manage large-scale production, quality control, and global logistics.



We are looking for a full-time Virtual Production & Supply Chain Manager to join our growing team for the long term.



This is a key position with direct communication with factories, freight forwarders, and management.



Responsibilities



• Manage daily communication with factories in China & Vietnam

• Follow up on production schedules and delivery timelines

• Ensure orders move smoothly from purchase order ? production ? inspection ? shipment

• Prevent delays, mistakes, and misunderstandings

• Coordinate booking with freight forwarders

• Monitor documents (PI, packing list, BL, etc.)

• Track samples, approvals, and packaging progress

• Maintain organized reports and order follow-up files

• Support problem solving when production or logistics issues arise



Requirements



• Proven experience in production / supply chain / sourcing

• Must have experience working with Chinese factories

• Strong understanding of manufacturing processes and export procedures

• Highly organized, detail-oriented, and responsible

• Excellent written and spoken English

• Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects

• Looking for a long-term position in a growing international company



Experience in kitchen & household products is an advantage, but not mandatory.



What We Offer



• Full-time, stable, long-term role

• Work directly with international management

• Opportunity to grow with a fast-expanding global trading company

• High responsibility and impact

title: Senior PPC Expert
description:
Position Overview

As a Senior Amazon PPC Strategist, you will take ownership of the strategy, execution, and optimization of high-impact Amazon advertising campaigns across multiple client accounts. You will be responsible for driving revenue growth, improving ROI, and shaping the strategic direction of PPC initiatives while collaborating closely with internal teams and guiding junior specialists when needed.



Key Responsibilities:



•Lead and manage complex Amazon advertising accounts across multiple brands

•Design and implement advanced campaign structures aligned with business objectives

•Analyze and optimize performance metrics (ACoS, ROAS, CTR, CPC, TACoS, etc.)

•Develop data-driven strategies to scale profitable campaigns and control spend

•Identify trends, risks, and growth opportunities, and provide actionable recommendations

•Collaborate with design and creative teams to develop effective ad creatives

•Mentor and support junior PPC specialists to ensure best practices and consistency

•Stay updated on Amazon Ads trends, algorithm changes, and platform innovations

•Prepare and present weekly/monthly performance reports and strategic insights



Skills & Requirements:



•5+ years of proven hands-on experience managing Amazon PPC campaigns, preferably in an agency or multi-brand environment

•Deep expertise in Amazon Ads (Sponsored Products, Sponsored Brands, Sponsored Display)

•Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex performance data

•Experience with Amazon Marketing Cloud (AMC) and/or DSP is a strong advantage

•Proficiency with PPC tools such as Helium 10, Intentwise, or similar platforms

•Strong understanding of keyword strategy, bid optimization, A/B testing, and budget management

•Highly detail-oriented with a strong focus on ROI and profitability

•Excellent problem-solving skills and proactive mindset

•Ability to manage multiple accounts and deadlines in a fast-paced environment

•Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

•Ability to work independently while collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams

title: Marketing & Relationship Support Coordinator
description:
Company Overview:



Core Strategy Partners is a mission-driven consulting firm leveraging human-centered design and evidence-based strategies to help organizations create meaningful, sustainable impacts. We partner closely with our clients to deliver innovative, strategic solutions tailored to their unique challenges.

________________________________________



Position Purpose:



The Marketing & Relationship Support Coordinator helps drive visibility, deepen relationships, and position Core Strategy Partners as a trusted thought leader. This role supports marketing and business development by leading content strategy, conducting industry research, and creatively developing assets that reflect our brand. This person ensures the CEO can focus on high-value interactions by managing marketing efforts and relationship workflows with intelligence, curiosity, and creativity.

________________________________________



You’ll Thrive in This Role If You…



Get It:

You are both a strategist and a doer. You understand how strategic marketing, thought leadership, and meaningful content fuel visibility and business growth.

Want It:

You love digging into research, crafting compelling content, learning and using new tools (including AI), and helping a brand stand out with clarity and creativity.

Have the Capacity to Do It:

You’re experienced in content, marketing, or communications. You’re savvy with CRMs, Canva, and AI, and you know how to manage all the moving parts without dropping the ball.

________________________________________



Core Responsibilities:



1. Content Research & Strategy

• Conduct industry research to surface relevant trends, insights, and timely topics.

• Identify and monitor trusted sources, curating content ideas that align with Core Strategy Partners’ focus.

• Use AI tools to brainstorm, accelerate content creation, and enhance storytelling.



Performance Expectations:

• Consistent pipeline of strategic, insight-driven content ideas and themes.

• Content supports company visibility and CEO thought leadership.



2. Creative Content Development

• Create engaging, visually appealing, and polished assets quickly using Canva and other tools.

• Draft compelling LinkedIn posts, short articles, visuals, and
 content.

• Collaborate on development of monthly or bi-monthly newsletters and lead generation content.



Performance Expectations:

• High-quality content aligned with brand voice and tone.

• Audience engagement across channels (opens, clicks, comments, shares).



3. LinkedIn Visibility & Engagement

• Manage CEO’s and company’s LinkedIn presence to strategically boost visibility.

• Schedule and publish high-impact posts that generate qualified interactions.

• Actively monitor and respond to engagement, helping turn interest into relationships.



Performance Expectations:

• Growth in relevant followers, engagement (comments, messages), and profile visibility.

• Regular insights on what content resonates and drives connections.



4. CRM & Relationship Workflow Management

• Manage relationship workflows using Pipedrive 
s, touchpoints, follow-ups).

• Ensure timely engagement with contacts and regular status updates.

• Provide CEO with weekly or bi-weekly dashboard reports on relationship health.



Performance Expectations:

• No missed follow-ups; CEO is empowered with insights and data.

• Target relationships are nurtured consistently and strategically.



5.
 Campaigns & Newsletter Execution

• Prepare and distribute
 campaigns and newsletters using Mailchimp (or similar platform).

• Segment lists, track performance, and make improvements based on metrics.



Performance Expectations:

• Regular
 communications with clear engagement results.

• Data-informed adjustments to improve content and outreach strategy.



6. Report & Thought Leadership Launch Support

• Builds repeatable launch playbooks for reports

• Helps package reports into smaller assets (exec brief,
 sequences, mini-decks)

• Coordinates outreach materials for different audiences



7. Website Analytics & SEO Monitoring

• Regularly review website traffic and SEO performance using Google Analytics and other tools. 

• Track keywords, traffic trends, and provide monthly summaries with recommendations.

• Identify and implement small SEO optimizations to improve visibility, such as keyword research, internal link improvements, blog optimization, etc.



Performance Expectations:

• Monthly reports with actionable insights.

• Clear understanding of how marketing efforts impact traffic and visibility.

________________________________________



Key Skills & Attributes



• Incredibly curious, resourceful, and a fast learner.

• Creative thinker with a strong sense of storytelling and visual design. Doesn’t wait to be told what to post, they propose the content strategy and execute it.

• Strategic mindset—always thinking about how content supports larger goals.

• Comfortable using Canva, LinkedIn, and AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Jasper, Claude).

• Organized, proactive, and confident managing multiple priorities independently.

• Experience with CRMs (ideally Pipedrive),
 marketing platforms (e.g., Mailchimp), and analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics).

________________________________________



To apply, please submit:



1. Your resume

2. A short cover letter answering:

-Why this role excites you

-Your experience with LinkedIn content and marketing campaigns

3. Include the phrase: “Strategic visibility drives growth” in the first line of your cover letter.



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be reviewed.

title: Systems & Automation Specialist
description:
About the Role



We are a small U.S.-based real estate company looking for a hands-on systems specialist to help maintain, improve, and evolve our Lofty CRM, Zapier automations, and related workflows in the technical space.



This role is ideal for someone who enjoys building and improving systems in a real operating business, not just maintaining them. While you will execute many clearly defined tasks, we also welcome thoughtful suggestions and improvements when you see opportunities.



Core Responsibilities



CRM & Automations

 • Work directly inside Lofty CRM

 • Build, adjust, and maintain Zapier automations

 • Monitor lead flow and data integrity

 • Troubleshoot and fix broken workflows

 • Suggest improvements to make systems more reliable, simpler, or more efficient

 • Document changes and logic clearly



Systems Thinking & Improvement

 • Identify friction points in existing workflows

 • Propose improvements or refinements before building

 • Help simplify processes where possible

 • Flag risks, redundancies, or failure points



(You will not be expected to redesign everything, but good ideas are welcome and encouraged.)



Websites & Execution Support

 • Update WordPress-based buyer and seller websites

 • Verify forms, links, and opt-ins are functioning correctly

 • Manage Google Ad SEO Keywords

 • Support deal posting and opt-in flows when requested



Light Marketing Execution

 • Post content or deal updates to:

 • Website 

 •

 • Instagram

 •
 (MailChimp) and Text (SlickText) blasts

 • Google My Business (as needed)

 • Ensure posts and links are accurate and live



What We’re Looking For

 • CRM experience is required

 • Experience building or maintaining Zapier automations

 • Comfortable working independently with limited supervision

 • Clear written communication in English

 • Organized, detail-oriented, and reliable

 • Willing to suggest improvements — but also able to execute quickly



Nice to Have (Not Required)

 • Experience with real estate CRMs or lead management

 • WordPress familiarity

 • Experience documenting systems or workflows



How We Work

 • We are a small, fast-moving team

 • We value clarity, reliability, and practical thinking

 • You’ll have room to make things better over time

 • Major system changes are discussed before implementation



Schedule & Pay

 • Full-time: 40 hours/week 

 • $7/hour

 • Long-term opportunity for the right person



How to Apply



Please include:

 1. Your experience with CRM's (what you’ve built or maintained)

 2. Examples of Zapier automations you’ve worked on

 3. One example of a system improvement you suggested or implemented in a past role

 4. To be considered, please include all of the following with your application. Incomplete submissions will not be reviewed.

     • A short screen video from speedtest.net showing your download speed, upload speed, and ping

     Screenshots will not be reviewed.

     • A short screen video showing your computer details, including:

          – laptop or desktop

          – operating system

          – processor

          – RAM

     • A short video showing the headset or microphone you use for calls and confirming it’s what you normally work with.

     • A short video (10–20 seconds is fine) showing your actual work setup and surrounding area.

     • Written confirmation that you can consistently work 8:00–5:00 PM US Eastern, Monday–Friday, and that you understand weekend shifts are occasional and added only if needed based on weekly volume.

     • Your current CV or resume attached.

title: Senior Experienced Project Manager & Call Handler (Property Maintenance & Renovations) – Remote Role
description:
Hello :)



PLEASE READ CAREFULLY BEFORE APPLYING 



We take great pride in our thorough and rigorous recruitment process. Please do NOT apply unless you have substantial experience working remotely in property maintenance and improvement – including handyman services, renovations, plumbing, and painting.



This is a fully remote position, and we are specifically looking for candidates who have previously worked remotely in this field.



We are not a property management company; we specialise in property maintenance. If you're unsure about the difference between the two, this role may not be the right fit for you. We need someone with extensive experience in maintenance, repairs, and refurbishments who understands the technical aspects of keeping properties in top condition and can effectively coordinate work from a remote setting.



Do you fit the role?

-Are you a highly experienced and skilled Project Manager (Maintenance Coordinator) with a passion for property maintenance and improvement?

- Do you have at least five years of remote work experience in this sector?

-Can you confidently handle client PHONE CALLS and manage communication professionally?

- Do you excel in time management, organisation, and remote team coordination?



If so, this could be a fantastic opportunity for you!



About Us

We are a well-respected property maintenance and improvement company based in London, UK. We focus on delivering high-quality services and take pride in our professionalism, attention to detail, and customer satisfaction.



Position Overview

We are looking for a Project Manager with at least five years of full-time remote experience in the property maintenance and improvement sector (covering renovations, plumbing, electrical, and handyman jobs). The ideal candidate will have a STRONG background in construction and renovation, with a very deep understanding of property maintenance challenges and solutions.



This role requires exceptional attention to detail, strong communication skills, and the ability to manage tasks efficiently from a remote setting.



Essential Requirements



1. Remote Experience

Minimum 3-5 years of experience in property maintenance and improvement, working remotely with construction or renovation companies. [PLEASE NOTE YOU MUST HAVE WORKED REMOTELY, WORKING FOR THE LOCAL MARKET IS NOT SUFFICIENT. ]

Experience in managing remote teams and coordinating jobs without being on-site.



2. Language & Communication

Fluent in spoken and written English, with a clear, neutral accent.



3. Job Management Systems & CRM

Proficiency in job management systems such as ServiceM8, 
, or similar.



4. Time Management & Administration

Ability to handle multiple tasks efficiently in a remote setting.



5. Telephone Skills

Exceptional phone skills for handling client inquiries, scheduling, and team coordination.



6. Initiative & Self-Motivation

Proactive and self-driven – someone who takes the initiative and continuously seeks process improvements.



7. Responsiveness & Urgency

Quick to respond to
s and phone calls, handling matters with a sense of urgency.

Comfortable with voice and video calls when required.



8. Quoting & Invoicing

Ability to prepare accurate quotes and invoices independently.



9. Note-Taking & Follow-Up

Excellent record-keeping – maintaining detailed notes on jobs, timesheets, and meetings, and ensuring timely follow-ups with customers and staff.



10. Staff Management

Experience in coordinating and managing field staff remotely.



11. Working Hours

8:00 AM – 5:30 PM GMT (UK Time) – you must be available during UK working hours.



Why Join Us?

-Work remotely with a reputable UK-based company.

- Join a passionate and professional team.

- Use your expertise to make a real impact.

- Be part of a company that values excellence, attention to detail, and high standards.



How to Apply

Please ONLY apply if you meet all the above requirements and have extensive experience in remote property maintenance coordination.



To apply:

1) Send your updated CV.

2) AT THE SAME TIME Record a short video (via Loom or Google Drive) explaining:



-Your relevant remote work experience.

-Why you are a great fit for this role. And how you can handle phone calls to make sales.





This ensures that only serious applicants who have read the job description carefully are considered.



Applications without a video will not be reviewed.





Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.





In summary





This role requires strong sales abilities and the confidence to engage with new clients over the phone. You must have a proven track record in selling property maintenance services to new customers on the phone, as this is not an easy job.



Fluency in UK English is essential—you must be able to communicate clearly, understand client needs, and convince potential customers to use our services. While training will be provided, this role is not suitable for those who have never sold to brand-new customers or lack experience in converting inquiries into bookings.



In summary, we need someone who can handle calls exceptionally well, build trust with clients, and demonstrate strong technical knowledge of the property maintenance sector to guide them effectively.



We look forward to welcoming an exceptional remote Project Manager / Maintenance Coordinator to our team!

title: Partner Support Specialist
description:
About Edstruments



Edstruments empowers K12 and nonprofit leaders with modern financial software spanning the Procure-to-Pay lifecycle and Budget Planning & Management. Our platform helps our partners align their spending and budgets to strategic objectives so that they can best achieve their mission. As a fast-growing startup, we add several new partners each month, and our platform is currently in use by organizations across multiple states in the US. We are seeking individuals who are excited to play a critical role in helping our partners achieve their missions.



Role Overview



The Partner Support Specialist will be the first line of defense on chat and
, helping our partners resolve technical and administrative issues, ensuring smooth communication, and troubleshooting challenges. You will manage incoming chats and
s, track tickets, and ensure partner needs are met efficiently. The role also involves vendor outreach, administrative tasks, and product setup for new clients. Over time, you will have opportunities to take on more advanced roles as you grow with the company.



Key Responsibilities



* First-Contact Resolution: Troubleshoot and resolve partner inquiries, ensuring a 70% first-contact resolution rate for partner inquiries. [Within the first 3 months of joining].

* Response Time: Respond to partner inquiries within 5 minutes for chats and 3 hours for
s during your regular business hours. [Ongoing].

* Ticket Management: Track and manage support tickets using a ticketing system (e.g., Zendesk, Freshdesk) to ensure all issues are resolved promptly. Close 90% of inquiries within 48 hours.

* Client Onboarding: Assist with the initial setup of our systems when a new client onboards to ensure successful data syncs with a 90% success rate.

* Vendor Outreach & Admin: Provide support with vendor outreach and administrative tasks, as needed. [Ongoing].

* Collaboration: Work with the Partner Success and Product teams to communicate findings from partner interactions and ensure partner needs are addressed. [Ongoing].



Key Outcomes



* Achieve a 4.5/5 satisfaction rating or higher for partner support interactions (chat/email).

* Close 90% of support tickets within 48 hours of receiving inquiries.

* Ensure 90% success rate for assigned client onboarding tasks.



Must-Have Qualifications



* 2+ years of experience in technical support, software support, or a related role.

* Strong technical aptitude and problem-solving skills, with the ability to learn and troubleshoot software-related issues.

* Experience with ticket tracking systems (e.g., Zendesk, Freshdesk) and a proven ability to resolve customer issues in a timely manner.

* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present technical information clearly to non-technical users.

* Strong attention to detail and excellent time management skills.

* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.



Preferred Qualifications



* Experience in customer support for SaaS platforms or other software solutions.

* Experience in vendor outreach or administrative tasks.

* Background in the education or nonprofit sectors is a plus.



Logistical Notes



This is a 100% remote role with a flexible start date, but availability during US Pacific Time business hours (8 am - 5 pm) is required.



Edstruments does not and will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender orientation, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status in any of its hiring decisions or other activities.



Why Edstruments?



* Mission-Driven Work: Work with a team passionate about improving financial processes for K12 and nonprofit organizations.

* Growth Opportunities: We offer potential for career advancement and development as the company scales.

* Remote Flexibility: Join a 100% remote team with a flexible start date.

title: Revenue Quality & Performance Lead- AUSTRALIA
description:
We are a growing Australian telehealth company generating high volumes of booked discovery calls each week.

Our revenue depends on one thing:

Turning booked calls into attended calls — and attended calls into paid consultations.

We are looking for a Revenue Quality & Performance Lead to take ownership of our daily sales performance tracking, reporting systems, funnel accountability, and call quality oversight.

This is not a basic VA role.

This is a numbers-focused performance role with quality responsibility.

If you enjoy working inside dashboards, spotting patterns early, reviewing call performance, and holding systems accountable — this role will suit you.



Your Core Responsibility

Your job is to protect and improve our revenue funnel performance by ensuring daily visibility, accuracy, accountability, and quality control.

You will own the numbers behind:



Calls booked

Calls attended (show rate)

Conversion rate

Revenue generated

On-time dial performance

Cancellation and no-show trends

You will also ensure that discovery calls are conducted according to company standards and sales process guidelines.



Key Responsibilities

• Pull daily reports from Pipedrive CRM / VOIP

 • Maintain and improve Google Sheets dashboards

 • Track daily and weekly KPI performance

 • Identify performance gaps and unusual trends

 • Flag issues immediately to leadership

 • Analyse no-show and cancellation patterns

 • Conduct call quality checks to ensure scripts and process standards are followed

 • Review a sample of recorded calls daily/weekly to identify compliance gaps

 • Provide structured performance feedback summaries to leadership

 • Help implement performance accountability systems

This role is hands-on and execution-focused.

 You will work closely with leadership to ensure discipline and quality inside the revenue engine.



Required Experience

You must have:

• 3+ years working with a CRM system (Pipedrive preferred)

 • Strong Google Sheets or Excel skills (formulas, reporting, clean data structure)

 • Experience building KPI dashboards

 • Experience tracking sales or appointment performance metrics

 • Experience reviewing call recordings or monitoring sales quality (preferred)

 • Excellent written and verbal English

 • High attention to detail

 • Comfort working with numbers every day



Strongly Preferred

• Experience in appointment-based or high-volume sales businesses

 • Experience improving show rates or conversion rates

 • Experience conducting call quality audits

 • Experience working with Australian, UK or US businesses



Working Hours

30 hours per week

 Must overlap with Australian business hours (AEST)

 Opportunity to move to full-time for the right person.





How to Apply:

Please submit:

Your CV

A short 2–3 minute video answering:

What KPIs have you tracked in a sales or revenue funnel?

Describe a dashboard you built.

How did you identify under performance and what action was taken?

What CRM systems have you used?

Your expected monthly salary (AUD)

Applications without a video will not be considered.

title: Acquisitions Closer – Real Estate
description:
Acquisitions Closer – Real Estate 



Are you process-driven, direct, and energized by real conversations?

We’re looking for a disciplined outbound sales professional based in the Philippines to connect with property owners facing urgent, complex situations—delinquent taxes, inherited estates, title issues, and more. Our sellers aren’t just “leads”—they’re people in transition who need straight answers and real solutions.



This is not a basic call center job.

If you’re skilled at asking the right questions, unafraid of hearing “no,” and want your compensation to reflect your results—not just your effort—read on.



Role Overview:



Primary focus: Outbound calling to distressed property owners—cold calls, follow-ups, and active pipeline management.



Objective: Uncover seller motivation, determine property fit, and guide owners to a clear outcome (offers or next steps).



Daily routine: High phone activity, rapid qualification, disciplined follow-up, accurate notes.



Pace: High volume, high accountability. Activity and results are tracked and reviewed.



Compensation Structure:



Base pay: Modest, for reliability.



Commission: Significant; your earnings scale with your results.



No ceiling: Top performers set their own income.



Underperformance: Addressed quickly—excuses are not accepted.



Environment & Expectations:



You control your own pipeline—but are measured daily.



Calls are monitored, results are tracked, and feedback is regular.



If you thrive in a disciplined, no-excuses culture, you’ll succeed here.



If you require micro-management or dislike structure and direct feedback, this will not be a fit.



What We’re Looking For:



Resilience: Can you keep dialing and qualifying, no matter how many rejections?



Clarity: Can you speak directly, ask difficult questions, and move conversations toward a decision?



Self-management: Do you measure your own output and seek improvement—without constant reminders?



Motivation: Are you truly driven by the opportunity to control your income?



Application Instructions – Read Carefully



Voice Recording (Required):

Send a 2–3 minute audio introduction (not read, not AI-generated).

Cover these points, in this order:



Your name and most relevant phone sales experience.



Why you’re a strong fit for conversations with distressed sellers (not just generic sales).



How you organize your workday to maintain consistent output, even when wins are delayed.



What excites you about commission-based earnings.



How you handle feedback and respond to strict accountability.



Applications missing the recording, or not following the format above, will not be considered.

Attach your resume as well.

Blockchain, Crypto & Digital Asset Companies—launch, token compliance, general counsel 

Tech Founders & Startups—capital raise, contracts, compliance, and strategic legal growth 

International Companies—U.S. market entry, SEC filings, regulatory advisory 

Venture Funds & Investors—due diligence, deal structuring, SEC documentation 





Key Responsibilities:



Provide legal and compliance support related to securities, tax, business, M&A, regulatory compliance, digital assets, capital markets, FinTech, and financial industry standards.

Review, draft, and maintain compliance documentation, policies, and procedures in accordance with U.S. regulatory requirements.

Conduct research and analysis on applicable laws, rules, and regulatory developments affecting the firm and its clients.

Assist with regulatory filings, due diligence, and risk assessments for financial transactions and investment activities.

Collaborate with internal teams and external clients to ensure adherence to ethical, legal, and compliance standards.

Support ongoing training, audit preparation, and compliance monitoring efforts across relevant business units.

Maintain clear communication with U.S.-based colleagues to ensure timely alignment on compliance issues.





Qualifications:



Must be a licensed lawyer in the Philippines (member of the Integrated Bar of the Philippines).

Minimum of 5 years’ experience in legal practice or compliance, preferably in securities, M&A, Fintech, corporate, or financial regulatory environments.

Knowledgeable in FINRA regulations, U.S. securities laws, and compliance frameworks.

Excellent research, drafting, and analytical skills with meticulous attention to detail.

Ability to work effectively within a multinational team and adapt to cross-border communication dynamics.

Must be based in the Philippines and available to work on a U.S. Eastern Time schedule.





Preferred Qualifications:



Previous experience working with U.S. clients or law firms, financial institutions, or compliance teams based in the U.S. is preferred but not required.

Familiarity with SEC and FINRA filing systems or experience with broker-dealer compliance.

Postgraduate studies or certifications in compliance, finance, or U.S. securities law are advantageous.





To Apply:



Submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and interest in the role, your expected hourly rate for 160 hours, or your monthly salary to

title: Storytelling, Journalism Content Writer (No AI Writers)
description:
Arispheris seeks an experienced and highly driven content writer responsible for creating written content for various platforms such as websites, blogs, social media, and marketing materials for a 3-month full-time project. Their main goal is to create engaging and informative content that will attract and retain the attention of their audience and to create eye-catching marketing and publication materials for online-based businesses, without the use of AI. You will also be responsible for coming up with original content for marketing materials for the company and its clients. They must have excellent writing and communication skills, as well as a strong understanding of SEO principles to create written content that is optimized for search engines, independent of any AI platforms.



You will be collaborating with tea
mbers in the Philippines and clients throughout the US and Europe; therefore, you must have excellent communication skills, a flexible schedule, and the ability to meet and work during specified time zones.



Company Overview

Arispheris is a staffing firm that provides authentic and connective staffing solutions for the small business owner. We provide in-depth recruiting processes to ensure that clients will have the best experience with our remote professionals.



We are actively seeking individuals with your abilities to join our team as we try to expand each of our departments. If you are interested in working remotely with a flexible schedule and demonstrating your creativity by crafting new and compelling written content for our company and diverse clients, then Arispheris is the company for you!



We seek a qualified candidate with the following qualifications for this position:

Bachelor's degree in English, journalism, marketing, or a related field

2+ years of experience in content writing, preferably in a professional setting

Excellent writing and editing skills, with a strong attention to detail, without the use of AI

Knowledge of SEO principles and experience optimizing content for search engines

Ability to research and gather information on various topics, without the use of AI

Strong communication skills and ability to work well in a team environment

Familiarity with content management systems (CMS) and basic HTML skills is a plus



Software & Platform Knowledge & Experience in the following:

Google Workspace

Canva

Microsoft Office Suites

Asana, Slack, Klayvio and Hubstaff

ClickFunnels and Shopfiy is a plus, but not required

Seeking: Expert Level in Excel/Google Sheets 



Job Highlights

Great compensation and benefits

Work-life balance

Work community incentives

Long-term career opportunity

Wonderful coworkers



Key responsibilities of a content writer include:



Researching and gathering information on various topics to create accurate and informative content, without the use of AI

Writing and editing engaging and SEO-friendly content for websites, blogs, social media, and marketing materials

Collaborating with tea
mbers, including designers and SEO specialists, to ensure content aligns with brand guidelines and SEO strategy

Collaborating with tea
mbers and clients to determine content needs and goals

Analyzing and measuring the success of content through metrics such as website traffic and engagement

Participating in brainstorming sessions to generate ideas for new written content

Ensuring all content is proofread and error-free before publication, without the use of AI

Developing ideas and creating outlines for new content

Reviewing and proofreading content for accuracy and grammar errors

Utilizing SEO best practices to optimize content for search engines

Updating and maintaining content on websites and other platforms

Interviewing clients to get acquainted with their overall business identity and branding preferences to create compelling content for the company and clients

Creating a directory and maintaining the organization of all content materials for the company and for each client.

Ensuring that contents and final deliverables comply with company and clients' guidelines, specifications, and preferences, and achieving the highest standard of written quality, without the use of AI.

Maintaining an eagerness to expand individual skillsets by utilizing company resources and leaning into areas of improvement.



The candidate we’re looking for has:

Unrivaled eye for writing, storytelling, creativity, and resourcefulness

Can write without using AI

Capability to create social media captions, postings, publication materials, and similar content on the fly.

Ability to adapt their writing style to fit the tone and audience of their projects

Exceptional verbal and written communication skills

Outstanding interpersonal skills and strong sense of collaboration with different departments

Ability to set priorities and meet deadlines

Comfortable providing suggestions to help the company and clients

Unparalleled attention to detail

Ability to work on multiple projects/clients simultaneously and adhere to strict deadlines

Ability to make evaluative judgments

Flexibility to create strategies quickly & effectively

Attentiveness & integrity

Friendly, emphatic, approachable, and professional demeanor

Ability to work well with internal and external parties



As a Content Writer, you may be entrusted with a variety of duties. The qualifications, responsibilities, and skill sets outlined above are merely a sampling of the duties that you will be responsible for. Job duties are expected to be carried out with minor to no supervision.



Compensation & Benefits

Full-time remote position (3-month term, potential for extension based on performance)

Competitive compensation based on experience and skills

Bi-monthly pay via money transfer

Paid career training relevant to the role

Performance-based bonuses

Work-life balance and flexible hours



How to Apply

We will be holding interviews on Wednesday, Friday, and Saturday of this and next week for immediate hiring, contingent on your skills, your interview task performance and company fit.



To Apply, Follow These Steps:

Reply with your Name and Position in the subject line. Example: "John Doe – Storytelling, Journalism, Writing Content Creator "

Share a story about your favourite food (this is part of your application process).



Submit the following:

Your resume (CV)

Portfolio links showcasing your original written work (no AI-generated content)

Publications you have written and published (if applicable)

title: WordPress & Shopify Store Developer
description:
Arispheris is looking for a highly skilled Website Developer to join our team for a 3-month full-time project term, with potential for extension. This is a remote position, but we require a designer who can work independently, take initiative, and bring fresh, original creativity to the table—no AI-generated websites will be accepted.



If you thrive in an environment that values creative autonomy, attention to detail, and hands-on design skills, we’d love to hear from you.



Company Overview

Arispheris is a staffing firm that provides authentic and connective staffing solutions for small business owners. We take pride in our in-depth recruiting process, ensuring that every professional we bring on board has the skills and drive to succeed.



We are actively expanding our design team and are looking for a Website Developer who excels at crafting fast and SEO ready websites to support clients in reaching their target audiences to increase revenue and website traffic. If you want to be part of a team that values true creative expertise, this is the perfect opportunity for you!



Requirements & Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Web development or related field, or relevant experience.

Minimum of 2 years of professional experience in website design and coding.

Website and software application designing, building, or maintaining, without AI.

Using scripting or authoring languages, management tools, content creation tools, applications, and digital media.

Conferring with teams to resolve conflicts, prioritize needs, develop content criteria, or choose solutions.

Directing or performing Website updates.

Developing or validating test routines and schedules to ensure that test cases mimic external interfaces and address all browser and device types.

Editing, writing, or designing Website content, and directing tea
mbers who produce content.

Maintaining an understanding of the latest Web applications and programming practices through education, study, and training. 

Back up files from Web sites to local directories for recovery.

Create daily logs of tasks completed for company and client reference.

Identifying problems uncovered by customer feedback and testing, and correcting or referring problems to appropriate personnel for correction.

Evaluating code to ensure it meets industry standards, is valid, is properly structured, and is compatible with browsers, devices, or operating systems.

Determining user needs by analyzing technical requirements.

Must be highly proficient in both WordPress, their respective plugins, & Shopify—you will be tested during the interview.

Strong sense of design composition.

Ability to create websites quickly and efficiently while maintaining a high standard of design quality.

Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with clients and teams.

Detail-oriented and capable of handling multiple projects at once while meeting deadlines.

Familiarity with tools like Google Workspace, Slack, and Asana is a plus.

Absolutely no AI-generated designs, portfolios, and websites will be considered.



Software & Platform Requirements:

Expertise in WordPress, Shopify and Elementor

Solid understanding of UX/UI principles

Proficiency in HTML and Python coding

Experience with affiliate marketing strategies

Proficiency with Shopify e-commerce platforms



Compensation & Benefits

Full-time remote position (3-month term, potential for extension based on performance)

Competitive compensation based on experience and skills

Bi-monthly pay via money transfer

Paid career training relevant to the role (should you be hired for longer than nine months) 

Performance-based bonuses (available for long-term staff)

Work-life balance and flexible hours



As part of our team, you'll interact closely with clients, forming strong partnerships. You'll use your excellent communication skills to understand, negotiate, and ultimately create tailored solutions that exceed expectations. Does the idea of such meaningful client engagement unnerve you? If not, then you're ready to contribute to our shared vision. Here are the next steps to move forward.



How to Apply

We will be holding interviews on Wednesday, Friday, and Saturday this week for immediate hiring contingent on your skills, your interview task performance and company fit.



To Apply, Follow These Steps:

Reply with your Name and Position in the subject line. Example: "John Doe – WordPress & Shopify Store Developer"

Define a backend developer staging area in WordPress/ CPanel (this is part of your application process).



Submit the following:

Your resume (CV)

Portfolio links showcasing your original design work (Absolutely NO AI-generated websites. Wordpress & Shopify Shops ONLY)



Once we receive your application, we will send you a scheduler to book your interview slot. During your interview, you will be required to demonstrate proficiency in Wordpress, Developer Backend, and Shopify Shop Setup.



If you’re ready to bring your creativity to a team that values real site developer expertise, we look forward to your application!

title: Online Chat Salesperson
description:
This is NOT a DATA-ENTRY or CUSTOMER SUPPORT position. We are looking for AGGRESSIVE candidates.





Job description:



Selling to and upselling over online chat to people who have indicated interest in the product. This is a SALES position, NOT a CUSTOMER SUPPORT position. We are looking for COMPETITIVE, DRIVEN, and HUNGRY candidates. Our standards are HIGH. You will work as a part of a TEAM, but you are responsible for YOUR OWN SUCCESS. The ideal candidate is between the ages of 18-25 and has ENERGY and AMBITION.





Compensation:



You will be paid hourly and in commission if your commission exceeds your hourly. After your trial period you will be expected to consistently exceed your hourly. If you are unable to meet the daily sales target after the trial period, you will be let go. You will be expected to make enough sales to AT LEAST earn $40 per shift. With skill and motivation a salesperson can exceed this amount multiple times over.





Hard Requirements:



- Adequate internet connection

- Adequate PC setup

- EXCELLENT written and GOOD spoken English

- SPEED. You may be juggling 10 or more chats at the same time and each requires your full attention to EARN

- WORK ETHIC: You will be expected to stay focused and active for the entire duration of your shift

Everything else can be taught.





Nice to have:



- Understanding of modern internet culture/
s

- Exposure to video games and other media from the US

- Charisma

- Post-secondary education (we'll accept it as an indicator of competence as long as you can provide us with the diploma)



This is NOT an easy job, but it can be VERY LUCRATIVE with talent and especially hard work.



End note:

Applications written by AI will be detected and rejected immediately. Chosen candidates are to expect a thorough interview (1 hour). No hard feelings if the interview is cut short, it means we have d
 you're not a good fit.



Full time ONLY

title: CAD Drafter/3D Renderer
description:
Key Responsibilities

1. Project Understanding

Review project briefs, layouts, design references, and brand materials to fully grasp requirements.

Collaborate with designers and project managers to clarify design intent and expectations.

2. 3D Modeling

Develop precise 3D models of booths, exhibits, or structures based on provided layouts and design direction.

Ensure proportions, scale, and details are consistent with the concept.

3. Materials & Texturing

Apply accurate colors, textures, and finishes that reflect the design style and brand identity.

Maintain consistency across all visual elements.

4. Lighting & Camera Setup

Configure realistic lighting to enhance spatial perception and mood.

Establish optimal camera angles to showcase the design effectively.

5. Rendering & Output

Produce high-quality rendered images suitable for client presentations and approvals.

Export final visuals in required formats, ensuring clarity and professionalism.

6. File Management

Organize and properly name all project files for easy tracking, retrieval, and backup.

Maintain a structured folder system to support workflow efficiency.

7. Software Utilization

Use SketchUp for modeling, D5 Render for rendering, and Canva/Photoshop for presentation preparation.

Apply Adobe Photoshop for advanced image editing, post-processing, and enhancing rendered visuals.

Stay updated on software features and industry best practices to improve efficiency and output quality.



Qualifications & Skills

Proficiency in SketchUp, D5 Render, Canva, and Adobe Photoshop.

Strong eye for detail, design aesthetics, and spatial accuracy.

Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.

Good communication and collaboration skills to work with cross-functional teams.

Organized and methodical approach to file management.



How to apply: Please send us your CV, Intro Video and active Whatsapp number

title: Video Editor & Social Media Manager
description:
Video Editor & Social Media Manager (Short-Form Specialist) — Remote (Philippines)

I’m looking for a fast, trend-aware Video Editor + Social Media Manager to support multiple UK aesthetics and skincare clinic brands using my marketing hub. You’ll turn raw content into high-performing short-form videos and help keep content consistent, modern, and engaging.

What you’ll do

Edit Reels / TikTok / YouTube Shorts from talking-head videos and B-roll

Create fast-paced, engaging cuts (strong hooks, pacing, captions, clean transitions, light graphics)

Add captions (UK English), on-screen text, sound effects, music, and simple branded elements

Repurpose long videos into multiple short clips and content variations

Spot and apply current editing trends (without making content feel gimmicky or off-brand)

Support basic social media management: scheduling, posting, light community/admin support (if needed)

What “good” looks like

You can take a basic talking-head clip and turn it into something people actually watch

You understand retention: hook, pace, pattern interrupts, and clear messaging

Your edits look polished, modern, and suited to a premium clinic audience (not overly loud or messy)

You’re proactive — you bring ideas, not just edits

Requirements

Strong short-form editing skills (portfolio required)

Confident with CapCut / Adobe Premiere / Final Cut (or similar)

Comfortable working with brand guidelines and keeping style consistent across clients

Reliable, responsive, and able to work to deadlines across multiple projects

Bonus (not essential)

Experience with beauty/aesthetics/medispa content

Basic graphic skills (Canva templates, simple thumbnails, covers)

Understanding of UK audience tone (professional, natural, ethical aesthetics)

 

Please send:

A link to your portfolio (short-form examples preferred)

Your editing software/tools

Your availability + typical turnaround time.  You don't have to match UK hours; however, some crossover is required for meetings. 

A brief note on the types of edits you most enjoy (talking head, B-roll, vlog, clinic content, etc.)

title: GoHighLevel CRM & Automation Specialist
description:
Company: Pioneers Veneers



We are looking for a highly experienced GoHighLevel expert who can build, optimize, and manage our CRM and automation systems at an advanced level.



This is not a beginner position. You must understand sales pipelines, automation logic, reporting dashboards, and how CRM structure directly impacts revenue.



Role Overview



You will be responsible for designing and maintaining the entire GoHighLevel infrastructure including workflows, pipelines, reporting dashboards, automations, integrations, and performance tracking.



Your goal is simple:

Build systems that increase conversions, reduce manual work, and give leadership full visibility over sales performance.



Core Responsibilities



CRM & Pipeline Architecture



Build and optimize multi-stage sales pipelines



Structure opportunities for inbound, outbound, payment plans, follow-up, and customer service



Ensure proper ownership assignment and round-robin logic



Create structured tags, custom fields, and segmentation logic



Workflow Automations



Create advanced workflows using triggers, if/else logic, wait conditions, webhook triggers



Automate follow-ups for short-term and long-term nurturing



Build payment plan logic automation



Prevent duplication errors and double counting



Build strike or compliance tracking if needed



Integrate 
, Stripe, Shopify, Aircall, or other platforms via webhook



Dashboards & Reporting



Create executive dashboards showing:



Monthly sales target vs actual



Current deal count per rep



Down payment totals



Remaining balance totals



Close rate



Missed calls vs answered calls



Build performance tracking for sales reps



Ensure accurate forecasting



Growth Optimization



Identify system leaks in follow-up or conversion process



Recommend automation improvements to increase close rate



Suggest tagging and segmentation strategies for better remarketing



Recommend upsell and retention automation



Optimize SMS/email nurture sequences



Implement A2P compliance logic if required



Required Skills



2+ years working deeply inside GoHighLevel



Advanced workflow creation experience



Experience with inbound webhooks and API logic



Strong understanding of CRM logic and sales processes



Ability to design dashboards for leadership visibility



Experience integrating third-party tools



Strong analytical mindset



Fluent English communication



Performance Expectations



Within the first 30 days:



Audit and restructure current CRM system if needed



Optimize pipelines



Build accurate dashboards



Improve automation logic



Identify at least 3 growth opportunities



This is a long-term growth role. We want someone who thinks like an operator, not just a technician.



Bonus If You Have Experience With



Payment plan businesses



High-ticket sales teams



Call center environments



Commission tracking automation



Sales team performance dashboards



If you are confident you can build systems that drive measurable revenue growth inside GoHighLevel, apply with:



A short explanation of the most advanced automation you have built



A screenshot of a dashboard you created



A Loom video explaining one workflow you built

title: Facebook Media Buyer
description:
**SUBMIT YOUR APPLICATION IN THE FORM BELOW**


/
Media Buyer 
 & Google Ads) — Full-Time (40 hrs/week)



Company: AT Media Partners

Location: Remote

Core Hours: 9:00am–5:00pm AEST (Monday–Friday)

Compensation: $700–$1,000 USD/month base + performance bonuses (up to $400/month)

Reporting To: Aaron Tang (Founder & CEO)





About the Role



As a Media Buyer, you will be responsible for launching, managing, and optimising paid advertising campaigns for our clients across
 Ads and Google Ads. Your mission is simple: drive consistent lead volume while hitting strong CPL targets.



This is local lead generation, not complex eCommerce. You’ll be running straightforward campaigns (radius targeting, lead forms, direct response) at scale — typically 40+ active campaigns — so efficiency and organisation matter.





Key Responsibilities



Campaign Setup & Launch

 • Build and launch new campaigns for newly 
 clients across
 & Google Ads

 • Configure targeting, budgets, creatives, lead forms, tracking, and campaign structure



Daily Campaign Management

 • Monitor performance daily and make smart optimisations

 • Adjust budgets, pause underperformers, and scale winning ads

 • Maintain clean account structure and ensure campaigns run smoothly



Cost Per Lead (CPL) Optimisation

 • Continuously optimise to reduce CPL and increase lead volume

 • Identify inefficiencies and implement performance improvements quickly



A/B Testing

 • Test ad creatives, copy, audiences, placements, and campaign angles

 • Use testing insights to improve results and prevent creative fatigue



Reporting

 • Track and report key metrics such as CPL, CTR, CPC, frequency, conversion volume

 • Provide clear updates to the internal team and support client reporting needs



Troubleshooting & Problem Solving

 • Diagnose and fix underperformance (low CTR, high CPL, learning limitations)

 • Resolve ad rejections, policy issues, and technical hiccups efficiently



Collaboration

 • Work closely with the Ad Creative Team (images/videos) and CSMs (client requests + feedback)

 • Collaborate with other media buyers to share insights and improve systems





What Success Looks Like (KPIs)



We measure success by results, not hours. Here’s what “winning” looks like:

 • Average CPL: $11–$17

 • Campaign Load: 40+ campaigns managed

 • Ad Approval Rate: ? 95%

title: Visual Marketing Designer (Funnels + Graphics)
description:
Virtualee & Co is an online business management agency that empowers stuck and overwhelmed Coaches & Founders to scale their business & reclaim their time. And our all-female wonders team is looking for you!



We’re looking for a Visual Marketing Designer (Funnels + Graphics) who thrives on details, creativity, strategy, and results. You’ll be responsible for designing high-converting marketing funnels and crafting visuals that are both stunning and strategic. If you're a visual storyteller who’s obsessed with user experience and knows how to turn ideas into eye-catching designs that drive action—we want to meet you.



Key Responsibilities:



Funnel Design Mastery: Strategize, design and optimize end-to-end marketing funnels, ensuring a seamless and visually appealing user journey. Collaborating with the team to align funnel designs with campaign objectives.



Visual Storytelling: Create captivating graphics, illustrations, and visual elements to tell compelling brand and product or service stories. Develop a cohesive visual identity that resonates with our target audience.



Creative Precision: Bring strong attention to detail, a keen sense of aesthetics, and creative thinking to every project from layout to final approvals.



Conversion Optimization: Brainstorm, suggest, and implement design strategies to enhance conversion rates at every stage of the funnel. Must also be able to monitor results and bring light to highest performing variables for optimization.



Responsive Design: Ensure all funnel elements are optimized for various devices, providing a seamless experience across desktop, tablet, and mobile.



Collaboration and Iteration: Embrace feedback and iterate on designs to continuously improve performance.



Stay Ahead of Design Trends: Keep a pulse on the latest design trends, techniques, and tools in the digital marketing space, including social media. Implement innovative and fresh design elements to stay ahead of the competition. Continuously expand your knowledge of sales funnel design and digital marketing strategies.



Qualifications:



Proven experience in strategizing and designing marketing funnels with a focus on conversion optimization.

Proficiency in graphic design software (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite, Canva).

Strong understanding of user experience (UX) principles and responsive design.

Proficiency in funnel-building or website platforms (e.g., ClickFunnels, Kajabi, WordPress, Leadpages) is a strong plus.

A creative thinker with strong attention to detail and a keen sense of aesthetics



Preferred Skills:



Familiarity with marketing automation platforms and CRM systems.

Ability to translate complex concepts into visually appealing and easy-to-understand graphics.

Strong project management skills with the ability to meet deadlines.

Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.



Please send us your most updated CV and portfolio when you apply.

This Role Is For You If:

mbers find delegation and systems easy to navigate

Operations & Systems

s, web pages, automations are tested and ready for go-live.
