title: Accounting Specialist
description:
The Accounting Specialist will own core accounts receivable and payable processes while driving collections, managing insurance supplementing, and providing phone backup during peak periods. This role requires meticulous attention to detail, accrual-basis accounting expertise, and prior construction industry experience to ensure accurate job costing, lien compliance, and cash flow integrity.



Key Responsibilities



Accounts Receivable

Generate and distribute progress/final invoices accurately and timely.

Post customer payments and remote deposit capture.

Follow up on aging receivables via phone/email; escalate to mechanics’ liens when necessary.

Accounts Payable

Code and enter vendor/subcontractor invoices to correct jobs, cost codes, and GL accounts.

Manage weekly check runs, ACH payments, and credit card reconciliations.

Verify lien releases, COIs, and W-9s before releasing payments.

Insurance Supplementing

Prepare and submit supplement claims to insurance carriers.

Track adjuster approvals, depreciation recovery, and final supplement payments.

Reconcile supplement funds to specific job cost ledgers.

Phone & Administrative Backup

Cover main phone lines during breaks/lunch or overflow periods.

Route calls, take messages, and assist field teams with invoice/payment status.

Month-End & Accrual Accounting

Accrue unbilled receivables and subcontractor retainage

Reconcile bank statements, credit cards, and intercompany accounts.

Assist in job cost variance analysis and percentage-of-completion schedules.

Required Qualifications



Experience: Minimum 3 years of full-cycle AR/AP in the construction industry; accrual accounting required.

Software Proficiency:

Advanced QuickBooks Online

Sage Intact experience a plus but not required

Microsoft Excel

Knowledge Areas:

AIA billing, lien rights, prevailing wage and certified payroll.

Job cost accounting and WIP schedules.

Soft Skills:

Thrives in a high-volume, deadline-driven environment.

Exceptional attention to detail—transposition errors are unacceptable.

Professional phone etiquette and ability to de-escalate frustrated vendors/clients.

title: Scriptwriter
description:
Hi! We're JEO MEDIA and we run multiple YouTube channels about animal rescue stories and heroic pets. Our videos get hundreds of thousands of views, and we need a dedicated full-time scriptwriter to help us keep growing.



This is a long-term position. If you do well, you'll grow with us.



You will be writing scripts for short-form videos that are 30 seconds to 1 minute long. You must have experience writing short, punchy, emotional scripts. Every single word matters — you need to know how to craft powerful hooks that grab attention immediately, keep the pacing tight, and hold viewers until the very end.



Please review the Google Docs link below. It contains samples of our existing scripts that have generated millions of views. Study them carefully to understand our exact style — the tone, the emotion, the pacing, the word choices, and how everything is built to keep viewers watching.



Google Docs Link: 



ONLY APPLY IF YOU ARE 100% CONFIDENT THAT YOU CAN MATCH THIS STYLE AND TRULY UNDERSTAND SHORT-FORM YOUTUBE CONTENT.





YOUR DAILY TASKS:

- Write 5 scripts per day (you'll scale up to 10/day over time)

- Use simple, emotional English — like you're telling a friend a story

- Submit scripts on time every day via Google Docs to a provided Google Drive

- Communicate with the team through 





REQUIREMENTS:



- Excellent English writing skills (grammar, spelling, natural flow)

- Experience writing scripts or stories is preferred

- Comfortable using AI tools like Claude and ChatGPT to speed up your workflow

- Can follow instructions properly

- Reliable, honest, and can meet daily deadlines

- Has a stable internet connection





HOW THE WORK SYSTEM WORKS:



This is a goal-based system, NOT an hourly system. You have a set number of scripts to complete each day (5 scripts at the start). Once your scripts are done and approved, you are done for the day. What matters is that the work is completed and the quality is good.





PAY STRUCTURE:



- Starting Pay: $600/month — 5 scripts per day

- After proving yourself and staying consistent: $1,400/month — 10 scripts per day



Bonus: Any script that leads to a video hitting 1 million views earns you a $10 bonus on top of your regular pay.



Weekly payment for the first Month and then monthly payment afterward.





TO APPLY FOR THIS ROLE:



1. Start your application with: "I am a skilled scriptwriter and I want to work with JEO MEDIA." (Otherwise, I'll assume you haven't read the job description.)



2. Provide samples of relevant work — share 2-3 samples of previous short-form videos which you've written scripts for.



3. Test sample (for finalists) — I'll select a few applicants and then request a test script sample. Full details of the test will be sent to you once you are selected.

title: HIGHLY DETAILED Operations & Admin Assistant (great pay)
description:
Position: Operations & Admin Assistant (Highly Detail-Oriented / Systems-Driven)

Remote | Beginning Part-Time (20–30 hrs/week to start) then ramp up to Full-Time

Compensation: I reward hard-working, competent employees! There is no "max" earning with this role- the more experience, accuracy, effort, and drive you have, the more you will earn.



Hi!!! My name is Mel, and I own the top Christian speed-dating services in the United States! I’m on the lookout for a new assistant to grow with me. There are countless opportunities for growth, and I’m so excited to find the right person to join the team. I currently have two AMAZING assistants and need a third to keep up with the growth we've been experiencing. Here's a testimonial from one of my assistants:



"I’ve been working as Mel's VA since September 2024, and I genuinely love it. The work is meaningful (helping people find their Godly spouses), fast-paced, and never boring. You’re supporting a business that’s actively scaling. Mel is professional, clear, and respectful of boundaries. I can fully enjoy my days off, travel when needed, and never worry about work piling up. She also pays weekly and always on time. That said, a great client is great for a reason. This role requires great - truly GREAT - attention to detail. Mel has high standards, and rightfully so. If you’re not detail-oriented, proactive, and committed to doing excellent work, this won’t be the right fit. But if you are, working with her is incredibly fulfilling. I’m grateful to be part of her team and to support a leader who is clear, mission-driven, and genuinely good to work with."



Please read carefully before applying



This role is not creative, not social-media strategy, and not “wing-it” work.

This role is for someone who genuinely enjoys:

• Following detailed SOPs

• Working from templates

• Tracking numbers

• Executing conditional logic accurately

• Catching mistakes before they happen

• Doing important but sometimes tedious admin work extremely well



If you are not naturally obsessive about details, this role will feel overwhelming.



About the Role:



We run highly organized, multi-city events with complex ticket logic, conditional
 workflows, and time-sensitive admin tasks. One small mistake can create downstream issues, so precision matters. You will be responsible for executing systems exactly as documented, while also helping improve them over time once you fully understand how everything works. This is a self-directed remote role with clear expectations, clear SOPs, and recurring tasks.



Core Responsibilities:



Admin & Operations (High Attention to Detail)

• Perform data entry and tracking using Google Sheets and internal spreadsheets

• Monitor ticket inventory levels across:

• Men’s tickets

• Women’s tickets

• 1-man + 1-woman tickets

• 2-men combo tickets

• 3-men combo tickets

• Ensure events stay balanced (e.g., targeting 15 men / 17 women)

• Flag issues immediately if numbers are off or approaching limits



This requires comfort with multi-variable tracking and checking numbers multiple times per day. I’m ideally looking for someone with a high "C" & high "S" in the DISC Assessment (please write out your DISC Assessment scores).



Conditional & Logic-Based Tasks

• Execute conditional logic workflows (if-then scenarios), such as:

• Sending different
s to men vs women based on ticket availability

• Triggering follow-ups based on survey responses

• Knowing which template to use based on status, timing, and inventory levels

• Ensure the correct message goes to the correct group at the correct time



Social Media (Execution Only- No Strategy Required)

• Post Instagram Stories from pre-made templates

• Schedule stories using Buffer

• Follow exact posting instructions (timing, captions, tagging)

• No content creation or creativity required — execution only



Community & Event Setup

• Create
 Events

• Post pre-scripted messages into
 groups

• Follow posting rules and instructions exactly



 & Review Follow-Ups

• Send follow-up
s to participants who complete post-event surveys

• Encourage Google Reviews using approved scripts

• Ensure
s are sent only to the correct segments



Tools You Must Be Comfortable Using

• ClickUp (task management required)

• Google Workspace

• Google Docs

• Google Sheets (must be comfortable with complex spreadsheets)

• Instagram (Stories posting + scheduling)

• Buffer (or willingness to learn quickly)

• ChatGPT (for problem-solving, clarification, and drafting)

• Zapier experience is a BIG plus (not required but highly preferred)



Schedule & Availability Requirements

• Remote

• U.S. work hours strongly preferred

• Must be able to check ticket levels morning and evening (U.S. time)

• Weekend availability required 1-3hrs in the morning & evening on saturday & sunday. Please let me know if this works for you in your reply.

- Monday–Friday, you may choose 4-5 days to work 5–7 hours per day. You may opt to work 6 days instead of 5 if you prefer shorter daily hours—I’m flexible- as long as you get time-sensitive tasks finished. Some tasks will be time sensitive, others are flexible.



Hours & Growth

• Start at 25–30 hours/week guaranteed, and then ramp into full-time

• Workload will grow as we:

• Add more cities

• Launch new projects

• Expand operations

• We intentionally do not overload you at the start so there’s room to grow



Who You Are (This Is Important)



You are someone who:

• Is extremely detail-oriented (double-checks everything)

• Enjoys systems, structure, and checklists

• Can follow SOPs without improvising

• Notices inconsistencies others miss

• Is fast and accurate

• Can work independently without constant reminders

• Enjoys improving systems after mastering them

• Is comfortable with repetitive but important work



This is not a good fit if you:

• Prefer creative work

• Dislike repetition

• “Skim” instructions

• Get bored easily with admin tasks

Best,



Mel

title: HR Guru
description:
The Mission:



Here at Davis Capital, we are a high-energy Medicare insurance sales agency looking for a "Swiss Army Knife" HR Specialist! This isn't a traditional sit-behind-a-desk HR role! We need a partner who can own the onboarding and licensing of our agents while being part of a team that is behind the driving force behind our company culture and online presence!





80% Core Responsibility #1: Onboarding and Integration!



This is your most important task! You are the bridge between a new hire and their first sale!

Rapid Onboarding: Lead the charge in getting new agents hired and integrated into our systems immediately!

Platform Expert: You will be responsible for learning and managing Spark, ensuring all agents are compliant and know how to use the system!



Carrier Partnering: Partner with insurance carriers like Humana and WellCare to lead the charge on contracting and licensing!

Compliance Accuracy: Ensure every agent meets necessary requirements so they can sell without delays!



20% Core Responsibility #2: Culture & Online Advocacy! 



You are the heartbeat of the company! You make sure our team is having fun and staying engaged!

Culture Lead: Create a fun, high-energy environment by sending out internal "hype" messages and celebrating wins!

Social Media Advocacy: Work with our online advocates/Social Media Manager on Instagram and
 to showcase our culture and make everything "tick" internally and externally!



Generalist Duties: Handle all standard HR Specialist tasks—from policy compliance to employee questions—acting as the "go-to" for everything HR!



Bonus Responsibilities (Where you can truly lead):



Agent Retention & Recognition: Develop "Agent of the Month" spotlights or milestone celebrations to keep our top producers feeling valued and "sticky" to the agency!

Recruitment Marketing: Help us find more "A-Players" by creating job ads and social content that scream "this is the place to be!"



Proactive Compliance Audits: Don't wait for a problem; proactively monitor licensing and carrier status to ensure no agent ever goes "dark" during peak sales seasons!



Internal Knowledge Base: Create "Cheat Sheets" for new agents on how to navigate the carrier portals, making you the ultimate resource for the team!



Virtual Event Coordination: Organize digital "happy hours," sales competitions, or holiday celebrations to keep our remote culture feeling like a family!



Are you certified in Human Resources? If not, what is your experience? Please only join our family if you can lead and follow.



This is a Leadership role. Not a support role!





Medicare Licensing experience is an advantage.



Systems:

Spark Sunfire

BambooHR

Microsoft Teams/Suite

GoHighLevel



Why Choose Us?


==







How to apply?

Send your resume.

Answer these 3 questions:

Are you a master of Applicant Tracking Systems?

Are you a wizard with GoHighLevel?

Do you know what it means to get the job done no matter what?

title: Social Media Marketing and Content Creation
description:
Part-Time Social Media Marketer for Houston Personal Injury Law Firm



About Us

We are a boutique personal injury law firm in Houston, Texas, specializing in auto a
 cases and premises liability cases (2 areas). Our firm consists of one dedicated attorney supported by a small, focused team of 1 paralegal. We're looking to expand our online presence and connect with potential clients through strategic social media marketing.



What you need to know

I have basically very little online presence. A few 5-star google reviews on google business. I advertise on
/ Instagram for car wreck cases and slip and fall cases. 



Position Overview

We are seeking a part-time Social Media Marketing Specialist with experience growing small professional service businesses, particularly law firms. The ideal candidate will develop and implement a comprehensive social media strategy across
, Instagram,
/X, and TikTok to increase our visibility, establish our brand as a trusted resource for personal injury victims, and generate qualified leads.

Responsibilities

• Develop a content calendar and create engaging, professional content tailored to personal injury law and our target audience

• Manage and grow our presence across multiple platforms 
, Instagram,
/X, and later TikTok)

• Create visually appealing graphics and short-form videos that communicate our services and value proposition

• Research and utilize relevant hashtags and trends in the legal industry

• Monitor social media analytics and adjust strategies based on performance

• Engage with followers, respond to comments, and manage direct messages

• Stay informed about personal injury law topics to ensure accurate content

• Collaborate with the attorney to highlight case successes (while maintaining client confidentiality)

• Identify opportunities for community engagement and local networking

• Implement a process for gathering reviews

.. Optimize $250/month
 ad budget for maximum reach and engagement



Requirements

• Proven experience growing a small business social media presence, preferably for a boutique law firm or professional service business

• Strong understanding of social media platforms, particularly
, Instagram, and
/X

• Experience with content creation tools (Canva, Adobe Creative Suite, or similar). I have a Canva account you could use.

• Excellent written communication skills with English grammar and spelling

• Basic understanding of legal ethics regarding attorney marketing

• Ability to create professional, empathetic content appropriate for personal injury victims without attorney being on camera. This may change later. 

• Content should create “emotion” (for example a quick content piece could be someone saying “Imagine being gifted a home…or enough to put a sizeable down payment on one. If you’ve been injured in a slip and fall/ a
 then your case may be worth more than you know. If you never call, you’ll never know. I’d like to help. Call The __________ Firm, 281-XXX-XXXX

• Must engage with clients as if you are the attorney (I will give you a list of standard responses and ask that you respond within 4 hours of someone leaving a comment).

• Experience with social media analytics and reporting

• Self-motivated with the ability to work independently

• Familiarity with U.S. culture and communication styles

• Should create a plan for growth and be willing to discuss your plan with attorney. Plan should include growth rate.

Hours and Compensation

• 15-20 hours per week (flexible). These hours will increase with time.

• Competitive hourly rate based on experience

• Long-term opportunity with potential for growth

Application Process

Please submit your application with:

1. Resume/CV highlighting relevant social media marketing experience

2. Portfolio or examples of social media accounts you've managed (especially for professional services)

3. Brief proposal (1 page max) outlining your initial social media strategy for a personal injury law firm and your payment requirements (please specify currency).



Please have examples of your experience/ prior jobs.



We look forward to finding a talented marketing professional to join our team and help grow our online presence!

title: WordPress Developer + Designer
description:
We’re looking for a reliable WordPress developer/designer who can build, improve, and maintain high-performing business websites. You’ll help us implement clean designs, improve UX, speed/performance, and ship pages that look great and convert.



This is a long-term role for the right person.



What you’ll be doing



- Build and design WordPress pages (landing pages, service pages, blog layouts)

-Customize themes and templates (Elementor, Gutenberg, or similar)

-Implement responsive design (mobile-first)

- Improve website speed and performance (Core Web Vitals)

- Basic on-page SEO implementation (titles, meta, schema, internal linking)

- Integrate tools like HubSpot forms, Calendly, Google Analytics, Search Console

- Fix bugs, plugin conflicts, layout issues, and broken styling

- Maintain clean site structure and consistent branding across pages

- Recommend improvements for conversions (layout, CTA placement, clarity)



Requirements (must have):

- Strong WordPress experience (2+ years preferred)

- Proven design sense (clean, modern, business-ready)

- Strong CSS skills (must be comfortable making precise styling changes)

- Experience with page builders (Elementor preferred) and/or Gutenberg

- Familiar with performance optimization + caching best practices

- Good communication and reliable deadlines

- Able to work from clear instructions and also make smart recommendations

- PHP basics and child theme experience

- Familiarity with HubSpot tracking/forms, GTM, and basic schema

- Experience building pages for B2B / SaaS / IT services firms



What success looks like:



- Pages match the design/brand exactly

- Fast load times and strong mobile responsiveness

- Clean structure, clear CTAs, and conversion-minded execution

- Reliable turnaround and proactive communication



Work setup:



- Remote (Philippines preferred)

- Part-time to start (10–15 hrs/week), opportunity for more

- Ongoing work for the right fit

This role is not creative. The work is repetitive and analytical, and results take time. It is best suited for someone who values structure, routine, and long-term stability.

This role must be your only job



Basic understanding of PPC fundamentals (courses required)

Detail-oriented and process-driven



Clear written English

Interest in a long-term role



Before You Apply



This role involves daily repetitive PPC tasks and spreadsheet work. Training is structured and feedback-heavy in the first 30–60 days. If you are looking to learn quickly and move on, this role is not a good fit.

Excel

Short introduction



PPC courses taken



Answers to the questions above

title: WEBSITE DESIGN & DEVELOPMENT SPECIALIST
description:
ABOUT US

We're a small marketing team in Arizona/Utah looking for a kind, reliable Website Designer to join us long-term. I'm the Web Design Manager, and I need a trusted partner who can help keep our client sites looking great and running smoothly.

We value independence and ownership—we want you to confidently run with projects. But we also love clear communication. Ask questions when you need to! It saves everyone time.

We genuinely care about work-life balance. Choose a schedule that works for your life and family. We just need one weekly tea
eting.

––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––



YOUR MAIN JOB

Build new landing pages that match the existing site perfectly. Here's the typical workflow:



1. We send you content in a Google Doc

2. You look at other pages on the client's site

3. You copy their design style (colors, fonts, spacing, layout)

4. You build the new page in WordPress (Elementor or WP Bakery)

5. The page looks like it's always been part of the site



Speed and accuracy matter here—this is what you'll spend most of your time doing.

––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––



WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU

Must-haves:



• Honest and dependable—we can count on you

• Fast at building landing pages by copying existing designs

• Strong eye for design—spacing, fonts, colors, and visual flow

• WordPress expert (especially Elementor, some WP Bakery)

• Know enough CSS/HTML to make small tweaks

• Good internet (35+ Mbps with a backup option)



Nice-to-haves (but not required):



• Can fix common WordPress problems (broken links, plugin conflicts, etc.)

• Familiar with ManageWP or site maintenance

• Know basic SEO stuff (site speed, redirects, metadata)

• Comfortable with DNS records and hosting

• Use AI tools to work faster

• Completed OnlineJobs.ph skill tests

––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––



THE DETAILS

Pay: $1,000 USD/month (about $5.77/hour)

Schedule: Weekly pay first month, then bi-weekly

Payment: EasyPay

Hours: 40/week, flexible schedule, one weekly meeting

Bonus: 13th month bonus for longterm

Tools: Trello, Asana, Everhour, Google Workspace

––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––



HOW TO APPLY

 us with this subject line: "Specialist for Lost Search Media - My Favorite Hobby is [Your Hobby]"



Include:



1. Make sure your OnlineJobs.ph profile has ID proof uploaded

2. Links to 3 WordPress sites you've built (we want to see your design skills)

3. A 2-minute Loom video: Show us one of the WordPress sites you built. Walk us through what you're most proud of and one challenge you solved while building it.

4. Internet speed screenshot + your backup internet plan



––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––––

That's it! We're looking forward to meeting you.

title: ASP.NET Developer (UI Expert)
description:
We are Mission Lens, a startup dedicated to providing powerful and intuitive software solutions for Non-Profit and Community Organizations. 



We are looking for a highly skilled 
 Frontend Developer to join our small but talented team and help us build user interfaces that make a real-world impact.



As a startup, we work in a fast-paced environment and have a team of strong, dedicated developers. This is a heavy UI development role for an expert 
, JavaScript and CSS who is passionate about creating clean, responsive, and engaging user experiences.



Key Responsibilities:

• Take the lead on developing, implementing, and refining user-facing features for our web applications.

• Translate UI/UX design wireframes into high-quality, functional code.

• Collaborate closely with our backend developers to integrate front-end components.

• Ensure our applications are optimized for speed, scalability, and responsiveness across all devices.



Required Skills and Experience:

• Experience: Minimum of 5 years of professional software development experience.

• Frontend Expertise: Expert-level proficiency in 
 and CSS. You should be able to create complex, responsive layouts and animations without relying on frameworks.

• Adaptability: Proven ability to learn new technologies and frameworks quickly. Our environment uses ASP.NET and Blazor.

• Communication: Strong English communication skills.

• Availability: Must be available for team collaboration and meetings between 7:00 AM and 9:00 AM Eastern Standard Time (EST) daily (Monday to Friday).



Work Schedule & Compensation:

• Schedule: Flexible hours outside of the required 7 AM - 9 AM EST daily overlap.

• Pay Rate: $16 - $18 USD per hour, depending on experience.



HOW TO APPLY:

To ensure we find the best fit for our team, we have a unique application process. We will only consider candidates who complete the following small technical project. This shows us your skills and your genuine interest in the role.



Mandatory Application Project:

You are required to create a simple Blazor application that demonstrates your ability to manipulate the UI.

Project Instructions:

1. Create a new, standard Blazor Web App project. The default template with sample pages is perfectly fine.

2. Add a "hamburger" button (icon) at the top left corner of the main layout.

3. Implement the following functionality:

o When the user clicks, the hamburger button for the first time, the sidebar navigation menu should smoothly minimize (e.g., collapse to show only icons).

o When the user clicks the button again OR hovers their mouse over the minimized sidebar, it should expand back to its original, full state.

4. Push the code to a public repository on GitHub, GitLab, or a similar platform.

5. Ensure the project is live and accessible.

title: Assistant Sales Manager – Client Growth
description:
Come grow with us! 



BlueYonder Corp. is seeking a Sales Management Assistant to join our team!  



Are you looking for the following? 

•$5/hr starting pay, based on experience 

•$.50 raise after 90 days and guaranteed additional raise at year 1 

•No Weekends Ever!

•Evening shift: 9am - 5:30pm EST Monday – Friday  

•100% Remote (Work from Home) 

•Paid Company Holidays 

•Paid Vacation Days   

•Paid Sick Time Off  

 

Is this you? 



?Experience in Leading and managing sales teams monitoring performance, and driving accountability 



?Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Excel 

• Maintain and organize large datasets 

• Format Spreadsheets for reporting and uploads 

• Vlookup 

• IF statements 

• Calculations 

• PIVOT table  

• Dashboard creation 

• Create month-month comparison of data 

• Data clean up 



•Experience working from home (home office/high speed internet/quite workspace) 

•Experience speaking with B2B Vendors ie. CRM Vendors 

•Superior English language proficiency 

•Experience in working with an American based company 

If you answered ‘YES’, then we are looking for you! 

 

WHO is BlueYonder Corp?  



We have an established and unique credit card processing program.  Since 2016 we operate in all 50 states.   

We offer businesses a credit card processing program that costs them a flat rate of $65 dollars a month for unlimited processing.  Business owners love our program because they save tens of thousands a year in fees. Which they would otherwise have to pay.

title: Remote Accounting Manager
description:
Role Overview



The Remote Accounting Manager is responsible for overseeing day-to-day accounting operations, ensuring accurate financial reporting, compliance, and internal controls. This role manages the accounting team, reviews financial transactions, and supports leadership with timely financial insights.



Key Responsibilities

Accounting & Financial Management



Oversee general ledger activities, journal entries, and account reconciliations



Ensure timely and accurate month-end and year-end close



Review financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow) for accuracy



Monitor AR/AP, cash flow, and bank reconciliations



Ensure proper expense coding and cost allocation



Payroll & Compliance



Review payroll summaries and ensure proper posting to the GL



Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local tax regulations



Coordinate with external accountants, auditors, and tax preparers



Support audits, due diligence, and regulatory reporting as needed



Systems & Process Improvement



Maintain and optimize accounting systems (QuickBooks, Sage, NetSuite, or similar)



Develop and enforce accounting policies and internal controls



Improve workflows for efficiency and accuracy



Support system integrations (payroll, billing, CRM, EVV, etc.)



Leadership & Collaboration



Supervise and mentor accounting staff



Provide clear timelines, checklists, and accountability



Collaborate with operations, HR, and leadership teams



Prepare financial summaries and insights for decision-making



Qualifications



Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field



5+ years of accounting experience, including supervisory responsibilities



Strong knowledge of GAAP and financial reporting



Hands-on experience with accounting software (QuickBooks preferred)



Payroll, AR/AP, and multi-entity experience a plus



Experience with service-based or healthcare/homecare organizations preferred



Skills & Competencies



High attention to detail and strong analytical skills



Ability to work independently in a remote environment



Strong communication and documentation skills



Excellent time management and deadline-driven mindset



Comfortable working across time zones and with remote teams



What Success Looks Like



Clean, reconciled books every month



On-time, accurate financial reports



Smooth audits with minimal findings



Improved accounting workflows and controls



Leadership confidence in financial data

title: Full-Time Claim Engineer
description:
Learn AI While Working From Home. Real Growth.





Full-Time Claim Engineer (Remote, Philippines Only)

Company: ClaimScale LLC







AI Is Changing Work. We’re Teaching You How to Work With It.





AI is already reshaping how work gets done. The real question is not whether AI will exist in your job, but whether you know how to use it.





At ClaimScale, AI is embedded into real production workflows. Not demos. Not theory. Not certifications.





You work with AI every day as part of your actual role, learning how modern teams combine human judgment with automation to deliver high-quality output at scale.





We are a U.S.-based insurance services and technology company with a full production team in the Philippines, operating on Philippine daytime hours in a full-time, remote model.





What This Role Is





This is a full-time production role inside a U.S. insurance operation.





You will be trained to support real property and catastrophe claims using structured systems, modern tools, and AI-assisted workflows. The work is detail-driven, rules-based, and quality-focused. Accuracy and consistency matter more than speed early on.





This role is designed for people who work well independently, follow clear systems, and want to build durable skills in a modern, AI-enabled work environment.





No prior insurance experience is required. Training is provided.





Why ClaimScale?



Philippine daytime schedule

Full-time, work anywhere

Paid training (4–6 months)

AI-forward environment with daily hands-on exposure

Stable demand

Growing U.S. startup with a Philippines-based core team

Team culture matters: we invest in in-person team activities and company trips when operationally viable, as part of building a long-term team 



This is not casual remote work. It is structured operational work inside a specialized industry.



Compensation (USD)



During training: $500+/month

Post-training: $600+/month

Long-term, high performers: $800+/month and above

Compensation progression is performance-based and tied to quality and throughput.



Application Process

Complete an initial online application form. 



ClaimScale LLC

U.S. insurance services. Real operations. AI as a tool, not a buzzword.

title: ServiceNow Developer - PH

The ServiceNow Developer will support ongoing ServiceNow continuous improvement projects of existing ServiceNow implementation for an enterprise. -provide subject matter expertise for ServiceNow for the enterprise

-perform other duties assigned related to the role



REQUIREMENTS



On day one, we'll expect you to...



-have 3+ years of IT service operations experience with a minimum of 1+ years as a ServiceNow Developer at a large company

-have 2+ years of relevant experience with implementing ServiceNow solutions

-have excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to create compelling materials for technical and executive audiences

-be experienced in planning and implementing integrations between ServiceNow and other systems, guiding developers or engineers, and providing alternative analysis and recommendations

-have end-to-end infrastructure lifecycle experience from “chip to chiller” inclusive of servers, storage, data centers, databases, middleware, and web/application environments

-have proven ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment

-have demonstrated ability to assess customer/client needs, creatively approach solutions, d
, and influence appropriate courses of action

-Ability to understand and communicate the lifecycle of technologies and applications and to translate them into business strategies for client organizations

-have experience in working with multi-vendor development environment

-have strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making capabilities.

-be able to accomplish results through others, particularly by establishing relationships, effective controls, and leading in a managed service environment

title: API Integration Developer/Engineer
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE:



The API Integration Developer/Engineer will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining scalable and secure integrations with public APIs across various technology partners. This role plays a key part in ensuring seamless data exchange and interoperability between internal systems and external platforms. The ideal candidate is experienced, detail-oriented, and skilled in building efficient API solutions that enhance system connectivity and overall performance.



RESPONSIBILITIES:

In this role, you'll get to...



- design, build, and deploy high-quality, scalable API integrations using REST, GraphQL, or other relevant protocols

- work closely with our technology partners to understand their API capabilities and limitations, gathering requirements and translating them into technical specifications

- implement the complete integration lifecycle, including discovery, development, testing, deployment, and ongoing maintenance

- implement and enforce security measures, including authentication protocols like OAuth2, to protect data during transmission.

- monitor and troubleshoot integration performance issues, such as bottlenecks, and implement caching strategies to optimize efficiency

- manage data transformation and ensure consistent and secure data flow between our internal systems and partner platforms

- create and maintain clear, comprehensive technical documentation for all integrations



REQUIREMENTS:

On day one, we'll expect you to ...



- proven experience as a software developer with a focus on API development and integration

- strong programming skills in languages commonly used for integrations, such as Python, Java, or JavaScript

- deep understanding of web service protocols, including RESTful APIs and modern API architectures.

- experience with API security practices (e.g., OAuth2, JWT, API keys)

- familiarity with API testing tools, such as Postman or Swagger

- proficiency with version control tools like Git

- experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP is a plus

- excellent problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills

- have a fully functional and up-to-date computer with which to perform duties

- be willing to install next generation end point protection on the computer

- be a current resident of the Philippines and can perform work from there

- be willing to work in US Pacific business hours (8am-5pm PST which corresponds to 12am-9am PH time, if not DST)



What separates the best from the rest

- knowledge of specific integration tools or platforms (e.g., MuleSoft, Zapier, AirByte, Estuary)

- experience with serverless architecture.

- experience with containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)

- familiarity with event-driven architecture and asynchronous messaging

We are seeking a highly creative, trend-savvy, and strategic Social Media Manager & Content Creator to elevate our digital presence across multiple platforms. The ideal candidate understands the culture and compliance landscape surrounding THC beverages, Daiquiris, Nicotine Vapes, and Nicotine Pouches, and knows how to market responsibly and effectively within platform guidelines.



This role requires someone who can develop engaging content, build brand awareness, drive traffic, and increase conversions — all while maintaining compliance with industry regulations and social media policies.



Key Responsibilities

Content Strategy & Creation



Develop and execute a comprehensive social media strategy aligned with brand goals.



Create engaging content including short-form video (Reels, TikToks), graphics, photography, captions, and stories.



Plan and manage a monthly content calendar.



Produce promotional campaigns for product launches, seasonal specials, and in-store activations.



Capture and edit high-quality lifestyle content showcasing THC drinks, daiquiris, vape products, and nicotine pouches in a compliant and brand-aligned manner.



Platform Management



Manage and grow accounts across Instagram, TikTok,
, X, YouTube Shorts, and emerging platforms.



Monitor trends, sounds, hashtags, and viral content opportunities.



Engage with followers, respond to DMs/comments, and foster online community growth.



Implement platform-specific growth strategies tailored to regulated products.



Industry Knowledge & Compliance



Understand marketing restrictions and advertising guidelines for THC and nicotine-related products.



Ensure all content complies with state regulations and social media platform policies.



Stay informed on evolving laws, compliance updates, and digital advertising rules within these industries.



Analytics & Performance Optimization



Track KPIs including engagement rate, reach, impressions, follower growth, CTR, and conversions.



Provide weekly and monthly performance reports with insights and optimization recommendations.



A/B test creative approaches and campaigns.



Brand Building



Maintain consistent brand voice and visual identity.



Develop influencer and UGC strategies.



Support promotions, franchise marketing initiatives, and new product rollouts.



Required Qualifications



2+ years of experience in social media management and content creation.



Demonstrated experience marketing regulated products (THC, alcohol, vape, nicotine, or similar industries preferred).



Strong knowledge of Instagram, TikTok,
, and emerging social platforms.



Video editing skills (CapCut, Adobe Premiere, Final Cut, etc.).



Graphic design skills (Canva, Adobe Suite).



Understanding of age-restricted marketing compliance.



Ability to work U.S. Central Standard Time (CST) hours.



Excellent copywriting and storytelling skills.



Comfortable working in a fast-paced, trend-driven environment.



Preferred Qualifications



Experience in beverage, nightlife, franchise, or retail marketing.



Familiarity with paid social advertising in regulated industries.



Experience working with influencers and brand ambassadors.



Photography and short-form video production experience.



Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)



Engagement rate growth



Follower growth month-over-month



Video views and reach



Website traffic from social platforms



Campaign ROI



Lead generation or store traffic increase



Community response time



Success in This Role Looks Like:



Creating viral, high-converting content while remaining compliant.



Building a strong, engaged community.



Increasing brand visibility across multiple markets.



Driving measurable growth in sales and awareness.

title: Content Marketing
description:
We are looking for a creative Content Marketing VA to post deals in a way that feels exciting, engaging, and marketable - not just copy/paste.



This role is for someone who understands how to frame offers, write hooks, and make promotions feel irresistible.



If you only follow instructions step-by-step, this is NOT the right job.

If you enjoy thinking of new angles and marketing ideas, keep reading.



Responsibilities:

• Turn deals into engaging promotional posts

• Write headlines and captions that attract clicks

• Format posts for social media or

• Suggest creative angles to improve conversions

• Help test different promo styles



Skills we want:

• Copywriting or marketing experience

• Understanding of urgency and offer framing

• Creative thinking

• Basic Canva or visual skills (bonus)

• Social media or ecommerce experience (bonus)



To apply, answer these questions:



How would you promote a 30% discount to make it feel exciting?



Write 3 headlines for: “Wireless headphones 40% off today only”



What makes a deal post boring vs engaging?



We are looking for someone long-term who wants to grow with us.

Pay depends on skill and creativity.

title: Remote Executive + Legal Administrative Assistant (Clio, Calendaring, Attorney Workflow)
description:
Job Type: Full-Time



Work Hours: Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM Pacific Time, with a 1-hour break



Salary: $1,000



Job Overview: 



We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Remote Executive + Administrative Assistant to support a fast-paced legal team by managing executive and personal priorities for the Managing Partner while also providing administrative and operational support across the firm. This role focuses on calendar and deadline management, workflow coordination, inbox and communication support, and maintaining accurate matters, tasks, and billing workflows in Clio. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, reliable, and comfortable balancing shifting priorities while keeping executives and attorneys organized, informed, and on schedule in a remote environment.



Key Responsibilities:



Executive + Personal Support



Manage the Managing Partner’s calendar, including scheduling, confirmations, reminders, priority planning, and personal/family obligations

Coordinate personal logistics such as appointments, travel planning, reservations, and vendor coordination

Draft and send
s and messages; track responses and follow up as needed

Organize inbox priorities and handle confidential information with discretion

Firm Operations + Legal Administrative Support 



Maintain firm and attorney calendars and deadlines

Update matters, tasks, notes, and contacts in Clio to ensure workflows remain accurate and current

Assist with billing coordination in Clio, including time entry tracking and task follow-ups

Attend meetings and calls, take detailed notes, and convert them into actionable task lists

Track assignments across the team and follow through to completion

Support document preparation, including formatting, templates, and correspondence drafts

Required Skills & Qualifications:



Minimum of 2 years’ experience as a Remote Administrative Assistant, Executive Assistant, or Office Coordinator

Strong calendaring and scheduling skills across multiple calendars with shifting priorities

Excellent written communication, proofreading skills, and attention to detail

Comfort with Clio, Google Workspace, Microsoft Office, Zoom/Teams, 
, and the ability to learn new systems quickly

Reliable availability during PST business hours

Quiet home workspace, reliable computer, and high-speed internet

Note: An NBI or police clearance will be required upon acceptance of the job offer.

title: Virtual Marketing Assistant (E-commerce)
description:
We’re a fast-growing, woman-owned Australian e-commerce brand looking for a highly capable Virtual Marketing Assistant to support day-to-day marketing execution and light personal assistant tasks.



This is not just an admin role.

You will be working directly with the founder and playing a key role in
 marketing, Shopify management, social media execution, and customer experience.



If you love marketing, are proactive, detail-oriented, and thrive in a fast-paced online business, we’d love to meet you.



About Us



We are a woman-owned Australian e-commerce brand in the wellness space, focused on creating premium products and meaningful customer experiences. Our work blends strategy, creativity, and high standards, and we’re looking for someone who values health and personal growth.



Core Responsibilities



 Marketing (Klaviyo – Essential)

 • Create and schedule
 campaigns in Klaviyo

 • Build and optimise automated flows (welcome, abandoned cart, post-purchase, etc.)

 • Segment audiences and manage lists

 • Track performance and suggest improvements



Shopify & E-commerce Management (Essential)

 • Upload and optimise products

 • Update website content

 • Assist with landing pages

 • Support backend setup (apps, bundles, subscriptions, etc.)

 • Understand basic conversion optimisation principles



Social Media Marketing (Essential)

 • Schedule and manage social media posts

 • Repurpose content across platforms

 • Assist with content planning

 • Engage with community (comments & DMs)

 • Track performance metrics



Customer Service (Essential)

 • Respond to customer
s professionally and promptly

 • Handle order inquiries, returns, and product questions

 • Maintain a high standard of brand voice and care



Video & AI Tools (Preferred but Highly Valued)

 • Basic video editing for Reels/TikTok

 • Experience using AI tools for marketing and content creation

 • Repurposing long-form content into short-form video using AI



Virtual Assistant Support

 • Calendar and inbox management (light)

 • Task coordination

 • General admin support as required



Required Experience & Skills

 • Proven experience with Klaviyo (must provide examples)

 • Strong experience with Shopify e-commerce

 • Social media marketing & scheduling tools

 • Customer service experience (e-commerce preferred)

 • Fluent written and spoken English

 • High attention to detail

 • Proactive problem solver

 • Strong organisational skills

 • Reliable internet connection

 • Comfortable working independently



What We’re Looking For

 • Someone who takes ownership, not just instructions

 • A growth mindset and willingness to learn

 • Comfortable receiving feedback

 • Willing to undergo training (paid) to align with our systems and standards

 • Long-term mindset (we value loyalty and growth)



???? Role Details

 • Remote position (Philippines-based applicants preferred)

 • Paid training provided

 • Competitive salary based on experience

 • Potential for long-term growth within the company



To Apply



Please include:

 1. Your resume

 2. Examples of Klaviyo campaigns or flows you’ve built

 3. Shopify stores you’ve worked on

 4. Social media accounts you’ve managed

 5. A short paragraph on why you’d be a great fit
